story:
explanation of the goal

We really need very little bit money, but the minimum goal of indiegogo is 500 USD -w-


 

 

The project is almost finished and only one thing lack to publish. We made a small kickstarter in May and gather te goal and we continued the development, now, close to finish, some problems arose. We really need gather the goal to expand, detail and finish a better game.

Q-yo Blaster takes elements from classics shootemups like Aero Fighters, Prehistoric Isle, some bullet hell like Dodonpachi or Ikaruga and little from Metal Slug.

 

  • Unique and animated stages
  • Beauty pixel graphics
  • Quick and frenetic action
  • Spectacular special powers and big monsters
  • Creative characters and enemies
  • Weapons and power ups
  • many fluid animations

TEAM

(click on the image)

Q-yo blaster will be released, it is a fact, but with your support we will do better and without mishaps. 

The only risk is that it changes its policy or natural hazards (earthquakes)

story:
English Français

To get an idea about the game, a demo is available:

the First Contact

Cubot is a simple and addictive puzzle game in which the player must move color cubes towards tiles of the same color. If you have multiple cubes, they move simultaneously!

an Easy Gameplay

One finger is enough to move the cube where you want...that's it!

Simplistic but not Repetitive

Several concepts are used to diversify puzzles but also to make them more complex. Like color cubes with different capacities or elements (buttons, elevators, color swappers, teleporters…)

Clean and Pure

The game and menus have a clean look to not disturb your concentration. In the same vein, the music is very soothing.

Several Hours of Play

There are 80 levels in the game for several hours of playtime to keep you challenged.

Challenging but Possible

The challenge increases level by level. If you are stumped, help is available!

There is no difference between Mobile and Desktop version, excepting controls. The Mobile version used touch contols while the Desktop version it plays with keyboard, mouse or pad (360 ou PS3).

Until now, the development of Cubot has been realizing on our own funds. Cubot is already released on Android and Win/Mac/Linux port is well advanced. So why start a Indiegogo project?

The goal is to help to complete the necessary budget to :

  • Finish the Win/Mac/Linux, iOs and WP8 portages
  • Purchase software licenses
  • Purchase software development kits‎ (iOs, WP8, …)

English Français

Pour se faire une idée sur le jeu, une démo est disponible :

Premier Contact

Cubot est un puzzle-game simple et addictif dans lequel il faut placer différents cubes de couleur sur des cases ayant une couleur identique. La particularité du jeu est que si plusieurs cubes sont présents sur l’espace de jeu ils bougent simultanément !

un gameplay très simple

Un seul doigt suffit pour déplacer le cube où l'on souhaite et ... c'est tout !

Simpliste mais pas répétitif

Plusieurs concepts sont utilisés pour diversifier les énigmes mais aussi les complexifier. Cela va des cubes ayant des capacités différentes à des objets parsemant les niveaux (bouton, ascenseur, échangeur de couleur, télé-porteur, ...)

Sobre et Propre

Le jeu et les menus affichent un look très sobre ainsi qu'une musique reposante pour ne pas perturber votre réflexion.

Plusieurs Heures de Jeu

Le jeu contient 80 niveaux qui vous garderont en haleine pendant plusieurs heures.

Difficile mais Possible

Un défi difficile mais possible qui augmente niveau par niveau. Et si jamais vous êtes bloqué, il sera possible d’avoir recours à une aide.

Il n'y a pas de différence entre les versions Mobile et Desktop, à part les contrôles. La version Mobile utilise des contrôles tactiles alors que la version Desktop se joue au clavier, à la souris ou au pad (360 ou PS3).

Jusqu’à présent, le dévellopement de Cubot a été réalisé sur nos fonds propres. La version Android du jeu est déja sortie et le portage Win/Mac/Linux est bien avancé, alors pourquoi lancer un projet sur Indiegogo ?

L'objectif est d’aider à compléter le budget nécessaire pour :

  • Finir les portages Win/Mac/Linux ainsi qu'iOs et WP8
  • L’achat de licences de logiciel
  • L’achat des kits de développement (iOs, WP8, ...)

story:
Short summary:

Are you missing money bills in your favorite board/card game? Are you bored with your old set of money bills? Do you have an idea for an original set of money bills? Do you need money bills designed specific for your game?

  The Repleacles - Money is your perfect answer. This project is dedicated to solve these problems and much more. By helping this project not only that you get printable replaceable alternatives in PDF format for your gaming money (in 1, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500 bills), but you also encourage us to continue developing our ideas.



Why Repleacles – Money?

The Replaceables – Money sets are very affordable, easy accessible and immediately available for those that lack original money in their board/card game or for those that would like to have a unique solution and want it as soon as possible. The process is simple. All you need to do is to download sets in PDF format, print them on any type of paper, cut them out and you are ready to continue playing your favorite game.




Stretch Goals


$500 stretch goal  - includes 3 sets: basic, futuristic and fantasy. Example:

$1500 stretch goal  -On this goal level we plan to create another 3 sets,



$7500 stretch goal  -  If we reach this goal, we will create a web interface for easy customization of the bills.




Reward levels

 

 get all default sets (including sets created in second stretch goal) in PDF format

Example:

 
 

 include $5 reward + 1 customizable basic set in PDF format

Example:

 
 

 include $5 reward + create your own unique money set in PDF format

Example:


Want to help us?

Spread the word about our project so we can contribute table top games community.


About us

  Djordje Milijanovic - Illustrator

  Milan Vlajnic - Philosopher, Philanthropist, Genius and the father

  Spiro Djurdjevic – Idea maker, Intuitive brainiac, family guy with a big heart

  Nenad Peric - IT consultant and a resident geek

story:
This will explain everything

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Np1MoE3utE

Can I have some quick bullet points about the project?

  • A loving parody of the middle school experience.
  • A point n' click adventure for Mac/PC, and if we get far enough based our initial goal IOS/Android too. (Probably Linux also, but that's not a matter of money, just whether or not the engine let's us port it.)
  • Multiple approaches to any given puzzle. 
  • Moral choices based around actions.
  • Wacky story based around Masahiro Sakurai's work.
  • A large amount of dialogue and puzzles based around absurd insults.
  • Genre-bending boss battles.
  • A leveling system based around status rather than power.
  • Diverse soundtrack, grounded in classic rock.  

What is Yen Yurki?

Yen Yurki is an adventure game based around the absurd logic of bullies. You may be told something like "This guy thinks he's captain Knots, captain tying knots, when everyone needs their knots tied they go to him, no way." And then later on in a puzzle, you'll have to put on a captain hat and tie someone's knots so that you can get to your next class and solve another absurd puzzle.

But if you've ever played an adventure game you'd think this was an absurd proposition, to make an adventure game with absurd items and absurd rules? No way! Get real!

But the game will be less mind-numbing than you might expect, everything that you can actually click on will be in pixelated to offer a contrast and distinction between what you can and can't use, you won't have to click everywhere to find your ropes and captain hat, it will be in plain sight. 

As for the absurd puzzles, you will continually be insulted throughout the game  but that's actually a  jumbled version of your objective.

Of course this is not the only type of puzzle, if it was the game would easily get dull and would require little brain-power. However, you'll usually be presented with 2 or more puzzles at once, (action trees) with this style being among them. 

The game is also based around the idea of moral choices with a silent protagonist. There will be a lot of choices and options based purely on how you complete a puzzle. The other characters will talk to you differently and let you go to different areas all depending on whether or not you "used x on y, rather than x on z." or if you "combine x with y and than use it on z." This will add a lot of variety to every possible play through. 

Action trees?

Maybe we should have done said that first... 

In addition to the subtle details that will change in the game based on minor things that you do throughout the game. We are also planing to include something we like to call "action trees." 

Action trees are a more active approach to dialogue trees, instead of during a conversation deciding whether to be good, bad, or neutral you'd be deciding whether to get through a door by, using a key, a camel's toe or punching it in the face. This is a fine example of the "logical, aggressive, and Sierra" system we will be using most of the time (meaning that during some scenarios there may be more) for the puzzle options.

Logical: The logical way of solving puzzles are probably what you expect, you solve a puzzle how you might solve it in real life, or in some cases a well made adventure game. How do you get passed the guard and get into the building? You distract the guard by convincing the man next to him to act like he's about to break in, then you use the key you inexplicably had from earlier. You know, how you would in real life. 

Sierra: The Sierra way of solving puzzles are probably what you'd expect... from an old Sierra game or terrible flash game. How do you get passed the guard and get into the building? You stick the old camel toe into your left ear, while the man next to you sticks a golden plate to his head, drinks goat milk and tosses you a crow bar to get through the door. (The key was a red herring.) This is the kind of puzzle you'll be trained to understand in the beginning through the riddles that Sir. Huntington uses to insult you early on (remember the captain knots metaphor from the beginning?) But be warned, these aren't always instructed, you're gonna have to get creative. Note: you can still go about any other way of solving a puzzle even when a Sierra one is instructed

Aggressive: The aggressive way of solving puzzles is along the lines of what you'd expect from a renegade option in Mass Effect. How do you get passed the guard to get into the building? Punch the guard in his stupid face! This is more or less your handicap. However, it will usually come back to bite you by the end. Later on you'll come across a really difficult puzzle, with no aggressive option and no hints. Also, you'll usually need to go through other minor puzzles to even be able to initiate the aggressive puzzle. So, you'll have to get the leather in room 1, and an old glove in room 2, and then combine the two items to make a boxing glove. Then later on, you put the glove on Hungre Jack then click on the guard to punch him in the stupid face. However, later on  because you punched the guard in the stupid face, you have to solve a more difficult puzzle. Is any of this getting to you?

So why My Money? And how will it be used?

Let's get the first question out of the way first: 

If two kids walked into your office and said " We want to make an adventure game with absurd logic, and we want to design the puzzle and story on our own." Would you take them seriously? Exactly. 

As for the money's purpose: we're asking for the bare minimum to get the software we'll need to make the game as great as possible, and also to set up a modest website for the game, so on and so forth. The further we get past our goal, the more we can do. We can make ports to IOS and Android (whichever has more demand when we reach the appropriate milestone. Said milestones will be announced when/if we surpass our original goal.) If we get enough, we may also be able to translate the game into other languages, so on and so forth, if we have more money than we can forcefully push back in. That money will probably go into ports for other devices like Linux and XBLA post launch, or free DLC.

What makes the game unique?

There are a lot of quirky attributes to this game that make it interesting.

One of the most significant ones is the boss battles, you don't typically see boss battles in a point n' click adventure game. There are going to be a whole bunch of boss battles that cycle through different genres, like Shmup, to RPG, to platformer, and something we never see; a point n' click boss battle. 

Also there will be a leveling system. You gain levels by finding dialogue using the word ____, doing things off the beaten path, and so on and so forth. Leveling up may change how people talk to you, change what is accessible, or change the games ending. So it will be very important to do everything you can in the game. 

As we mentioned before, the items and NPCs will stand out from the backgrounds through the use of different art styles, but there will also be a lot of cutscene variety that takes advantage of that stylization. We're going with a unique style as far as cutscenes are concerned, every cutscene that isn't made with in game graphics will have pixelated characters over a digitized real world background, it's hard to explain, but imagine a Sega CD cutscene with the people replaced with 8-bit characters. (It's easier to see in the video.)

It's also very important to know that virtually all of the antagonist dialogue are actually insults that have been used against us, like "ge'in hungi" (as in getting hungry.) and "gen jerky" (I know as well as you do.) Also the story will be loosely based on the troops of Masahiro Sakurai's work.

Tell me about the game's characters?

You play as Hungre Jack (yes, that was a real insult) a silent protagonist and a victim to bullies, like Sir. Huntington and Julinavi.

Sir. Huntington is the game's main antagonist, he's a giant gooey blob with tiny arms and giant tentacle legs. He more or less takes the role of the Riddler, most of the insults/puzzles will come out of him.

Julinavi is somewhere between an antagonist, and a guide. He constantly insults you, yet he's helping you because it reminds you to stay on task, and let's you know what you're supposed to do. Definitely a unique character. 

So how do I know you won't spend the money on candy?

We have created a very specific list of what we will do with the money when we reach specific goals, additionally my parents will be reviewing our list to make sure we're using the money wisely, and it will also be in her bank account to make sure we're using it wisely, you can rest assured the money won't be spent on candy.

Please give generously, and check out the rewards, we've got some really neat stuff to give.

And if you have any questions or concerns, feel free to message us at YenYurki@gmail.com

Also here are some things credible people have said about us.

story:
A new way to play board games. There is no order of turns between players. Each player can perform his character's actions simultaneously with other characters, or after one character finishes their actions. Our game board is different from most of the boards in other games, because we are trying to give the players a totally different board game experience. By taking the good visualization that exists in many miniature war games, we hope that our board will inspire even more different ways to play.

Stretch Goal 50,000$: ???

Stretch Goal 100,000$: ???

Stretch Goal 150,000$: ???

A new way to play board games. There is no order of turns between players. Each player can perform his character's actions simultaneously with other characters, or after one character finishes their actions. Our game board is different from most of the boards in other games, because we are trying to give the players a totally different board game experience. By taking the good visualization that exists in many miniature war games, we hope that our board will inspire even more different ways to play.

story:
Active Soccer

Active Soccer is a cool retro football game inspired by all time classics like Kick Off 2 and Sensible Soccer.
Another retro arcade football game? Yes, but Active Soccer brings us back to the '90s good old days, the game is developed by Gianluca Troiano (Kick Off 2 World Champion) and the soundtrack is produced by the Legend Chris Huelsbeck!!!
What?!? Chris Huelsbeck??? Yes Chris Huelsbeck, the author of Turrican series, X-Out, The Great Giana Sisters, Apydia and many other titles, has produced Active Soccer soundtrack.
What are you waiting for? Active Soccer already hit 1st place as top paid sports game on Google Play Store!!!

Features

Active Soccer is the first cross platform online football game ever. It provides a world ranking where people can play independtly from their device. It could be an iPhone, an iPad, an Android device, a Black Berry 10 or even Windows 8 Phone. This really doesn't matter, you just need Active Soccer to play.

- Classic gameplay
- 360 degrees movements
- Total control of the game
- Exciting online multiplayer match
- Choose your preferred player and climb up the international ranking
- Compete in the world cup and try to prevail
- Draw the most effective tactic on the pitch and win
- Practice with free kicks and penalties
- 3D game engine
- Soundtrack created by Chris Huelsbeck (Turrican, Jim Power, The Great Giana Sisters, X-Out and many other titles)
- Amazing fun!

 

Why do you need money?

We need money because we are running out of resources. We need money for porting the game to PC Windows desktop and Mac OSX

 

Do you provide a demo?

We can't provide a demo, but the game is already released for iOS and Android. We strongly suggest to try Active Soccer on your mobile phones before funding the PC and Mac OS version.

 

 

I already have Active Soccer on my phone/tablet, why should i fund it?

Pc and Mac OS will be a different and more enjoyable experience. The game is designed to be played with a retro joystick (C=64 / Amiga adaptor will work) or a 360 degrees gamepad. PC and Mac OS version will provide high detailed graphics, footballers and stadium and you can play at full 60fps (mobile version runs at 30fps)!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can buy mobile version and spread the word!
Active Soccer be ready for the revolution!
 

Future scenarios

If Active Soccer will achieve enough success we will develop a career mode, a mix in between Sensible World of Soccer and Player Manager, we already have the game design.
 
 
Enjoy Active Soccer!

story:
Update 6 - Stretch Goal?

10 days left to go and 42% of the campaign goal covered. If you're out there, NOW is the time to contribute!

According to the poll, about 60 people said they wanted a Modular Gaming Table if the price was right. 3 of them bought a table. This leaves us with 57 prospects. Obviously, for them the price is not right.

I did my best to lower the price as much a possible. I'm in the position to buy the materials at a discount, I got access to the machinery and know-how to work with the materials. Believe me, the current price is at its minimum. To give you an idea, making a table like this at a local welder will cost you about 800 - 900 euros.

However, there's another way to lower the price, but this requires an investment of about 3000,- euros. The investment involves the development of a plastic connection bar. Something similiar to the one below. The new connection bar not only reduces material and labor costs, but also improves overall stability and weight capacity considerably.

 

Early adopters of a MGT set buy a table, but more importantly they contribute to the further development of the table. Furthermore, early adopters will receive future upgrades like the new connection bar above for free.

I'm willing to invest if the campaign succeeds, but are you willing to contribute?

Update 5 - Going Live!

I thought about making a video before and I probably should have made one at the beginning of the MGT campaign, but I didn't, until now. What better way to demonstrate the table, than to simple show.

I made three videos in total. One showing the construction of a 2x3 setup, one showing the deconstruction and another one showing the construction of the storage setup. I'm also demonstrating my personal gaming boards both in the table and storage video. Enjoy!

Note: the gaming boards are NOT included and are intended for demonstration purposes only.

Video 1 - 2x3 table (construction)

Video 2 - 2x3 table (deconstruction)

Video 3 - storage (construction)

Update 4 - Examples

So, you want a MGT set, but can't really decide yet? Let me show you what one MGT set gives you in terms of table configurations, besides what has already been demonstrated.

1.

 2.

 3.

4.

5.

Having two MGT sets opens up a whole set of configurations. One of such is the "star" configuration shown below.

Update 3 - International Shipping:

For the past few days I've been receiving questions about International Shipping rates. Even though the world seems more connected than ever, sending a package around world without selling your kidney is not as easy as it seems. Especially when the package falls outside the maximum allowed size restrictions.

However, there is still hope! There are still companies offering reasonable shipping rates with flexible size restrictions. Therefore, I can now offer a fixed shipping fee for shipment to the USA. I've added a new perk for shipment to the USA.

Please contact me if you desire to know your International Shipping fee and I'll do my best to find the best deal.

Update 2 - WAF:

It seems like the campaign is starting to take off. Many thanks for your contributions. This leaves us with only 6 more tables to go!

Some might have noticed a difference in the legs on the pictures shown on the blog or on the gallery section of the campaign website. This is due to some improvements that have been applied after the prototype table was made. The new version has adjustable legs while the prototype table has static legs. The picture above shows both versions side-by-side.

So why the need for adjustable legs? First, the adjustable legs are lighter, have lower production costs and are removable for easy packaging. Secondly, the legs adjust themselves to uneven floors for stable footing. Thirdly, they are required when combining multiple MGT sets together to form one table.

Let me elaborate the last statement. We know the table has a slight downcurve due to the 1 mm space margin between each connection point. The longer the table, the bigger the downcurve. When combining two or more tables together to form one big table, you have four extra legs at your disposal. These extra four legs are used to give extra support to the table. See the picture below.

You need adjustable legs to span the distance without disturbing the downcurve, otherwise you get a "telephone line" effect which might push the gameboards apart from each other. Adjusting the outer legs at a higher level and the inner legs at a lower level, prevents the "telephone line" effect from happening.

The leg consists out of three components. The aluminium bar, a metal-threaded insert and a standard machine feet. All of which are easily replaceable when damaged.

Update 1 - 3D Gaming:

My first update is about 3D gaming. I wrote about this a bit in the post Modular Gaming Table: Part 11. At the time I demonstrated the table in a 2x2 layered configuration. Not particularly the ideal setup when playing in 3D, because you wouldn't be able to reach all parts of the table. This post will demonstrate a configuration better suited for 3D gaming.

The pictures below show two two-layered configuration types which can be made from one MGT set. Both players can stand at either side of the table and still be able to reach all parts. The table can represent a variety of things like a dungeon, space hulk, building or an underground complex. Obviously my boards don't represent any one of these and specific boards must be made for that.

I hope this demonstrates some of the possibilities, enough to spark your imagination?

Introduction

My name is Alex Koning, I'm 32 years old and I live with my familiy in the Netherlands. At the start of 2012 I designed and developed a Modular Gaming Table. Enthusiastic reactions inspired me to look for ways to make it available to others.

What's a Modular Gaming Table?

It's a configurable table with four or more legs consisting out of separable 2'x2' sections.

The table is designed to support (modular) gaming boards, but can be used for a variety of things;

The table is configurable and can be endlessly expanded, to form up an array of table configurations.

The table has two modes:

  • table mode
  • storage mode

This campaign is not about the development of the table, but getting it to your doorstep as cheap as possible!

The table has already proven itself to work. An in depth explanation of the Modular Gaming Table series can be found on my personal blog.

The gallery section shows some pictures of the prototype table. These pictures were taken during the development and differ slightly from the actual table.

Please take a look at the instruction manual or videos to get a detailed description on how to setup a MGT.

  • Instruction manual - table mode
  • Instruction manual - storage mode
  • Demonstration video - 2x3 table (construction)
  • Demonstration video - 2x3 table (deconstruction)
  • Demonstration video - storage (construction)

Why a Modular Gaming Table?

Safe space: to store the table when it's not needed

Protection: to protect and to safely store your (modular) gaming boards

Mobility: to take the table along to gaming clubs or friends

Configurability: to setup and configure various table sizes

3D-gaming: to make multi-level gaming a reality!

What I Need & What You Get

I need an order of at least 10 MGT sets to offer the table at the mentioned price. All contributions are refunded if I fail to meet this goal. Production starts when the campaign ends and the goal has been reached.

Perks are divided into two types: standard and double perks. A standard perk gives you one MGT set and a double perk gives you two MGT sets.

A MGT set contains the following:

  • 2x frame type A
  • 4x frame type B
  • 4x table legs
  • 4x short connection bars
  • 20x long connection bars
  • 8x support bars
  • 16x extra canoe-clips
  • 1x instruction manual

One MGT set allows you to setup a table between 2'x2' and 4'x6' feet.

NOTE: Gaming boards shown on the pictures are NOT included!

All orders are expected to be shipped by the end of November 2013.

Packaging & Shipment

Each MGT set will be bubble wrap packed in a 65x30x65cm cardboard box and weighs about 11Kg.

Perks are sub-divided into three zones for shipment to countries inside the EU. These are: EU1, EU2 and EU3. Below you can see a list of countries for each zone.

Shipments within the Netherlands are free of charge.

EU1

Belgium, Denmark, Germany, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Austria, Spain, United Kingdom & Sweden

EU2

Bulgaria, Estonia, Finland, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia, Slovakia & Czechia

EU3

Albania, Andorra, Bosnia-Hercegovina, Canary Islands, Cyprus, Faroe Islands, Gibraltar, Greece, Greenland, Iceland, Channel Islands, Kosovo, Croatia, Liechtenstein, Macedonia, Malta, Moldavia, Montenegro, Norway, Ukraine, San Marino, Serbia, Turkey, Vatican City, White Russia & Switzerland

World

Please contact me for international shipping fees. Due to size and weight restrictions, shipping fees varies by country.

Specifications

Below some technical specifications of the table:

  • Material: Aluminium
  • Coating: Powder Coating
  • Total weight: 10 Kg
  • Min/max table height: 79/86 cm
  • Frame size: 61x61 cm (2'x2' feet)
  • Safe maximum weight: 21 Kg *
  • Downcurve without boards: 6/7 mm **
  • Downcurve with 3,5 Kg boards: 14/15 mm **
  • Table stability: 5 mm ***
  • Max height between frames (storage mode): 11 cm

*) The maximum weight is tested on a 2x3 configuration with six boards each weighing 3,5 Kg. The actual maximum weight has not been tested and might easily exceed 21 Kg.

**) Between each connection bar and frame there's 1 mm of movement space. This causes the table to bend downwards. A 2x3 table setup without boards has a downcurve of 6/7 mm measured from the centre and 14/15 mm with six 3,5 Kg boards.

***) Between each connection bar and frame there's 1 mm of movement space. This causes the table to move a little. The table has a 5 mm movement margin in all directions.

I need your help!

To be successful in this campaign, it need to be relayed in as many places as possible. For this to happen I am counting on your assistance spreading the word.

Even if you do not have any direct interest in a MGT, or if you cannot afford to support the project financially, it will be greatly appreciated that you spread the word (on your blogs, on forums, everywhere you may see fit, but please no spam!)

This project could be the beginning of, a stable production of MGT's.

Have you got any questions?

I'm here to help if you have any questions. You can contact me at: mgt@dreamfish.nl

story:
What are SELF Bands™?

SELF Bands are high quality wristbands that can help you when you're trying to make/break habits. Each band is engraved with the phrase "NULLAE EXCUSATIONES"™ on the front, which means "NO EXCUSES" in Latin, to help motivate you.

How does it work?
You unlock different SELF Bands (like achievements or equipment in a game) by increasing your habit streak (like leveling up). There are 3 modes.



Something must be wrong with my computer. The pics aren't loading.


Rendered pics

(Each multicolor band will look unique due to the creation process. Example: Your black/yellow band will look different than your friend's black/yellow band.)


How much of a discount do I get for being a backer?

As a backer, you get the packs $5 cheaper than retail prices; this means each band only costs around $4. Also, many different samples were tested for over a year, and these bands were chosen because they are made from very high quality materials that last.

How did Myron Gaines get in shape?

It took Myron a few months of training with his friend Sal Tekh to get in shape.

How much does shipping cost?

Shipping is $5 to the U.S. and $10 internationally. Be aware that international orders may be charged a VAT/customs tax.

Timeline


Contact Information

Contact us if you have any questions or comments. 
  • Comment section
  • Email: supportteam@selfbands.com

Disclaimer

SELF Bands and Miscceo LLC are not physicians, and the above information is not medical advice. SELF Bands and Miscceo LLC are not claiming to cure, treat, diagnose, or prevent an illness or condition. For serious health conditions, like addictions, consult your physician.

story:
Soup: The Game is a micro-strategy experience in which you wage war against opposing microorganisms. It features minimalistic, intuitive controls and great depth of unit interaction.

Ok, maybe it's not the most funded campaign in history :) Thanks to all our backers, your support means a lot to us!

We released it as an Early Access package on Steam, come and get it!

Welcome to the crowdfunding campaign for Soup: The Game! Soup is a 2D micro-strategy game for Windows, Mac and Linux. Soup is being developed by Dewdrop Games, a small team of independent developers. We are seeking your help to elevate the base concept of Soup to a whole new level, and turn it into a complete and awesome game.


Biologists, machines and programmers have been modelling biological systems for many years. We think that it’s about time a video-game got in on the act! This is our unique premise for Soup. We believe that battling agents, with limited interaction types, creates an experience that is bursting with colourful action, yet deceptively strategic.

We have endeavoured to combine two well-known game mechanics: the strategic building and commanding of units coupled with good old competitive battling! Player control input is purposefully limited but extremely tactical. You will need to keep a close eye on the evolving battlefield and make split-second decisions on which units to employ. These decisions can be the difference between triumphant victory and swift defeat. We have already amassed a community of fans who love sharing their strategies and techniques with us. In short, Soup is easy to pick-up-and-play but difficult to master.

At its core, Soup is a player-vs-AI or local multiplayer player-vs-player experience. We don’t plan to limit the fun to just two players simultaneously, however. Strategic microorganism chaos is best shared with others! 

Different playable microorganism species constitute the “factions” or “races” in Soup: The Game. Each has its own unique appearance, special units and abilities to enjoy. The three core species are:

Bacteria - A form of life that is found in every habitat on Earth, bacteria is omnipresent and harks right back to the history of life itself. Farm to grow and then become the predator to hunt down those who dare to challenge that which is at the core of all life!


Virus - Much mystery surrounds these “organisms at the edge of life”. They have an unclear origin and are the providers of means of horizontal gene transfer for other lifeforms and powerful enemies. With the virus, you harvest and then seek to annihilate whatever opposes you with destructive mines and lethal nuke organisms.

Nanobots - Not all microorganisms are natural. Nanobots are the technology of the future gone rogue, and seek to destroy natural life! They are adept at ruthlessly and efficiently destroying their biological competition, with your instruction. 

The core team of Dewdrop Games recently participated in game development contest LudumDare #34. In just three days, we created from scratch a prototype for a video game that got loads of positive feedback and was simply great fun to play. The idea for Soup was born, but now we’re determined to realize its potential.

At present, we only work on Soup part-time. Actually, our paid jobs don't have to be boring, we know how to find fun stuff to do, but game development is the most absorbing and exciting job of all. With your support, we’ll be able to give it much more of our time and attention. There is so much that we want to add, including new artwork, additional species, more diverse unit behavior, catchy music tracks, and so on!

We have decided to set a modest target, which is just enough to cover what we consider to be Soup’s core features. We want to shoot for the stars, however, and have included many more ambitious features as our stretch goals, detailed below.

We don’t want to just settle with what we’ve outlined so far. We have loads of ideas for cool features that we’d like to add to Soup if we exceed our funding target. So without further ado, here is the list of our stretch goals:

$3,000 - Campaigns

  

Although there will be plenty of strategic, battling action in the base game, we recognise that sometimes you just want to test yourself in a single-player campaign. The campaigns will feature a variety of different situations and progressive difficultly, going from levels where resources are plentiful and enemies scarce, to the ultimate challenge of wrestling control of every cubic micrometre of space from hostiles.

$5,000 - New species and extra music themes

   

Soup will already feature three playable species and have a rollicking soundtrack of between three and five head-bobbing tunes, but we’d really like to be able to add more. If this stretch goal is met, we’ll add some brand new species, each with their own unique units and super-weapons, and also pledge to double the number of music tracks to accompany your battling.

$7,000 - Online multiplayer


Local multiplayer is one of Soup’s features that we’re most excited about. We do recognise, however, that sometimes it’s just not possible to be sitting next to your mates when you eradicate their species! We would therefore love to reach this stretch goal to be able to develop an online multiplayer suite that will allow you to compete in tense battles with a handful of your friends at a time.

$10,000 - Mobile platform support

If we reach this stretch goal, we will port Soup over to mobile platforms, namely Android and iOS. We believe that Soup will be ideal on mobile with reworked touch controls, and will be a perfect fit for a quick battle whilst on-the-go. All existing backers would receive the app if this goal is met.

$14,000 - Gamepad support


Our final stretch goal is ambitious, but one that we’d love to reach. Gamepad support would bring a whole new dimension of gameplay to Soup, giving greater freedom of movement and control precision. In addition to the minimalistic controls, gamepad support would allow control functions such as setting rally points and altering the behaviour of your units.


$1 USD

Special thanks!

You have our eternal thanks. We will provide you with updates on Soup’s development and list you with thanks on our homepage.

$10 USD

Single game pack

Delivery of a single digital copy of Soup: The Game on the platform of your choice and a “Harvester Backer” title in the Contributor Credits.

$12 USD

Early access & art pack

Everything above, plus access to early version of Soup: The Game (digital), a digital art pack to adorn your desktop with, and a “Hunter Backer” title in the Contributor Credits.

$18 USD

Soundtrack pack

Everything above, plus the original soundtrack (digital) for you to dance away to in your kitchen!

$30 USD

4-game pack

Four digital copies of Soup: The Game on the platform of your choice. Your friends will love you!

$50 USD

Open access pack

Everything included in the ‘Soundtrack pack’ tier plus total access to updates on the development process, new art/sketches when completed and nightly builds of the game.

$100 USD

Insider pack

Everything included in the ‘Open access pack’, plus access to invite-only discussions with the developers where daily progress is discussed, and access to exclusive feature voting. Now you’re one of us!

$250 USD

Dominant species pack

Everything included in the ‘Insider pack’, plus we will work with you to name a brand new species of our design! You will also be granted the hallowed title of ‘Nuke backer’ in the Contributor Credits.

$500 USD

Ultimate species pack

You truly dominate the primordial soup! Everything included in the ‘Dominant species pack’, plus we will work with you to design and name a super-weapon unit in your named species.
story_txt:
Soup: The Game is a micro-strategy experience in which you wage war against opposing microorganisms. It features minimalistic, intuitive controls and great depth of unit interaction.



Ok, maybe it's not the most funded campaign in history :) Thanks to all our backers, your support means a lot to us! 
We released it as an Early Access package on Steam, come and get it!Welcome to the crowdfunding campaign for Soup: The Game! Soup is a 2D micro-strategy game for Windows, Mac and Linux. Soup is being developed by Dewdrop Games, a small team of independent developers. We are seeking your help to elevate the base concept of Soup to a whole new level, and turn it into a complete and awesome game.



Biologists, machines and programmers have been modelling biological systems for many years. We think that it’s about time a video-game got in on the act! This is our unique premise for Soup. We believe that battling agents, with limited interaction types, creates an experience that is bursting with colourful action, yet deceptively strategic.
We have endeavoured to combine two well-known game mechanics: the strategic building and commanding of units coupled with good old competitive battling! Player control input is purposefully limited but extremely tactical. You will need to keep a close eye on the evolving battlefield and make split-second decisions on which units to employ. These decisions can be the difference between triumphant victory and swift defeat. We have already amassed a community of fans who love sharing their strategies and techniques with us. In short, Soup is easy to pick-up-and-play but difficult to master.
At its core, Soup is a player-vs-AI or local multiplayer player-vs-player experience. We don’t plan to limit the fun to just two players simultaneously, however. Strategic microorganism chaos is best shared with others!  


Different playable microorganism species constitute the “factions” or “races” in Soup: The Game. Each has its own unique appearance, special units and abilities to enjoy. The three core species are:


Bacteria - A form of life that is found in every habitat on Earth, bacteria is omnipresent and harks right back to the history of life itself. Farm to grow and then become the predator to hunt down those who dare to challenge that which is at the core of all life!




Virus - Much mystery surrounds these “organisms at the edge of life”. They have an unclear origin and are the providers of means of horizontal gene transfer for other lifeforms and powerful enemies. With the virus, you harvest and then seek to annihilate whatever opposes you with destructive mines and lethal nuke organisms.


Nanobots - Not all microorganisms are natural. Nanobots are the technology of the future gone rogue, and seek to destroy natural life! They are adept at ruthlessly and efficiently destroying their biological competition, with your instruction.

story:
Manic Digger is an open source 3d block building game. It's a clone of Minecraft and Ace of Spades games.

Address: http://manicdigger.sourceforge.net/

With your help we could continue making it, and take it to the next level.


Web browser version

With Html5 version it will be possible to play MD directly in web browser, without downloading game or any plugins like Java, Unity, Flash or Silverlight.

Just click a server link and you can join the game in 10 seconds on any computer anywhere.

This greatly reduces barriers to play and should bring many new players.

War mode

War mod can be made even more fun.

  • New weapons: shovel, grenades, stationary machine gun
  • New modes: Capture the flag, Bomb

Fortress mode

These will be made and included with the game:

  • Farming - vegetables and animals
  • Music block
  • Logic circuits
  • Tools
  • Signs
  • Flowing water
  • New blocks
  • Possibly more

Modding

Modding functions will be improved and made easier.

Other

  • Fix gallery website
  • Server administrator panel in web browser - so it's easy to configure own server.

Budget

$1,000 allows for 3-4 months of full-time programming.

Open source

Manic Digger will remain open source and free.

story:
Beach Bounce is a family friendly arcade game targeted towards mobile phones. The game will feature 100 levels with more being added on a regular basis. The game is easy to learn, but tough to master. Each level gets harder as you progress and will challenge your reflexes as well as your puzzle solving abilities. Each level has a unique level and a unique background. Each level is hand detailed to be unique. Beach Bounce includes a dynamic changing weather, from sunrise to sunset to a starry night. The game will never get boring as it constantly surprises you with new changes. 

But I can't do it without advertising. A mobile app cannot be successful without a good advertising campaign and that's why I need your support. I need funding to start an advertising campaign that will let everyone know about this amazing app. 

Every donor will have their name in the official credits of Beach Bounce! 

 

The first 100 $10 donors will have a level named after them.

story:
All that stands between them and the helpless masses of the Victorian Age are the Rippers: a secret society of scholars, warriors, sages, and heroes who battle legendary creatures around the globe.

To Triumph over the likes of werewolves, vampires, mummies, and worse, the Rippers must discover dark magics, collect powerful artifacts, and learn forbidden lore. Some even take the risk of implanting Rippertech: harvesting parts of the creatures they fight and grafting them onto their own bodies to harness the monstrous supernatural powers of their foes. 

Rippers: Rise of the Great One is a turn-based game for PC, Mac, and mobile devices, based on one of the most popular Savage Worlds roleplaying settings, Rippers. Players take the role of Victorian monster hunters, members of the shadowy secret society: the Rippers. 

In Rippers: Rise of the Great One players join the Rippers in a mysterious trek across the globe to far-flung locales, seeking clues to an ancient secret, and battling a host of powerful supernatural enemies.

Rippers: Rise of the Great One is an exciting tactical battle game using the Savage Worlds system. Combining an evil plot that threatens mankind and an ancient malevolent foe, the game presents players with unpredictable plot twists and cunning surprises right up to the last act of the game.


The game has been adapted from the Savage Worlds pen and paper system.  

Players create and manage a group of Rippers in a struggle against evil and powerful monsters. The main focus is on the game turn-based tactical battles, but players must also protect and develop their Rippers' Lodge. This includes the construction of new facilities such as a library or laboratory, recruiting new Rippers, collecting revenue, and undertake combat missions to destroy the agents of the Cabal.

Just as with the pen and paper roleplaying game, Rippers: Rise of the Great One provides the player with a huge range of options for creating and customizing a heroic character. Players choose from a range of archetypes, which they can then customize with Edges and Hindrances, skills and attributes, to ensure that no two characters are quite alike.

Rippertech provides a further opportunity for developing a unique character. These implants and extracts are obtained by pseudo-science from a variety of supernatural creatures found in the game.

In addition to their main character, the player can recruit colleagues to their team of Rippers, equip them with arcane knowledge and gear, and add Rippertech implants to prepare them to fight the hideous beasts they must confront. With skill and planning, the player can select the most suitable band of Rippers and send them to complete specific tasks.

Arrayed against the Rippers are the forces of darkness. The many monsters opposing the hero and his companions ensure fights are exciting and varied, providing a wide choice of possible tactics. Each opponent has certain strengths and weaknesses, employs extensive use of their surroundings and unique abilities, and forces players to adapt to the conditions, making each battle unique.


Founded in February 2012, Krasnodymov Production LLC develops and publishes applications for mobile devices. Its titles include Confetti and the Tale Teller storytelling game.


We do believe that together we can create something unique, something that we couldn't make without your help. Every penny we will use to improve the art, style and animation of the game. Balancing game mechanics and developing the range of options the game deserves needs time and, with your help as supporters, together WE will create the game we all want to play.


Most of the money raised will go to towards animation. We want to create fully animated cut-scenes for the game, using classical 2D animation and this requires a lot of work. With all crazy stuff in our imaginations, this will add great immersion to the game and will require the talent of a special animator :)

story:
About us

Rothand Studio is a flourishing young company at the beginning of an exciting and long journey. 

We love war gaming and our greatest passion is developing the most beautifully designed crafted gaming figures.
Rothand Studio is dedicated to designing and creating our beautifully finely casted figures in order to offer fellow players and collectors these epic scale gaming works of art at a reasonable and affordable price.

The goal

Our goal is simple:  To offer the greatest gaming figures to the largest possible community at the most affordable prices.
By using Indiegogo as a funding platform, we aim to raise $5,000 which will allow us to take the next step and finance the production of our figures. 

In addition to producing our product, this start-up campaign will allow us to introduce our ideas and vision to the growing community of gamers.  More importantly it will give Rothand Studio interactive feedback about what you, the customer, think about our designs and will allow us to grow with the demands and needs of the gaming world.

Our work

Rothand Studio's journey into the war gaming world began over a year ago.  Let us show you what our hard work and vision has to offer so far.

‘Primeval Treeman’ 

 

the huge one. The figure is made of high quality resin and provided with 100 mm square base. The model is around 30 cm high, weight about 0,5 kg. It is unpainted and requires assembling. The assembling set consist of 23 elements: 2x rear branches, 4x central branches, 2x front branches, 1x body, 1x nose for a wild head, 1x wild head, 1x old head, 2x arms, 2x forearms, 2x palms, 2x thighs, 2x legs, 1x 100 mm square base.

The concept was to give the players and hobbits the free way of assembling. Usually you don’t have much choice of assembling the figures we wanted to change this:]. 

Using your imagination and small support from our assembling guide  you can create your own Treeman in a dynamic unique pose.

 

‘Golem Cronus’

 

The figure is made of high quality resin and provided with 100 mm square base. The model is around 17cm high, weight about 0,4kg. It is unpainted and requires assembling. The assembling set consist of 11 elements: 1x torso with thighs, 2x legs, 2x hands, 2x crystal shoulders, 1x head, 1x crystal backbone (long), 1x crystal backbone (small piece), 1x 100 mm square base.

 

 Our aim was to bring into your battlefields a creature that identifies pure strength. So we hope you like it.

‘Mountain Giant’

 

another huge figure is around 14 cm high and weight about 0,3 kg. We wanted to enclose the battle rage of a giant in a dynamic pose of his model.

 

‘Colossus legs’

 

The converting kit is made of high quality resin and provided with 50 mm square base. The model is around 7cm high, weight about 0,1kg. It is unpainted and requires assembling. The assembling set consist of 4 elements: 1x legs with 50 mm square base, 1x waist with thighs, 1x knee pad (skull), 1x front robe

The main idea by the sculpting of this converting part was to give to the players the possibility to built their own titan based on design of Egyptian god.

 

REVIEWS OF OUR FIGURES:

http://landomisfittoys.blogspot.com.au/2013/02/...

http://wappellious.blogspot.com/2013/04/colossa...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6oHnjzwoyAc

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uSlFYqu2yRA

 

PERKS:

 LEVEL 1

high quality resin square lava base (100 x 100 mm, weight about 0,2 kg) + lanyard and one ArtWork of your choice

 

LEVEL 2

 high quality resin square forest base (100 x 100 mm, weight about 0,3 kg) + lanyard and one ArtWork of your choice

 

 

 

ARTWORKS TO CHOSE:

CREATE YOUR OWN INDIVIDUAL PERK:

When you decided for one or more of our perks please send us an information with the simple information : Perk name + ArtWork number. When the perk has mug to chose : Perk name +ArtWork number + ceramic mug or thermo mug.

IF YOU LIKE OUR CAMPAING OR THINK IT'S COOL BUT FROM SOME REASONS YOU CAN'T GIVE US FINANCIAL SUPPORT PLEASE HELP US TO MAKE 'SOME NOISE' TO SHOW AS MUCH PEOPLE AS YOU CAN OUR WORK! :] 

WE HOPE YOU WILL HAVE SO MUCH FUN WITH OUR MINIATURES AS WE HAD BY MAKING THEM AND PREPARING THIS CAMPAGIN!

R E W A R D S

5 000 $ - When we reach the goal of 5000 $, every funder up Level 5 will get for free the set of TREEWARDENS (8 cm )

 

7000$ - When we reach this goal, every founder up Level 7 will get for free the Devil Serpent (11 cm)

WE HOPE YOU WILL HAVE SO MUCH FUN WITH OUR MINIATURES AS WE HAD BY MAKING THEM AND PREPARING THIS CAMPAGIN!
R E W A R D S
5 000 $ - When we reach the goal of 5000 $, every funder up Level 5 will get for free the set of TREEWARDENS (8 cm )
 

7000$ - When we reach this goal, every founder up Level 7 will get for free the Devil Serpent (11 cm)

story:
Welcome to Manorhouse Workshop Indiegogo project!

 


Hi everyone, my name’s Lorenzo Marchetto, founder of Manorhouse Workshop, which deals with 28-35mm Wargames’ and modelism kit making since more than 13 years.

Our main activity is the production of buildings, sceneray elements, and modular gaming tables for tridimensional wargames and static modelism.

During our years of activity, we did work wiht a lot of national and international societies of this sector, providing them with dioramas, models, and other works. Those societies inclues Games Workshop, Rackham, Italeri, Wizards of the Coast, without forgetting editors’ houses like Hachette and Hobby&Work, or TV channels like Disney Channel and RAI.

When working with privates collectionists or players, we did give birth to historical or fantasy’s reproductions, like Helm’s Deep of the Lord of the Rings, Falkenstein Castle in Corinthia or the Templar Castle of Almuruol in Portugal.

Our passion even made us create Mindstalkers, a 3D Skirmish Wargame in 35mm, which received a Nomination for the "Best of Show" at the prestigious Italian Fair of Lucca Games, finishing as 1st in 3D Wargames category.

Our experience, throughout the years allowed us to project and continuously build a range of modular scenary kits that can thus be combined to create multiple and infinite results, be it for outside or inside scopes, while having an extreme sturdiness yet keeping perfect realism, as you can see (to see hundreds of examples of our works, come visit our Blog!).

It is our wish to keep bettering ourselves, by continue to create new products with new state of the art materials and priting techniques, like we’ve been constantly doing during our long history.
 

Project highlights

Our vision is to design a new series of kits of 28-35mm scale, that will recreate a complete, typical italian medieval village, with its fortified walls, the manor, the church, the water mill, the center of the village with the Arengario and the houses which surround the central tournament square...

but also typical medieval stores, like the blacksmith, the shoe repairer, the butcher... and many more, which we will reveal progressively as the project unfolds!

NOTICE: At the moment we're making the first model (the Water Mill), and we have only hand drawings to let you see something as the one shown here below (you can see some more sketchesin the "Gallery" tab of this project). Once every master will be finished, we'll update the page with detailed photographs!

This new series of kit, while increasing the modular possibilities of modelism and the level of details - and giving you a fresh new design - will be fully compatible with all of our existing products.

This new series of kits will also be produced with an increased industrial policy: the material will be high quality polyreuthane resin, and the production will be done using the latest vacuum and printing technologies, with new generation silicons molds which highly lower down miscasts... and this will mean lower kit prices too!

This innovation will allows us to print the models both sides, while still keeping all doors and windows open to keep all gaming options open.
 

Why Indiegogo?

This Manorhouse Workshop project is very big and complex, and requires a hefty investment. Our decision to transition from an artisanal production to a new semi industrial one, and to direct client sales allows us to use the Indiegogo platform to its fullest, since it brings us into contact with you, our potential customers.

To bring it to life, we need you. We need your pledge so that we can have "the numbers" to lower production costs, and to gain better delivery costs for all. Indeed, you will be the one to decide if this project is worthy of success. And you will be the one to benefit from all the advantages, discounts and rewards.

By reaching our Indiegogo goal we will be able to start the production, and it will allow you to gain great gifts and rewards, while economizing on the final price... and if the project will rise and pass objectives and objectives, more and more prices and adds-on will be open to you!

 

Perks Description

Creating the Sales Bundles for our project turned out difficult. We did aim for the best, and so we did include a high number of buildings inside bigger perks.

Unfortunately, Indoegogo allows only up to 20 perks, but we do have dozens of different modular itens, and may different design for  some of them (e.g. houses' walls). 

So, all the goodies that we weren’t able to insert in the perks, will be proposed later on in some ADD-ONs that you will be able to purchase at a special Indiegogo price, merging them with the purchased perks.

Here beside you can see described all the perks; as soon as each product master will be ready we'll add here detailed photographs of it!

Technical Information

  • All kits are printed with high quality polyreuthane resin
  • All kits are printed (detailed) on both sides
  • All kits are sold unpainted, yet to be assembled.

Update N° 10

Hello to all.

Last hours of the campaign. Meanwhile, we want to thank all those who have supported us and that will support us until 11:59 pm. tomorrow August 15th. Thanks to all of you.

We continue with the update dedicated to our project. The tenth is dedicated to special rewards,  are two, and both dedicated to two specific perks if purchased together. House Raisers and House Raisers Pack 1 Pack 2.

First series: two small  bridges one covered and one uncovered – a overhang consists of two seperate storeys – a terrace.

Second series: Two small  bridges one covered and one uncovered -  an external staircase with door – a terrace.

Both of these packages are very useful for making it even more interesting your village, Below are some examples.

The images make it more than a thousand words. Our modular system allows different compositions. And with the new accessories allows an unlimited possible combinations.

The next update. Lorenzo

Update N° 9

Hello to all.

Begins to take shape the village. after the watermill, we are creating the first houses of the village. The texture of the houses will be: Stone, stone and wood, only wood and bricks to finish.

Let’s start with an overview of the first houses built.

On two storeys.

With external staircase.

Combination 2-storey house 10×10, more a house 15×10 at one storey.

Overview of the village with the first houses built and at the center the water mill.

The stair and the stone bridge for the passage from one house to another, are 2 of the 4 rewards that you can get by purchasing the 2 perks: House Raisers Pack 1 and House Raisers Pack 2.

Gradually will be realized the houses we’re going to replace the basic models of polystyrene. The sight is very attractive. in the next 9 days you will see changes in this village and with your help the village will also become bigger and bigger, and will be added new buildings.
Thank you for your help. Lorenzo

Update N° 8

Hello to all.

Below is the direct link at list of weights and prices during and after the Indiegogo. The weights are used for all those who purchase outside Europe to quantify the cost of shipping. You will notice that the transition to the resin decreased greatly the weight of individual items.

Weights and prices of perks during and after the Indiegogo

Update N° 7

Hello to all.

Here are the photos of the Water mill in its final form. Remember the initial design of the mill?

Here is the finished master.

I have to say I’m better at sculpting than to draw …
The water mill was a very interesting project and quite complex. But now it’s on the table in my lab completed. a little dream come true. 

Now we start with the houses of the village. to the next update. Lorenzo

Update N° 6

Hi to all.

The Water Mill is being finalized. Completed the tower-silos, are to be completed only some details, Roofs, stairs… An overview of the Mill.

 

In detail, the tower-silos of mill in wood

 

We also have the first house with textures in legno10x10 for the perks: House Raisers Pack 2. Can be combined with the perk: House Raisers Pack 1. In order to raise one or more storey of the houses.

 

To the next update. Lorenzo

Update N° 5

Hello to all.
5th update only dedicated to the work in progress of the water mill. the central body and part of the porch are nearing completion.

 

The detail wooden roof with stones to keep the boards in place. and the mill wheel still by to work to make it more worn.

Detail of the portico.

Proportions with a miniature in 28-32 mm. The kit is designed for miniatures in 28-35mm.

To next update.

Lorenzo

Update N° 4

Hello to all.

First images of the work in progress of the Water Mill. Part of the arcade and the first walls of the house of the miller.

 

We go into detail: two walls to two storey of the dwelling. the new masters have been studied and etched on both sides.

 

Above the dwelling there will be a  building made entirely of wood, as you can see from the drawing.

We end with the arcade.

At the next update.

Lorenzo

Update N° 3

Hi to all.

New updet for our project. This accessories have been created by Michele Bottalico.

Step ladder and wheel of the Watermill

 

 

New Wooden Balustrades

 

 

New Doors for Church, Barbican and for Houses

New Windows for houses

Regards, Lorenzo

 

Update N° 2

Let’s get into 2 very interesting Perks. (Models pictured are the basics of space for the creation of masters)

House Raisers Pack 1 - 85,00 Euro

House Raisers Pack 2 - 140,00 Euro

Those are without doubt the most useful and convenient perks to rapidly build a little village.

Their content will allow you to combine in a multitude of ways the house kits.

As you can see from the above pictures, with a Perk from 85,00 Euro  and a one from 140,00 Euro  you can create a small village in various ways, the combinations are endless.

Now let’s see how you can easily compose the various modules to obtain a group of houses attached one to another, in the typical italian fashion.

Every storey will have an access to the upper and to the lower floor.

With the purchase of those 2 perks you will also get the rewards 01 serie, which will give you even more possibilities of combination.

The rewards 01 serie was created precisely to be combined with those 2 perks.

Each added purchase of those 2 perks will get you the possibility to get an additiona rewards 01 serie.

Or, if you prefer, you can get your rewards based on the overall amount of goods purchased, as usual.

Regards, Lorenzo

Backers Rewards

By buying 120,00 Euros or more of goodies, you will get some rewards. Those rewards will be divided in groups (A,B,C, etc.): depending on how much is the overall purchase, you will have access to a certain group of rewards.

Unlocked Rewards Groups

Group A: can be choosed with a purchase of € 120,00 or more

You'll can get for free ONE of the following options:

  • 1 Balcony
  • 1 Uncovered Suspended Passage (to connect two houses)
  • a 10% discount, valid for one order of Manorhouse products - but not in Indiegogo projects - (validity 1 year, from February 20th, 2014 / February 20th,2015, NOT CUMULATIVE with other discounts)

Group B: can be choosed with a purchase of € 220,00 or more.

You'll can get for free ONE of the following options:

  • 2 Balcony
  • 2 Uncovered Suspended Passage
  • 1 Balcony OR 1 Uncovered Suspended Passage + a 10% discount, valid for one order of Manorhouse products - but not in Indiegogo projects - (validity 1 year, from February 20th, 2014 / February 20th,2015, NOT CUMULATIVE with other discounts)

Group B: two Special Rewards.

and both dedicated to two specific perks if purchased together. House Raisers and House Raisers Pack 1 Pack 2. Total cost = 225,00 euro

Or first series: two small  bridges one covered and one uncovered – a overhang consists of two seperate storeys – a terrace.

Or second series: Two small  bridges one covered and one uncovered -  an external staircase with door – a terrace.

Group C: can be choosed with a purchase of € 420,00 or more.

You'll can get for free ONE of the following options:

  • 2 Balcony + 2 Uncovered Suspended Passage 
  • 2 Balcony OR 2 Uncovered Suspended Passage, + a 10% discount, valid for one order of Manorhouse products - but not in Indiegogo projects - (validity 1 year, from February 20th, 2014 / February 20th,2015, NOT CUMULATIVE with other discounts)

Upcoming Rewards Groups (yet to be unlocked)

  • Group D: can be choosedwith a purchase of € 720,00 or more.
  • Group E: can be choosed with a purchase of € 1.000,00 or more.
  • Group F: can be choosed with a purchase of € 1.700,00 or more.
  • Group G: can be choosed with a purchase of € 2.300,00 or more.
  • Group H: can be choosed with a purchase of € 3.000,00 or more.

Special "Kings' Reward"

Those "Kings" who will buy one of the 5 complete “Large Village” perks, will get a unique benefit: a complete modular landscape, refined and painted by Lorenzo Marchetto himself!

Only 5 will be done, and only for this project (indeed none will be inserted into the MHW catalog once this Indiegogo project is over).

The landscape will be made of 9 pannels, 40x40cm each, where the lucky contributor will be able to put his just-purchased village.

Please notice: only the landscape will be painted and refined.

The image above shows an EXAMPLE of 9 finished landscape pannels.

 

  

Time schedule

The shipping of the goods will start on the second half of February, 2014.

Maybe some items will be ready before this limit, and so will be shipped before this term, but we have to consider the production of the entire project as "real" term to be given to you to be realistic.

 

Door to door delivery costs 

Notice: Estimated weight of single items will be published soon.

Italy: free delivery on all the national territory. 

European Union (EU): add 25,00 Euro on the overall expense (for a maximum weight of 50 kg).

 

Switzerland - Norway - Gibilterra: add 40,00 Euro on the overall expense (for a maximum weight of 50 kg).

 

U.S.A.:

  • weight from 1 to 5 kg: add 27,00 Euro on the overall expense.
  • weight from 6 to 10 kg: add 35,00 Euro on the overall expense.
  • weight from 11 to 15 kg: add 45,00 Euro on the overall expense.
  • weight from 16 to 20 kg: add 60,00 Euro on the overall expense.
  • weight from 21 to 30 kg: add 85,00 Euro on the overall expense.
  • weight from 31 to 50 kg: add 120,00 Euro on the overall expense.

Rest of the world: please contact us first by email: marchetto.lorenzo@gmail.com 

Update N° 8

Below is the direct link at list of weights and prices during and after the Indiegogo. The weights are used for all those who purchase outside Europe to quantify the cost of shipping.

Weights and prices of perks during and after the Indiegogo

The above weight limits apply on the overall purchase for this Indiegogo project, of course as long as the delivery stays on the same region/weight selection as the first purchase.

Example: one purchaser buys a first perk for 5 kg worth of material. The goods need to be delivered in Germany.

Later, the same purchaser wants to buy some other goods of this Indiegogo project. As long as the overall goods purchased do not go over the 50 kg limit (weight or volume), there won’t be any additional 25 Euro delivery expense for the second, third, etc purchase.

 

This section will be filled in later on, with YOUR questions... and our answers!

story:
Vietnam. The Wargame.

Vietnam is a collector NAC based wargame, set in this bloody conflict. It recreates the battles and challenges that came under american detachments. The huge amount of tokens shows the different units and weaponry used: Viet Cong, Green Beret, heliborne troops, infantry, mortars, anti-aircraft, missile launchers, Chinook, Cobra, Huey and Cayuse helicopters.

Two, three or four players take command of American and South Vietnamese troops, and the army of North Vietnam.
Once initial troops placed on the board, each player takes turns moving the mobility factor of each unit, applying modifiers depending on the passing zone (rivers, streams, jungle paths, roads and rice fields).
Infantry units can engage in combat with adjacent opponents, existing differences between combat values depending on their experience and equipment (guerrillas, viet cong, infantry and Green Berets are an example).
Artillery units can launch ranged attacks against other tabs or objectives.
The weather factor also plays a big role.
The firepower and mobility offered by different types of helicopters are the great strength of the American contingent, as opposed to the number of North Vietnamese infantry and difficult terrain mobility, may be grouped, giving the oportunity to cheating with empty groups that must be discovered approaching them.
Several Fire Support Base, which at siege are recreated in an extended area on the board, providing another level, much more exciting, including mines and barbed wire to open a gap.
At the end of the round 14, players earn points for every target that their units still maintain (bases, hills and villages). The winner is the most points of victory has joined.

Contents:

  • 1 80x64cm game board depicting in detail villages of Vietnam jungle
  • 1 Fully color illustrated manual
  • 360 High detail tokens, depicting different infantry, artillery and aircraft units involved in the conflict
  • 2 control sheets to create groups
  • 1 Reference Tables Sheet
  • 1 Wargame special Dice

Vietnam. El Wargame.

Vietnam es un wargame de coleccionista ambientado en el conflicto que le da nombre. En él se recrean los combates y dificultades a las que se vieron sometidos los destacamentos estadounidenses. La enorme cantidad de fichas reflejan las diferente unidades y maquinaria usada: viet cong, boinas verdes, tropa helitransportada, infantería, morteros, antiaéreos, lanzamisiles, helicopteros Chinook, Cobra, Cayuse y Huey.

Dos, tres o cuatro jugadores toman el mando de las tropas americanas y survietnamitas, o el ejercito de Vietnam del norte.
Una vez colocadas las tropas iniciales sobre el tablero, cada jugador se turna moviendo el factor de movimiento de cada ficha, aplicando modificadores dependiendo del tipo de zona por el que pase (ríos, riachuelos, jungla, caminos, rutas y arrozales).
Las unidades de infantería pueden entablar combate con los adversarios adyacentes, existiendo diferencias entre los valores de combate dependiendo de su experiencia y equipo (guerrilleros, viet cong, infantería y boinas verdes son un ejemplo).
Las unidades de artillería pueden lanzar ataques a distancia contra otras fichas u objetivos.
El factor climatológico también juega un gran papel.
La capacidad de fuego y movilidad que ofrecen los distintos tipos de helicópteros son la gran baza del contingente americano, en oposición a la cantidad de infantería norvietnamita y su movilidad por terreno dificultoso,pudiendo agruparse, engañando al contrario con grupos vacíos que avanzan y deben ser descubiertos acercándose a ellos.
Existen varias Base de Apoyo al Fuego, que al asaltarse se recrean en una zona ampliada en el tablero, ofreciendo otra escala, mucho más emocionante, incluyendo minas y alambradas por las que debe abrirse una brecha.
Al finalizar el turno 14, los jugadores suman puntos por cada objetivo en el que aún mantengan sus unidades (bases, colinas y poblados). El ganador es el que mayor cantidad de puntos de victoria haya sumado.
El tablero ricamente ilustrado mide 80x64 cm,  dividido en hexágonos, que representa las junglas, BAF, poblados y arrozales de Vietnam.  Con 360 fichas de 1 cm. ilustradas que representan unidades tales como: viet cong, tropas helitransportadas, artilleria, cañones, morteros, helicopteros cayuse, chinook, cobra y huey (entre otros). Además incluye 2 hojas de control para los objetivos y agrupaciones, así como una hoja de tabla de referencias.

Contenido de la caja:

  • 1 Tablero de juego de 80x64 que representa con todo detalle y arte la jungla y poblados de Vietnam
  • 1 Manual a todo color ricamente ilustrado
  • 360 Fichas troqueladas de alto detalle, representando las distintas unidades de infantería, artillería y aviación que participaron en el conflicto
  • 2 Hojas de control para crear guarniciones y agrupaciones
  • 1 Hoja de Tablas de Referencia
  • 1 Dado especial de wargame

 

About us and this project

Ronin7 Studio designs and produces game systems and elements. It starts its work at the beginning of this year with this project, whose production was limited to collectors. This time we are trying to reach an international distribution, giving us the chance to continue with new and awesome projects for all the players.

Sobre nosotros y el proyecto

Ronin7 Studio es un estudio que desarrolla y produce sistemas y elementos de juego. Comenzó su andadura como tal a principios del presente año con este proyecto, cuya producción se limitó a coleccionistas. En esta ocasión nuestra intención es distribuir a nivel internacional, dándonos la oportunidad de continuar con nuevos e interesantes proyectos que harán las delicias de los jugadores.

 

What I get? What I receive?

The answer is very simple: Our target is to reach the production costs for the first issue of the english-spanish edition. With each perk you'll get different game packs, before anybody, and for a lower prize than you would pay in a shop.

For small colaborations we'll send our scenery resin craters, that can be used in other wargames with miniatures.

Also, if we overcome our target every funder will recieve these extras with your perk:

Reaching 9000 €

+ 1 promotional Poster

Reaching 12000 €

+ 1 promotional T-Shirt: Ronin7 Juegos or Vietnam design (to choose)

And if you are resident in Spain we'll send you all totally free trought postal service.
For rest of countries, you receive a message with shipping costs, paying them with a simple donation.

¿Qué obtengo si contribuyo?

La respuesta es fácil: Nuestro objetivo es conseguir la producción de la primera tirada de la edición español-inglés. Alcanzando las diferentes cuotas de colaboración conseguirás distintos packs del juego, antes que nadie, y por un precio mucho menor al que tendrías que pagar en la tienda.

Para las pequeñas colaboraciones enviaremos nuestros cráteres de escenografía, lo cuales pueden usarse en otros juegos de estrategia con miniaturas.

Además, si superamos nuestro objetivo todos los colaboradores recibiréis los siguientes extras con vuestra recompensa:

Alcanzados los 9000 €

+ 1 Poster promocional

Alcanzados los 12000 €

+ 1 Camiseta promocional de Ronin7 Juegos o Vietnam (a elegir)

Y si eres residente en España te enviaremos todo a tu casa totalmente gratis mediate servicio postal.
Para el resto de países, se enviará un mensaje con los gastos de envío correspondientes, abonándolos como una donación extra.
