Voici la liste des métiers avec les caractéristiques proposés :
Le
 fermier vous permettra de récolter de la nourriture plantée au 
préalable. Mais ne pensez pas que la récolte sera très profitable.
Le militaire est physiquement plus athlétique et maitrise le maniement des armes avec plus de facilité.
L’ouvrier vous permettra d’avoir un plus large panel de craft et de travailler le titanium avec plus d’aisance.
Le
 médecin est capable de se soigner et de soigner les blessures plus 
graves les autres joueurs à l’aide d’équipement qu’il faudra trouver.
L’ingénieur est capable de réparer les armes, armures et les véhicules.
Les
 métiers sont évolutifs : le joueur commence à 75% des capacité acquise grâce au métier. Le métier 
se présente en points de compétences qu’il faudra déverrouiller au cours
 de son expérience acquis dans le jeu.Il sera possible de déverrouiller d’autres métiers avec une limite de 30% de ses capacités.

Les modes


Nous avons la volonté de vous proposer quatre modes de jeu :
Le
 premier est celui du joueurs contres joueurs. Ce mode vous permettra 
d’incarner un Xelox ou un survivant humain. Qu’allez vous préférer ? 
Jouer au prédateur ou survivre en tans que proie ?
Le deuxième mode est la confrontation à objectif. Xelox ou Humain, votre but sera la réussite de la mission.
Le troisième mode est celui de I.A contres joueurs. Vous incarnez un survivant face aux Xelox qui seront impitoyables.
Enfin, Le dernier  mode de jeu consiste à implémenter du contenu solo pour en découvrir plus sur l’univers du jeu.
Il faut savoir que tous ses modes sont sujet au changement selon les résultats de la compagne de financement.



Les différents objectifs



A savoir



Toute la conception et la réalisation d’Outsider 
World ont comme ligne directrice le plaisir de jeu. Pour cela nous 
serons à l’écoute de la communauté et de leurs retours sur le projet. 
Pas d’extensions, de free to play et de micros transactions qui 
nuiraient du plaisir du jeu. Nous pensons que le système de sondage est 
la meilleure solution pour donner la parole aux joueurs tout comme les 
échanges sur le forum. Par conséquent nous attachons une attention toute
 particulière à ses outils pour le développement du jeu.
                    Pour toutes questions éventuelles liées au jeu, veuillez nous contacter sur support@cardigames.com.Pour plus d'informations nous vous invitons à regarder la vidéo ci-dessus ou à visiter le site http://outsider-world.com/Merci beaucoup de votre attention et à bientôt sur Outsider-World !

story:
↑ You can help us by sharing this campaign！ Thank you! ↑


Forward to the Sky! 

Balloon up and explore the sky ruins with Princess! A 3D action adventure game for PC/Mac/Linux.　

Developing by Magichnology, welcome to our Website and IndieDB game page. You can also subscribe to our major announcements by email.

中文請見網站: www.tw.magic-nology.com


Once upon a time, there was a great tower in the sky. People were mining crystal with delight during the prosperous days. Until that disaster happened…… Time past, the history had been forgotten. And now, it emerged from the clouds again – the sky tower.


Game 

Reveal the story of the sky tower!

Forward to the Sky is a third person action adventure game in the sky tower ruin. Without a single word in the game, you are going to collect all the fresco pieces to connect the story and everything will be revealed once Princess reaches the top level.


The game is Zelda-like, focus more on puzzles also features a mixture of action and adventure gameplay. Relaxing mood, bright art, adventurous but peaceful music, simple control and combat. A game everyone are able to finish and provides additional fun of difficulty to hardcore players. 

     


There will be 6 unique levels to be explored. Engage in combat with various attack combos, break the walls, run through the traps and play with interactive mechanisms to solve the puzzles. Find your path to discover the story in the sky!

     


Project status

We've been constantly updating our progress on our website and IndieDB. And we will continue to update the progress in the future.

To sum up the project status for now: 

System:

# 90% of the system are done. The game is already playable.

Content:

# 2 of 6 stages design are done, 3rd and 4th in progress.

# 70% of must-have environment objects ( art ) are done.

# Princess model and all animation are done.

# 2 of 9 BGMs are done, 3rd in progress.



Funding

Wei is funding this game out of his own pocket and needs some more funding to help. 

Most of the team members have years of experience in the game industry but are working for little to no pay because they believe in this project.

However, all the little payments add up to be something not easy, especially when building a fantasy game with quality art. And that's why Wei needs your help!

All of the funding are going to be used in paying art. 

There are still 30% of the must-have environment arts to be done. $3,000 ($2,790 will actual go to the project after the fee for Indiegogo and Paypal) is not much, but it will allow us to improve the art and have more interesting environment.

We assure you that we do our best not to waste your money and spend the money only on where it needs to be.


Team

Wei ( Project lead and programming )

Wei has years of experience programming. Although he is not in the game industry, he's been fighting/struggling his way making games. He is gathering talented people together to make this game and can't be happier to work with them.

Apupu ( Character modeling, animation and particle effects. )

Apupu has been working in the game industry for many years and especially good at modeling 3D characters and making character animation. His beautiful skill is bringing characters to life. 

CONE ( Character design and CG )

CONE has been working in game industry for a long time. He is good at character design and likes to do it. He has created many attractive characters in the past. CONE is going to work on the game CG as well, he said he needs some push so give him a word!

Randgris ( Game design )

Randgris is a gamer and always wants to design a game himself. He got many interesting idea and some were already implemented in the game.

Ted ( 3D Scene art )

Ted is in the movie/animation industry for years and he loves game. He helps a lot on the early scene environment and concepts, without him we would have a long way to go. He is also very good at machine concept and the balloon was designed by him.

Chris Kukla ( Music design )

Chris have been working in the music industry composing for a wide range of media for years. He is going to do the best he can to bring sound into this sky adventure.

Nori ( GUI design and CG )

Nori is good in a wide range of digital art and has been working in the game industry for many years. She has already shown her good works of GUI design and CG painting for this project and will continue to help us on the environment art if she got any time after.

Kay ( 3D Scene art )

Kay has years experience works on environment art in the game industry. She focuses her skill on providing a beautiful gaming world, and she is going to bring a fantasy sky tower into this game.

EOWS ( 3D Scene art )

EOWS, has been in the game industry for a decade. He is good at scene conception, modeling and texturing in variety styles. Even after years working for the company, he has not lost his heart for gaming. He is going to work with us with his strong skill of environment/prop art.

Also, credits to Jog for supporting particle effects, Bao Chen for creating the game opening BGM, and Bitgem3d for the skeleton.



Rewards

Soundtrack

At least 9 tracks from the game. You will be able to download it in high quality DRM-free formats.

Collection Book

The development of the game and all the origin art images from conception to production. How does this project started? How were the characters design changed? How the stages were being designed and built? Everything else happened during the make of this game. It should be around 20 pages in pdf format.


Risk & challenges

Every project has risks.

In the past 6 month, we've built up a playable game with all the required gameplay system and art that are already polished. We are starting this funding campaign because we have the confidence that we will finish the game. No matter what results in the end of this campaign, we are going to finish it.

However, this campaign will make a big difference on how good this game can be. More than the funding, this campaign really means a lot to us because it brings us confidence that we are making something people like.

We hope that you will join us, together, bringing the game better quality and gaming experience.


Questions

Q: Witch platform will this be on?

A: We are going to contact Humble Store to get a Humble widget and release on Desura, 

Steam? Yes, we'll definitely bring the game through Greenlight when it is near done and we'll need your support again! 


Q: What's the feature of this game?

A: This game focused on 3D interactive puzzling. You are going to play with mechanisms that will affect multiple floors and solve the puzzle of it. Asides from puzzles, the game also focused on action gameplay ( your controlling skill ) and a slighter part of fighting. Check the Updates and have a watch at the videos!



Please help us spread out the message. Simply share this campaign on Twitter/Facebook/G+ or any other social media or ask your friends if they can help this project, thanks!


Special thanks to RyanSumo, everyone from TIGForums and IndieDB helped me on this campaign page.

story:
Q: So, why did you decide to port to the SMD?

A: We honestly fell in love with this and new that this would be the best way to share it with everyone.

However, there are a few changes to our version.

 

        1. You can expect to see three completely open worlds, each with ten fun and engaging levels and even one hidden level.

        2. Each world consists of one end-level-boss, which is created in part by you and us!

        3. Your actions have consequences, so whether you want a happy ending or a horrific one, that choice is yours!

        4. In total, there are nine secret levels which you'll need to uncover to discover valuable tools and information for your next quest.

        5. Users love choices, right? Well, you have the option of which characters to choose from – maybe you want to be Fox's lovely girlfriend?

 

 

We tested our version of the game on real hardware. The game supports both regions, both NTSC and PAL.

 

 

Don't have a console at home? Have no fear as we are also able to offer a digital version which you'll be able to use on any device, even your phone or PC!

 

 

Ah... love, Love... How beautifully in one word. My mind is racing, my stomach flutter butterflies, heart racing. Are you willing to do anything to give a million cherries, collect all the jewels and even save your favorite?

      

Here's our Foxy Fox is ready to rescue his love! He sent her on a dangerous journey and without Your help Foxy to save her!
Embark on an adventure filled with dangers and difficulties that You have to overcome! Complete many challenging levels, collect the gems and cherries and get to the end of the level to get three stars.
Look in the shop and spend the collected cherry on new items.

      
And if You can pass all levels in FoxyLand? We now check!

- A wholesome sum of levels

- A variety of puzzles to overcome 

- A heartwarming love story

- Your choice in ending 

- Quality graphics coupled with lively and entertaining music

- Straightforward and amusing!

      

 

 

                                                         

           

 

 

                           

 

https://pscd.itch.io/foxyland

 

 

We are connoisseurs of retro video games, especially games from the Sega Mega Drive\Genesis. However, we want to see more quality, captivating games on the Sega Mega Drive\Genesis, so instead of only waiting and hoping, we are doing something about it!

 

We have been developing BioEvil for a year and a half now, and the process has grown on us and has become quite enjoyable!

 

 

Our team consists of three people. You can think of us like the "Planeteers" who combine our skills to create the mighty "Captain Planet"! Okay, really, we are three experienced guys who are obsessed with retro gaming and what to share it with the world.

 

The game MineSweeper for SMD (2013)

The port of the game FlapyBird on SMD (2014)

The Chip8 emulator for SMD (2015)

And since 2017 he has been working on the game BioEvil.

      

        

                       

       

 

 

He began his "creativity" in 2017, taking part in the development of the game BioEvil.

              

         

                           

 

"Aliens: Neoplasma" by Sanchez crew (2019)
"OldTowers" by Retrosouls (2019)

 

 

If you want to keep up to date with the development of Foxyland or just see what we're up to in general, then here are the obligatory social media links!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/312428125976652/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/greengh0st1

Website: http://pscd.ru/

В контакте: https://vk.com/pscdru

 

 

At the end of the work we will need no more than two months. The only thing that can delay us is the production and delivery of cartridges, so we took stock on time, so everything was done on time.

story:
Sono veramente tante le associazioni degli appassionati al mondo dei rallies che organizzano numerosi eventi e competizioni che hanno come protagonisti i modellini radiocomandati. Esistono quasi dei veri e propri campionati paralleli a quelli ufficiali, nei quali si emulano in scala 1:10 le gesta e le gare dei grandi piloti che corrono nel WRC. E' un gioco che attualmente si pratica recandosi direttamente nei luoghi per lo più all'aperto, dove vengono allestite le varie tipologie di prove da affrontare, si vivono in questo modo delle belle giornate a pieno contatto di tante persone che condividono la stessa passione.

Le gare alle quali si partecipa risultano sicuramente divertenti ma presentano anche dei limiti, come ad esempio il fatto che sia necessario rincorrere i modellini a piedi nei tracciati e quindi di conseguenza averne una visione dall'esterno degli stessi che non è proprio ideale, normalmente nella realtà infatti si guida da seduti e si ha una visione sulla strada da percorrere dall'interno di un abitacolo. 

Rally Game non sostituirà tali eventi che conserveranno sempre un loro spazio, ma apporterà tanti vantaggi interessanti, non sarà più necessario attendere che vengano organizzate delle gare da qualche parte e non ci si dovrà recare direttamente dove hanno luogo, ma soprattutto contribuirà a fornire un pò la sensazione di trovarsi a bordo vettura grazie alla camera che inquadrerà i percorsi di gara come se ci trovasse all'interno, le stesse immagini verranno trasmesse dalla rete sui grandi schermi delle smart Tv avveniristiche che ci ritroviamo oggi giorno in salotto.

 

Ora immagina di pilotarla su percorsi reali dal 55 pollici del tuo salotto!! Ti trovi nell'abitacolo di questo piccolo bolide drone!

Tutti i partecipanti alle prove cronometrate di Rally Game avranno a loro disposizione gli stessi mezzi, dotati delle migliori tecnologie e ritrovati di questo specifico settore per possedere pari opportunità nelle prove speciali che saranno cronometrate e registrate da un moderno sistema di cronometraggio affidabile e completamente automatizzato.

La tecnologia 

Oggi si può pilotare tranquillamente un piccolo drone amatoriale usando le reti di telefonia mobile 4G, figuriamoci quando arriveranno le super reti telefoniche di quinta generazione (5G) che dal 2020 ci daranno prestazioni adesso semplicemente inconcepibili, tra cui velocità dati di decine di megabit al secondo per decine di migliaia di utenti connessi contemporaneamente, e soprattutto un tempo di latenza molto ma molto inferiore a quello delle migliori reti LTE disponibili sul mercato.

La latenza di soli alcuni millisecondo significa che da qualsiasi parte del mondo è possibile pilotare un automodello "drone" ovunque si trovi, inviando i comandi da un device che opera su rete 4G per riceverne il video di ritorno dalla stessa rete per dirigere il mezzo e controllarne di conseguenza la migliore traiettoria possibile sul tracciato.

Il terreno individuato è coperto già da un forte segnale 4G che sarà reso più performante da alcune soluzioni tecnologiche posizionate nelle immediate vicinanze del campo da gioco per riuscire a migliorarne la stabilità e di conseguenza l'efficienza. Sarà possibile giocare e pilotare con una precisione adeguata avendo le garanzie necessarie per un controllo a distanza abbastanza efficace.

I piccoli bolidi radiocomandati

Gli automodelli in scala 1:10 saranno dotati di una camera hd con micro stabilizzatore, posizionata in modo da fornire una visione dei percorsi simile a quella che si avrebbe dall'interno dell'abitacolo di una vettura,  di un controller collegato ad una normale sim telefonica e integrato ad un radio controllo digitale d'ausilio per migliorare le performance di guida, motore elettrico, 4 ruote motrici e gomme da sterrato. I modelli acquistati di serie subiranno delle modifiche necessarie ad affrontare in tutta affidabilità le condizioni del tracciato sterrato in qualsiasi periodo dell'anno.

Un'evoluzione continua delle tecnologie legate a questo particolare settore ne consentiranno poi un continuo e futuro sviluppo che sicuramente accresceranno le sensazioni e il divertimento, è possibile che a lungo termine Rally Game possa di fatto anche diventare quasi un nuovo sport. 

Le prove speciali

Il campo da gioco si svilupperà su un terreno di oltre 5 ettari, sarà composto da 8 prove speciali con percorsi in fondo sterrato, lunghezze variabili dai 400 ai 700 metri e larghezza di carreggiata intorno ai 70 centimetri.

Verrà realizzato un percorso aggiuntivo di prova per testare i comandi a distanza, configurare le connessioni tra i più disparati device e prendere confidenza con il controllo online delle vetture. Completerà poi l'impianto un fantastico percorso che replicherà fedelmente in scala il famoso tracciato dell'Ittiri Arena, lo stesso dove si disputa la prova d'apertura del Rally Italia Sardegna nel campionato del mondo WRC.

Questo percorso in particolare sarà utilizzato per trofei di gare ad inseguimento con "manche ad eliminazione diretta". Un complesso sistema di cronometraggio di ultima generazione, installato lungo tutte le prove speciali, consentirà di prendere e registrare in modo molto preciso i tempi dei concorrenti per stilare i risultati. Durante le competizioni ufficiali gli addetti si occuperanno di riposizionare in carreggiata gli automodelli sino ad un massimo di 7 volte per gara, anche se a loro discrezione potranno sospendere le vetture che hanno subito grossi incidenti, quasi come a rispettare le competizioni reali e le stesse regole del mondo rallystico.

Nel campo da gioco saranno presenti anche delle camere esterne che riusciranno ad immortalare i passaggi più belli dei piccoli bolidi, alcune foto e video saranno trasmesse ai partecipanti tramite email quale ricordo dell'evento.

Le competizioni

Lo svolgimento delle gare sarà possibile grazie all'ausilio di un sito web di riferimento e alle applicazioni sviluppate ad hoc. Forniranno orari e dati per effettuare l'accesso alle piste e consentire la partecipazione alle gare in programma. Eseguito il login al sistema, un operatore sul campo da gioco interverrà per creare il collegamento a distanza tra il pilota e la vettura prescelta o selezionata in qualche modo in precedenza. Seguiranno le prime fasi per il settaggio dei comandi e quelle di test sino a quando tutto sarà pronto per affrontare le prove speciali cronometrate. Gli addetti sul campo forniranno poi anche tutta l'assistenza tecnica lungo il percorso per eventuali problemi ai radio modelli e ci sarà poi una certa flessibilità per consentire di proseguire la gara anche con dei limitati fuori pista come quasi ad emulare la realtà. 

Semaforo verde e il play now

Le gare con le prove speciali saranno in genere stabilite e decise anticipatamente con calendario e orari stabiliti, ma sulla home page del sito come pure sull'applicazione sarà presente un semaforo che quando apparirà di colore verde consentirà di giocare in real time con la possibilità di correre i rallies tra amici con prove cronometrate. Il campo da gioco risulterà di fatto aperto e gli addetti saranno presenti per fornire tutta l'assistenza necessaria al svolgersi delle competizioni.

Campionato italiano e FRANCHISING

Vorrei che questa mia iniziativa trovi i giusti canali e altri protagonisti che consentano a Rally Game di spaziare a dei livelli più alti, le intenzioni sarebbero quelle di promuovere un campionato nazionale rivolto a squadre regionali che si contendono il campionato stesso di questo gioco. 

Per tale motivo avrei pensato ad una selezione dei 3 componenti della squadra del team sardo ovvero della squadra Sardinia Rally Game scegliendo i conduttori tra un gruppo totale di 500 persone.

Gli impianti potrebbero nascere sull’intero territorio nazionale, nelle varie regioni italiane con un sistema simile al “franchising” ovvero versando un contributo veramente minimo per ricevere tutta l’assistenza e la consulenza per non commettere errori risparmiando sulla realizzazione, l’apertura e la gestione dei vari campi da gioco e di tutte le attività collegate. Si potrà usufruire gratuitamente della piattaforma web e delle applicazioni informatiche sviluppate ad hoc consentendo in maniera uniforme agli utenti di poter partecipare al gioco e alle competizioni ufficiali. 

ATTENZIONE: SONO DISPONIBILI 11 SPAZI PER 11 DIFFERENTI REGIONI ITALIANE.

Timeline

Il Rally Game ha fretta di nascere, questa illustrazione ne mostra a grandi linee quali saranno indicativamente i passi da compiere e i tempi necessari per arrivare ai primi beta test e alle prime competizioni online con partecipanti da tutta l'Europa ad ogni singola gara ed evento.

Conclusioni

La presente campagna sarà aggiornata costantemente, come da timeline passo dopo passo saranno mostrati risultati e progressi ottenuti in modo tale da anticipare un pò i tempi e completare l'intero progetto per avere il campo da gioco operativo entro il mese di giugno.

Nella prima decade di giugno in Sardegna si disputerà la gara del mondiale rally WRC, speriamo che durante i momenti di pausa alcuni campioni si possano già cimentare in prove e test delle applicazioni informatiche, percorrendo a distanza il piccolo circuito che replica la prova dell'Ittiri Arena che allestiremo appositamente per quest'occasione.

Sono veramente lieto di aver pubblicato questo progetto e ringrazio fin da ora quanti lo sosteranno anche con dei consigli utili per migliorarlo e renderlo operativo il prima possibile.

Grazie a tutti per l'attenzione, speriamo di divertirci e vivere delle belle gare...

tanti cari saluti, Antonio Bezzu

Nulvi, 16/05/2018

Risks & Challenges

L'idea rally game è legata fortemente al progresso della tecnologia delle reti di connessione internet. E' chiaro che disponendo da subito di una rete 5G con latenza veramente minima il controllo sarebbe garantito in maniera più che ottimale, godendo in tal modo di un'esperienza di gioco con prestazioni eccezionali. 
All'inizio potrebbero verificarsi casi di device che potrebbero presentare delle incompatibilità al controllo efficace delle vetture da gara pilotate o comunque controllate a distanza. 
Per ultimo il numero delle vetture a disposizione potrebbe causare dei rallentamenti nello svolgimento del calendario delle gare in programma, questo potrebbe essere imputato in parte anche ad una rete internet che in qualche modo risulti causa di un controllo non proprio pienamente efficace. 
Sono comunque problemi che possono essere risolti entro la stagione del prossimo anno quando magari sarà veramente istituito il campionato nazionale del gioco grazie al contributo spero di tanti appassionati di questo sport che sapranno pazientare per avere nel giro di alcuni anni un bellissimo gioco legato fortemente ad uno sport per il quale nutrono seriamente di un sentimento speciale, grazie a tutti per l'attenzione. Buone derapate a tutti gli appassionati, versate un minimo contributo, noi daremo il massimo per farvi veramente divertire.
story_txt:
Sono veramente tante le associazioni degli appassionati al mondo dei rallies che organizzano numerosi eventi e competizioni che hanno come protagonisti i modellini radiocomandati. Esistono quasi dei veri e propri campionati paralleli a quelli ufficiali, nei quali si emulano in scala 1:10 le gesta e le gare dei grandi piloti che corrono nel WRC. E' un gioco che attualmente si pratica recandosi direttamente nei luoghi per lo più all'aperto, dove vengono allestite le varie tipologie di prove da affrontare, si vivono in questo modo delle belle giornate a pieno contatto di tante persone che condividono la stessa passione.

Le gare alle quali si partecipa risultano sicuramente divertenti ma presentano anche dei limiti, come ad esempio il fatto che sia necessario rincorrere i modellini a piedi nei tracciati e quindi di conseguenza averne una visione dall'esterno degli stessi che non è proprio ideale, normalmente nella realtà infatti si guida da seduti e si ha una visione sulla strada da percorrere dall'interno di un abitacolo. 
Rally Game non sostituirà tali eventi che conserveranno sempre un loro spazio, ma apporterà tanti vantaggi interessanti, non sarà più necessario attendere che vengano organizzate delle gare da qualche parte e non ci si dovrà recare direttamente dove hanno luogo, ma soprattutto contribuirà a fornire un pò la sensazione di trovarsi a bordo vettura grazie alla camera che inquadrerà i percorsi di gara come se ci trovasse all'interno, le stesse immagini verranno trasmesse dalla rete sui grandi schermi delle smart Tv avveniristiche che ci ritroviamo oggi giorno in salotto.


 

Ora immagina di pilotarla su percorsi reali dal 55 pollici del tuo salotto!! Ti trovi nell'abitacolo di questo piccolo bolide drone!
Tutti i partecipanti alle prove cronometrate di Rally Game avranno a loro disposizione gli stessi mezzi, dotati delle migliori tecnologie e ritrovati di questo specifico settore per possedere pari opportunità nelle prove speciali che saranno cronometrate e registrate da un moderno sistema di cronometraggio affidabile e completamente automatizzato.
La tecnologia 
Oggi si può pilotare tranquillamente un piccolo drone amatoriale usando le reti di telefonia mobile 4G, figuriamoci quando arriveranno le super reti telefoniche di quinta generazione (5G) che dal 2020 ci daranno prestazioni adesso semplicemente inconcepibili, tra cui velocità dati di decine di megabit al secondo per decine di migliaia di utenti connessi contemporaneamente, e soprattutto un tempo di latenza molto ma molto inferiore a quello delle migliori reti LTE disponibili sul mercato.

La latenza di soli alcuni millisecondo significa che da qualsiasi parte del mondo è possibile pilotare un automodello "drone" ovunque si trovi, inviando i comandi da un device che opera su rete 4G per riceverne il video di ritorno dalla stessa rete per dirigere il mezzo e controllarne di conseguenza la migliore traiettoria possibile sul tracciato.
Il terreno individuato è coperto già da un forte segnale 4G che sarà reso più performante da alcune soluzioni tecnologiche posizionate nelle immediate vicinanze del campo da gioco per riuscire a migliorarne la stabilità e di conseguenza l'efficienza. Sarà possibile giocare e pilotare con una precisione adeguata avendo le garanzie necessarie per un controllo a distanza abbastanza efficace.
I piccoli bolidi radiocomandati
Gli automodelli in scala 1:10 saranno dotati di una camera hd con micro stabilizzatore, posizionata in modo da fornire una visione dei percorsi simile a quella che si avrebbe dall'interno dell'abitacolo di una vettura,  di un controller collegato ad una normale sim telefonica e integrato ad un radio controllo digitale d'ausilio per migliorare le performance di guida, motore elettrico, 4 ruote motrici e gomme da sterrato. I modelli acquistati di serie subiranno delle modifiche necessarie ad affrontare in tutta affidabilità le condizioni del tracciato sterrato in qualsiasi periodo dell'anno.

Un'evoluzione continua delle tecnologie legate a questo particolare settore ne consentiranno poi un continuo e futuro sviluppo che sicuramente accresceranno le sensazioni e il divertimento, è possibile che a lungo termine Rally Game possa di fatto anche diventare quasi un nuovo sport. 

Le prove speciali
Il campo da gioco si svilupperà su un terreno di oltre 5 ettari, sarà composto da 8 prove speciali con percorsi in fondo sterrato, lunghezze variabili dai 400 ai 700 metri e larghezza di carreggiata intorno ai 70 centimetri.

Verrà realizzato un percorso aggiuntivo di prova per testare i comandi a distanza, configurare le connessioni tra i più disparati device e prendere confidenza con il controllo online delle vetture. Completerà poi l'impianto un fantastico percorso che replicherà fedelmente in scala il famoso tracciato dell'Ittiri Arena, lo stesso dove si disputa la prova d'apertura del Rally Italia Sardegna nel campionato del mondo WRC.

Questo percorso in particolare sarà utilizzato per trofei di gare ad inseguimento con "manche ad eliminazione diretta". Un complesso sistema di cronometraggio di ultima generazione, installato lungo tutte le prove speciali, consentirà di prendere e registrare in modo molto preciso i tempi dei concorrenti per stilare i risultati. Durante le competizioni ufficiali gli addetti si occuperanno di riposizionare in carreggiata gli automodelli sino ad un massimo di 7 volte per gara, anche se a loro discrezione potranno sospendere le vetture che hanno subito grossi incidenti, quasi come a rispettare le competizioni reali e le stesse regole del mondo rallystico.
Nel campo da gioco saranno presenti anche delle camere esterne che riusciranno ad immortalare i passaggi più belli dei piccoli bolidi, alcune foto e video saranno trasmesse ai partecipanti tramite email quale ricordo dell'evento.
Le competizioni
Lo svolgimento delle gare sarà possibile grazie all'ausilio di un sito web di riferimento e alle applicazioni sviluppate ad hoc. Forniranno orari e dati per effettuare l'accesso alle piste e consentire la partecipazione alle gare in programma. Eseguito il login al sistema, un operatore sul campo da gioco interverrà per creare il collegamento a distanza tra il pilota e la vettura prescelta o selezionata in qualche modo in precedenza. Seguiranno le prime fasi per il settaggio dei comandi e quelle di test sino a quando tutto sarà pronto per affrontare le prove speciali cronometrate. Gli addetti sul campo forniranno poi anche tutta l'assistenza tecnica lungo il percorso per eventuali problemi ai radio modelli e ci sarà poi una certa flessibilità per consentire di proseguire la gara anche con dei limitati fuori pista come quasi ad emulare la realtà. 
Semaforo verde e il play now
Le gare con le prove speciali saranno in genere stabilite e decise anticipatamente con calendario e orari stabiliti, ma sulla home page del sito come pure sull'applicazione sarà presente un semaforo che quando apparirà di colore verde consentirà di giocare in real time con la possibilità di correre i rallies tra amici con prove cronometrate. Il campo da gioco risulterà di fatto aperto e gli addetti saranno presenti per fornire tutta l'assistenza necessaria al svolgersi delle competizioni.
Campionato italiano e FRANCHISING
Vorrei che questa mia iniziativa trovi i giusti canali e altri protagonisti che consentano a Rally Game di spaziare a dei livelli più alti, le intenzioni sarebbero quelle di promuovere un campionato nazionale rivolto a squadre regionali che si contendono il campionato stesso di questo gioco. 
Per tale motivo avrei pensato ad una selezione dei 3 componenti della squadra del team sardo ovvero della squadra Sardinia Rally Game scegliendo i conduttori tra un gruppo totale di 500 persone.

Si potrà usufruire gratuitamente della piattaforma web e delle applicazioni informatiche sviluppate ad hoc consentendo in maniera uniforme agli utenti di poter partecipare al gioco e alle competizioni ufficiali.

Il Rally Game ha fretta di nascere, questa illustrazione ne mostra a grandi linee quali saranno indicativamente i passi da compiere e i tempi necessari per arrivare ai primi beta test e alle prime competizioni online con partecipanti da tutta l'Europa ad ogni singola gara ed evento.

La presente campagna sarà aggiornata costantemente, come da timeline passo dopo passo saranno mostrati risultati e progressi ottenuti in modo tale da anticipare un pò i tempi e completare l'intero progetto per avere il campo da gioco operativo entro il mese di giugno.
Nella prima decade di giugno in Sardegna si disputerà la gara del mondiale rally WRC, speriamo che durante i momenti di pausa alcuni campioni si possano già cimentare in prove e test delle applicazioni informatiche, percorrendo a distanza il piccolo circuito che replica la prova dell'Ittiri Arena che allestiremo appositamente per quest'occasione.
Sono veramente lieto di aver pubblicato questo progetto e ringrazio fin da ora quanti lo sosteranno anche con dei consigli utili per migliorarlo e renderlo operativo il prima possibile.
Grazie a tutti per l'attenzione, speriamo di divertirci e vivere delle belle gare...

story:
Introducing Runster

The new dimension where gaming and exercise converge.

Runster, It's an online game for exercise which is controlled by your body movement in the real world to elevate both gameplay experience and your health. Moreover, it's work without requiring any extra gadget just a smartphone, and a PC is enough. 

Click on the image above to register. Our prototype is available only in this crowdfunding period. After that, we will open closed beta version which available for those who have closed beta access key only.

*We haven't completed all the feature on the video yet. It also can have a minor change for better gameplay and balance. And yes, it's can also have bugs on some specific devices if you found it, please report us we will fix it as soon as possible.

Technology

Runster uses accelerometer and gyroscope data from your phone combined with gesture detection technology to detect your body movements and then sends the data to the PC to be processed as actions in the gameplay. The player can control their character by their body movement in the real world. Without buying any extra gadget just a smartphone and a PC are enough.

Improve your health and upgrade your character at the same time. 

At the end of the match, you will see a number of calories burnt and also receive points from participation. Points can be used to customize your characters. Even if you don't play it with a PC, you can still earn points by joining "minigames" or daily walking (in real life).

 


4 teams. 1 Map, with white flags scattered over the battlefield. Capture the tactical points to conquer the buildings. The team with the most buildings wins. The faster you run, the faster you will reach tactical points and get a higher chance for your team to win.


Battle your opponents by using your weapons you've selected before playing. When you kill them, all of their points will be yours!


There are many kinds of weapon, i.e., gun, trap, barricade and much more.
Every weapon will have a different effect to use in different situations. You can select up to 3 weapons on every match. Try to mix and match your strategies for a greater chance to win.


After capturing a tactical point, it will become your building.
There are 3 different types of building: 
Armory can reload a weapon.
Infirmary can heal yourself.
A statue is just a decoration.

 

 

To make people exercise more

without forcing themselves.

 

 

We also provide Sexy Pack which can change your idle post into a sexy post to make your characters become the sexiest man alive in Runster. It's a limited posture in this crowdfunding period only!

 

We have a prototype for you to play and explore. By the way, it just a prototype which means it can contain bugs on some specific devices or have some undeveloped feature (that's why we are launching this campaign). However, it's good enough for you to play, enjoy and understand our concept. 
If you have any suggestion or issue, please let us know. Don't forget to give us your feedback to make Runster the best exercise game for all. 
By the way, our prototype is available only in this crowdfunding period. After that, we will open closed beta version which available for those who have closed beta access key only.

*We haven't completed all the feature on the video yet and it can have a minor change for better gameplay and balance.

Follow us 

https://web.facebook.com/RunsterOnline/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDGQZW51m0Usq2NgAhDn9Iw
https://twitter.com/Runster3

story:
2020: The population of the Dominoes risks the extinction. They live by generating a special kind of energy when they touch each other. But something scary is about to happen… 

The researcher Domi and her assistant Nick know how to face this threat. Domi is smart, inflexible in her job. On the contrary, Nick is shy and clumsy. Despite frequent disagreements, they work in a lab that makes several tech objects and inventions that improve the life of Dominoes.The year before, while cleaning the lab, Nick and Domi found an ancient, prophetic map about what could change the future of the Dominoes. This map showed the instructions to create a special device that can be used to travel through time.
The writing suggests that in the future, in the year 4023, two heroes will need to find a lost box containing a strange object that will save the Dominoes and their energy. 
After eight months, our heroes are ready to go to the future, but an unexpected event changes their plans and the mission suddenly gets complicated...Because of a hard day of testing, Domi goes home to rest, while Nick stays alone in the lab. A terrible earthquake, one of many in the Dominoes Planet, shakes the city.
Domi falls from her bed, while Nick jumps from his chair, making the and the device crashes on the floor, breaking some parts.

Panic takes over Nick. He doesn’t know how to explain the damage to his boss. His distraction can compromise the whole project!  He decides to reorganize the lab, pick up sheets, pens, tools and cables from the ground. Then, he tries (very badly…) to repair the broken device and restart it before the sun rises. 

What happens next? Nick wasn’t a very good watchman but also not a very good assistant. He tried to fix the device but he made a huge mistake! What is gonna happen and where are our heroes? Will they be able to find the right way to 4023 and Save the Dominoes? 

 

 

Domi - The Researcher 


Domi is the founder of the Lab. She's smart and intelligent but also bossy, when needed. She is the last piece of the chain, her device will have a green light if the level is completed correctly. 

 

 

Nick - The Assistant 


Nick is Domi's personal assistant. No one knows why she chose him, considering he's messy, clumsy and pretty lazy! He's the first piece to move to start the game.


Normals - The Population 


The normals are the population of the Domino's world. They might change depending on the era the adventure is set. 

 

Stopper - The Angry Bodyguard 

He's angry, and he's gonna stop you. The Stopper has the ability to stop and reverse the direction of any domino. 


Tumbler - The Rolling Domino 
 

We don't really know where he's from, but he looks like a pacific happy Domino. He likes to roll over and over and over... 

 

The Dominoes Adventure’s gameplay is very simple and at the same time engaging.The players, level by level, have to solve the puzzle in order to complete the chain, that will always start with Nick and end with Domi.

The first task of the player is to identify the right path to reach Domi. To solve puzzles he can fill the gaps or remove characters to complete the chain and go to the next level. He has to pay attention to the unique moves of every character and also manage the limited pieces available in the characters box.

Levels are increasingly difficult and in almost every world there’s a new character with fun a personality and appearance. They are what makes the game more diverse: in fact, every single one of them introduces new mechanics to the game itself. The player chooses the position of the dominoes and then decides in which direction it’s going to fall. 
Wake Nick Up! Don’t break the chain. The Dominoes need your help!

What is gonna happen and where are our heroes? Will they be able to find the right way to 4023 and Save the Dominoes?   Domi - The Researcher Domi is the founder of the Lab. She's smart and intelligent but also bossy, when needed. She is the last piece of the chain, her device will have a green light if the level is completed correctly.   Nick - The Assistant Nick is Domi's personal assistant. No one knows why she chose him, considering he's messy, clumsy and pretty lazy! He's the first piece to move to start the game.
Normals - The Population 
The normals are the population of the Domino's world. They might change depending on the era the adventure is set.  Stopper - The Angry Bodyguard He's angry, and he's gonna stop you. The Stopper has the ability to stop and reverse the direction of any domino. 
Tumbler - The Rolling Domino  
We don't really know where he's from, but he looks like a pacific happy Domino. He likes to roll over and over and over...  The Dominoes Adventure’s gameplay is very simple and at the same time engaging.The players, level by level, have to solve the puzzle in order to complete the chain, that will always start with Nick and end with Domi.The first task of the player is to identify the right path to reach Domi. To solve puzzles he can fill the gaps or remove characters to complete the chain and go to the next level. He has to pay attention to the unique moves of every character and also manage the limited pieces available in the characters box.Levels are increasingly difficult and in almost every world there’s a new character with fun a personality and appearance. They are what makes the game more diverse: in fact, every single one of them introduces new mechanics to the game itself. The player chooses the position of the dominoes and then decides in which direction it’s going to fall. Wake Nick Up! Don’t break the chain. The Dominoes need your help!

story:
Hi!
I'm Robin. I'm a 23-year-old Stanford drop-out with a neat product, a one-person company, and an interesting life. I make Noteboards. They're dry-erase boards that fold up to pocket-size.
  • TechCrunch says, Noteboards "might just change the world."
  • Gizmodo says, "Brilliant... just waiting to be turned into a pirate map."

Your support will let me produce 10,000 Noteboards — a large enough batch that the cost for each one will go down, meaning I can earn enough to survive and can keep making these for students, artists, tabletop gamers, bored kids on car trips, and more!

Write now! Worry later!

Noteboards fold up from about 28" x 16" to the size of an index card. They're printed with a square-inch and square-centimeter grid on one side, are blank on the other, and are packaged with a dry-erase marker and a microfiber pouch that works as an eraser.

A Noteboard also makes a great collapsible sign.

...and a place for brainstorming your novel.

...and something to keep your kids busy during long car trips.

...and a surface for tabletop role-playing games.

...and a template for storyboarding your next film.

...and can be custom-printed with any kind of logo or artwork!

The NEW version will be a grid of 7 by 5 sections so you can use it as a calendar, and it'll have a hexagonal grid on it so it's easier to draw angles and use for tabletop RPG games!

Plus, you'll be supporting two good causes:

  1. RGFT.net Entrepreneurs are ordinary people who could use some extra income — they're students, newlyweds, people just generally down on their luck, and so on. They apply to get to buy Noteboards for super-cheap, at almost no profit to me, and then resell them however they want and keep 100% of whatever they makes.

    Why? I don't like trying to convince people to buy stuff, but there are those that do. I help RGFT Entrepreneurs start mini-businesses by giving them some inventory for a really low cost, and in return I get some extra market exposure, some great user feedback, and the warm-fuzzies of having given someone a hand.


  2. RGFT.net Designers are also ordinary people who've got an idea for some kind of invention that's so simple it should totally exist but for some reason doesn't. They'd love to turn their idea into reality, but they just don't have the money.

    If they let me develop and sell their invention for a year, I'll help them perfect the product, work out legal kinks, get them initial market exposure, and then turn the product back over to them at the end of the year if they wish.

    RGFT.net's only six months old and already there are several neat new products coming through the pipeline! I just need more of a budget to get them to production.

Learn anything anyone ever wanted to know about Noteboards here!

Photos from happy Noteboarders:




Me hard at work in the RGFT.net factory/my basement.

What a trendy perk! THIS COULD BE YOURS!

story:
The Game

http://www.rhythmdestruction.com

Rhythm Destruction is in a unique position here on indiegogo where most game developers come here to fully fund their project we are mostly done and we just need help to finish the game.

Rhythm Destruction is a game like no other. It features intense rhythm based gameplay mixed with 'Shoot Em Up' inspired elements. To play, you manuever your ship while tapping timed key presses to the beat of the music to destroy your enemies. Rhythm Destruction tracks high scores across all game types and stages. It also features a scrolling feed to update you on whats happening around the community in real time in regards to new records, high scores and game news. The game also features a competitive challenge mode where users can go head to head on a specific song for bragging rights and more. Rack up enough wins and earn your spot on the challenge leaderboard, gaining worldwide recognition among your peers. We have big plans for this game mode in the future including tournaments with prizes and tiered leagues for non-stop competitive play.

We also have support for DLC to extend the life of our game well after launch. Some people argue that DLC is a way to hold back content that should have been there at launch. Well we fully intend to show everyone how DLC should be done. We are still trying to make sure our distribution partners will allow us to do this but we fully intend to give out all of our DLC FREE FOREVER to people who purchase the game on day 1 or donate at least 10 dollars here. People should be rewarded for being early adopters to games not punished.

Medals! We have around 100 medals for launch with ideas for plenty more. Most medals also unlock a special title to equip to your player profile. Up to four medals can be worn in your profile to show off your accomplishments to friends and foes. Let everyone know that you've beaten the hardest stage in the game without dying or that you've gotten a high score on the leaderboards.

*note* Since the trailer above was created we have redone lots of models/textures and upgraded the lighting system.

The Music

We have an excellent lineup of music from http://www.scirecordings.com/ which are the same guys that provided music to other rhythm games such as In The Groove, Pump It Up Pro, and more recently with ReRave.

The Team

Rhythm Destruction is being developed by 2 people who love games. Ruu is in charge of programming and Sennin handles all the 2D/3D art as well as some music.

The Goal

The reason we are doing this indiegogo is because we want to finish Rhythm Destruction and that is only going to happen if we take some unpaid leave from our full time jobs. We have families we have to support so the money raised here will allow us to take time off and focus on making the best game possible! Any extra funds raised over the goal will go towards licensing future DLC songs and advertising the game when it launches.

 

We have HUGE plans for DLC post launch. Aside from just adding new music tracks and stages we have begun preliminary planning on adding a full on story mode. Other possibilities include adding in a league mode and online co-op play. But all of that depends on the success of this indiegogo and the success of the game when it launches so help us spread the word!

story:
Hello everybody! Let me introduce you my work which I’d like to share with you – fellow players - to spend free time with and to have fun with your friends in front of the computer or TV monitor. 


The idea for this game came from my wife when she asked me if it would be possible to create a simple game a la the old DOS game Tunneler to play in our free time.


That was when I started working on the game. It had taken weeks until I got the first results. The game was very simple and lacked basic features such as sound. However, it was pretty entertaining and we would spend a lot of time playing it so I decided to go on.


Ever since its beginnings the game has been created as a split screen game for multiple players. I gave it life in form of a modern graphic look, basic sounds and control via keyboard or gamepad. So far it includes only one map. Everything is constructed in a way that enables the player to control the whole game from the comforts of your couch via gamepad if the players choose to play on TV. 


The game’s principle is simple – find and destroy all the players.

At the beginning of each game the players are randomly placed within their base.

At the base the player can repair what has been damaged and recharge energy he needs for moving and firing. He can also use the enemy basis for this purpose. In case the tank spends all its energy and doesn’t manage to recharge it explodes immediately and the game in the given round is over for this player.

The successful player obtains a point at the end.

The obtained points enable the player to access new weapons. The player can choose chassis with better armour plate and higher maximum load which is slower.

The weapons which are available depend on the chosen type of chassis. There are several types available – from a light machine gun, middle weight cannons and chemical weapons to a heavy rocket launcher. However, it’s still possible for the light tank to beat the heavy one.

Along with selection of the guns you can also change the tank camouflage. 

Camouflage is important and the right choice of it can provide you with a tactical advantage.

After obtaining a given number of points the game restarts or the map changes.

The game includes special features such as mines and exploding grenade boxes which are generated randomly. You can use their presence to your advantage.

There are two basic game styles available. You select one of them before beginning the game.

One is a classical view from above and the other one is a view from a low perspective. 


Classical view from above:

View from a low perspective:


I have become completely engulfed by this game. However, it has begun to show on my finance. 

Each of you can help to bring this game to a higher level. Every contribution is valuable.

  • I’d like to finish the game and make it available to you – fellow players
  • I intend to add new maps, environment, weapons and tanks
  • To increase the number of camouflages to at least 20 (forest, winter, desert, digital)
  • To add a single player game against the computer
  • The game requires a 2D GUI interface, menu etc.
  • I need to purchase further software, music and sound effects licences.
  • Pay another person on 2D.
  • To at least partly cover the costs of living connected with the time I spend developing the game considering the fact I have a family
  • In case of large popularity and collecting a larger sum to gradually complete LAN and possibly also online multiplayer 

I sincerely appreciate everyone who makes any contribution to this project.

As a reward you can obtain the following in accordance with the selected package:

  • full version of the game after it’s been released
  • preliminary access to the beta version, although only with basic functions and extent considering the fact that the game is still being developed
  • promo materials in digital form
  • special thank you note in the game titles
  • opportunity to participate in designing weapons, chassis and camouflages 

Thank you for reading through this. I hope the game has gotten your attention and that you’ll give it a chance. It has been created for the players - not for profit but for fun. I’m developing a game that people around me and I enjoy. That’s why I hope it’ll find its fans.


Now I am working as 3D graphic designer and programmer freelancer. I worked for different clients from various countries (Slovakia, Czech Republic, Ireland, United Arab Emirates, Russia, etc.)

story:
Introducing the "StuCube"

Introducing the "stuCube", a unique concept in 3D puzzling for all ages, skill levels and interests.

The stuCube has been conceptualized and designed by Stu French, an amateur guitarist, loving grandfather, and computer boffin.

18 months sgo, Stu had a dream where he was building a perfect cube out of odd shapes and figures. Overwhelmed with creative enthusiasm, he designed his first cube, with a simple apple in the centre.

The journey from it's humble beginnings to today - where several different themes and skill levels of stuCube have been designed - has been one of fun and excitement in the French household, as we've shared our ideas and encouragement for this project.

Our campaign is to raise $10,000 to fund a 3D printer and the first order of filament. This will allow us to produce the cubes, so you can get puzzling! 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

Our first goal of $10,000 will provide us with a 3D printer and filament to produce the first edition (limited to 250) of stuCubes. These cubes will be of a kind, due to their unique serial number, indicating that you were one of the first crucial investors in stuCube.

The StuCube will come in its own neat 3D printed box, that snuggly fits the cube inside. So once you've solved StuCube, you can pack it away, safe and sound until the next time you get puzzling!

 Our stretch goal of $50,000 will enable us to purchase more sophisticated modelling software, to develop an expanded range of stuCubes, and establish a website for private consumers. This website will enable users to purchase a range of stuCubes from our designed set, or contact us to arrange a quote for a personalised stuCube, based on their unique requirements.

 Our further stretch of $100,000 will enable us to effectively market the stuCube for commercial purposes. This includes all neccessary patents, copyrights and legal fees, development of packaging, and establishment of supply chain. It is our ultimate goal that children and adults all over the world can enjoy the stuCube challenge, and get puzzling!

We will refund all contributions if we do not reach our goal of $10,000 

 The Impact

For a friend, for a loved one, our 3D modelling options are endless, we can design a 3D puzzle of any difficulty, based on a theme or object you provide us.

Imagine a stuCube created specially for your child, featuring their initials and their favourite objects, a soccer ball, an ice cream cone, and their teddy.

Imagine a stuCube built using the name of your business, and set out in your waiting room for customers to amuse themselves.

Imagine presenting your loved one a heart-shaped stuCube. At first, she looks confused, after all, it's just a puzzle, but as she pulls it apart, piece by piece, she reveals the centre, an engagement ring, and as that look of surprise crosses her face, you drop to one knee and say something cheezy like "I'll give my heart to you, every day, if you'll just say 'yes' ".... okay maybe not, but you get the idea.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have an idea for stuCube that we haven't presented here? Possibly a new theme, or extension of the concept? Contact us at stu@stucube.com with your contribution.

For bulk order or corporate enquiries, contact us at laura@stucube.com

If you think you'd love a stuCube, but can't afford to fund us, share us on facebook, and remind a close friend relative that your next birthday is already less than a year away ;)

And that’s all there is to it.

GET PUZZLING :)

INTRODUCING StuCube BIRTHDAY CUBE:

A 40 PIECE BIRTHDAY PUZZLE CUBE

FOR THAT SPECIAL SOMEBODYA VALENTINES DAY PUZZLE CUBE

 A 150 Piece StuCube

                           

Pieces are made from the ASCII Charecters

        StuCube's don't have to be cubes
All shapes, with mysterious objects inside
                    BRAIN TEASER'S

StuCube's are made of awesome shapes
Shapes that can turn into other toys, by assembling pieces,
found from inside a StuCube!

THAT'S SUPER AWESOME

story:
Update 22 July 2012

All contributions should have been refunded.

Thank you everyone for your support in trying to make this happen. Unfortunately it wasn't to be, but the project will still be worked on as best as can be managed.

If you wish to keep up with development, and other projects from A Rock Called Steve, you can follow @rockcalledsteve on Twitter or like the Facebook page - a website is still pending.

Thank you everyone! The support I have had, both financially and not, means a great deal to me and I hope that I can provide a good player experience when I release! 

                                                                            - Jon "Moose" Tetrino

        

Update 08 July 2012

I have released the first in a series of developer diaries! In this diary I talk about how  the core style of the environments you'll see in Spectrum was conceived. You can read it here!

 

What is Spectrum?

Spectrum is a side scrolling shooter that uses the nature of colour in computing to provide structure for the levels and visual feedback to the player.

In computing, colour is handled by the number of bits available to the computing system. The earliest computers were limited to a single bit - it was either off or on, so black and white (depending on the available monitor) were the only available display options. As computing power increased, the number of available hues and shades also increased - first four, then sixteen, and so on. Today, computers use as standard a 24-bit system, allowing for 16.7 million colours.

In Spectrum, these systems, or "palettes", are used as a method to separate the levels, as you fight through your world  in order to return what was stolen: Colour itself. Each target is its own shade - though some may look similar - and the further into the game you reach the larger the pool of targets to destroy.

With an art style based on the works of Piet Mondrian, you as the player receive visual feedback from the world itself. Your health, your ammo count, and even your level progress is shown to you via how the environment -and you - change. The goal, ultimately, is to limit the interface to the target reticule itself.

As a player you will be fighting your way to complete each colour palette from the very first bit to the 16-bit system. As you fight, you will progress and evolve with the colour, working your way from the cellular level through to the high atmosphere.

 

How will the money be spent?

After working on the design and early stages of Spectrum for the past few months alongside other (now complete) projects, it is my intention to go into full time production. What your money will allow me to do is cover the costs of living and some basics (such as setting up the website) that have currently been out of my financial reach.

By allowing me to go full time on the project, the quality of the product will be vastly improved, along with the speed of completion.

 

Where and when will you release?

The initial goal is to release the game on PC on various online distributors - primarily the Steam platform.

Depending on the success of Spectrum, it may be ported to Mac, phone and tablet systems. Whether this actually happens depends on the success of this pitch, and the success of the game itself.

There is no set release time for Spectrum. With the challenges of developing a game, I do not wish to place more undue stress on myself by setting a release date that if I miss will disappoint us all. It will be released when it's done, but the progress of development will be a public affair to all who show support. It will not be a silent process.

 

What do I get?

By showing your support, you'll have access to a newsletter detailing the progress of development.

By Pre-ordering Spectrum,  you get a digital, DRM-free PC copy of the game upon final release, along with also being signed up to the newsletter.

While the soundtrack is currently subject to large change from what you see in the video, if you throw in five bucks more you will also receive a full DRM-free copy of the soundtrack in FLAC.

Further perk points are still under consideration, including a hard copy of both the game and soundtrack.

Update 23rd June

Based on feedback from people interested, asking for this specific perk, anyone who donates $25 will be listed in the credits for Spectrum under a "Special Thanks" section.

Update 27th June

You asked for it you get it! Anyone who donates $50 or more will have their credit in anything A Rock Called Steve releases over the next two years - be it film, audio, or game related.

Those who have already donated $50 or more will be automatically bumped to this perk. Anyone who has donated less can bump themselves up by donating more if they wish!

Anyone who donated more than the perk they selected before higher perks were available will be bumped if they reached the next perk target.

 

Who are you?

I'm a visual artist who has worked in film and animation for the past five years, and I intend to branch into the independent gaming market as a portion of my life experience. Having been an avid game player for almost two decades now, it has been a want of mine for some time. Now, my experience and training in art, animation and project management allows it to become a reality.

 

Final Words

Thank you for spending the time to read this pitch, even if you decide not to show your support and fund the project. Despite having pitched ideas to big businessmen, TV executives and magazine editors, pitching to you  the general public - has filled me with more nerves than them all combined.

If you decide not to buy in, please at least share it! The more people who see this, the more likely this will succeed - so share, and share alike.

My twitter is very active, so if you wish to follow development (but without the detail of the newsletters) you can follow me @rockcalledsteve. I am very vocal to any who wish to chat, so feel free to ask questions.

Twitter Tag for Spectrum: #SpectrumGame

Facebook page for Spectrum

Facebook page for A Rock Called Steve

Facebook page for Jon "Moose" Tetrino

 

FAQ (Updated regularly):

How is scoring worked out?

Each level is scored based upon the percentage of targets killed in the stage. A fair comparison to the kind of result you expect would be the score system of the game REZ - Every kill counts to the percentage.

 

Is colour more than a visual gimmick?

Well, yes. The main point of the colour is to show your progress in a similar way to how a number will show your score in any number of arcade games. However, complimentary and clashing colours do have a benefit or punishment for the player and the enemies as the level progresses.

 

What about the pacing?

The alpha footage is slow. Very slow. I admit this, however it was a drawback of an early build - I struggled to get a recording at all, actually. The finished product will have a much quicker pace to the action, and it will challenge your co-ordination.

 

Linux?

Most probably yes, but I cannot promise.

 

Colourblind mode?

I am weighing up whether this is viable, but considering I have the entire spectrum of colour at my disposal I should be able to include such a mode. The problem will be making sure that every stage of the game is viable for a colourblind player.

 

Is colour purely aesthetic, or is there actually a point to things being different colours (and them coloring the background)?

It is primarily aesthetic, however I am intending on including pickups that change the colour you are firing - your basic bullet is white, so multi-spectral, however if you pick up say an Orange pickup, for a limited amount of time your bullets will be Orange, so they will do more damage to Blue targets (which are complimentary colours to Orange) and less to Purple, which is the clashing colour.

Other clashing colour pairs include Blue and Red, Yellow and Pink, Sky Blue and Pink, and so on.
story_txt:
Update 22 July 2012
All contributions should have been refunded.
Thank you everyone for your support in trying to make this happen. Unfortunately it wasn't to be, but the project will still be worked on as best as can be managed.
If you wish to keep up with development, and other projects from A Rock Called Steve, you can follow @rockcalledsteve on Twitter or like the Facebook page - a website is still pending.
Thank you everyone! The support I have had, both financially and not, means a great deal to me and I hope that I can provide a good player experience when I release! 
                                                                            - Jon "Moose" Tetrino
        
Update 08 July 2012
I have released the first in a series of developer diaries! In this diary I talk about how  the core style of the environments you'll see in Spectrum was conceived. You can read it here!
 
What is Spectrum?
Spectrum is a side scrolling shooter that uses the nature of colour in computing to provide structure for the levels and visual feedback to the player.
In computing, colour is handled by the number of bits available to the computing system. The earliest computers were limited to a single bit - it was either off or on, so black and white (depending on the available monitor) were the only available display options. As computing power increased, the number of available hues and shades also increased - first four, then sixteen, and so on. Today, computers use as standard a 24-bit system, allowing for 16.7 million colours.
In Spectrum, these systems, or "palettes", are used as a method to separate the levels, as you fight through your world  in order to return what was stolen: Colour itself. Each target is its own shade - though some may look similar - and the further into the game you reach the larger the pool of targets to destroy.
With an art style based on the works of Piet Mondrian, you as the player receive visual feedback from the world itself. Your health, your ammo count, and even your level progress is shown to you via how the environment -and you - change. The goal, ultimately, is to limit the interface to the target reticule itself.
As a player you will be fighting your way to complete each colour palette from the very first bit to the 16-bit system. As you fight, you will progress and evolve with the colour, working your way from the cellular level through to the high atmosphere.
 
How will the money be spent?
After working on the design and early stages of Spectrum for the past few months alongside other (now complete) projects, it is my intention to go into full time production. What your money will allow me to do is cover the costs of living and some basics (such as setting up the website) that have currently been out of my financial reach.
By allowing me to go full time on the project, the quality of the product will be vastly improved, along with the speed of completion.
 
Where and when will you release?
The initial goal is to release the game on PC on various online distributors - primarily the Steam platform.
Depending on the success of Spectrum, it may be ported to Mac, phone and tablet systems. Whether this actually happens depends on the success of this pitch, and the success of the game itself.
There is no set release time for Spectrum. With the challenges of developing a game, I do not wish to place more undue stress on myself by setting a release date that if I miss will disappoint us all. It will be released when it's done, but the progress of development will be a public affair to all who show support. It will not be a silent process.
 
What do I get?
By showing your support, you'll have access to a newsletter detailing the progress of development.
By Pre-ordering Spectrum,  you get a digital, DRM-free PC copy of the game upon final release, along with also being signed up to the newsletter.
While the soundtrack is currently subject to large change from what you see in the video, if you throw in five bucks more you will also receive a full DRM-free copy of the soundtrack in FLAC.
Further perk points are still under consideration, including a hard copy of both the game and soundtrack.
Update 23rd June
Based on feedback from people interested, asking for this specific perk, anyone who donates $25 will be listed in the credits for Spectrum under a "Special Thanks" section.
Update 27th June
You asked for it you get it! Anyone who donates $50 or more will have their credit in anything A Rock Called Steve releases over the next two years - be it film, audio, or game related.
Those who have already donated $50 or more will be automatically bumped to this perk. Anyone who has donated less can bump themselves up by donating more if they wish!
Anyone who donated more than the perk they selected before higher perks were available will be bumped if they reached the next perk target.
 
Who are you?
I'm a visual artist who has worked in film and animation for the past five years, and I intend to branch into the independent gaming market as a portion of my life experience. Having been an avid game player for almost two decades now, it has been a want of mine for some time. story:
We are going to restart this campaign soon on another famous crowdfunding website! Search for it! :)


Phoenix Force 1 vs Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer

PHOENIXES

In Phoenix Force 1, you are limited to using one of the 5 classic phoenixes and linearly upgrading their powers.

In Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer, you’ll be able to create your own phoenix! You can select the types of projectiles you want your phoenix to fire, the super power, and, of course, the visual appearance!

WORLD

In Phoenix Force 1, you have a linear world, and you can’t choose your next challenge;

In Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer, you’ll be able to select the team of bosses/guardians you want to attack!

BOSSES/GUARDIANS

In Phoenix Force 1, there are 13 boss creatures that come in bundles of up to 4 units. 

In Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer, there will be 30 boss creatures, in bundles of up to 7 units! Each boss will have up to 10 levels with significant visual changes! 

This will be possible due to changes in the animation rendering technique, that will decrease the memory usage by 90%, and increase the frame rate from 30fps to 60fps!

Graphics will also receive a major quality upgrade!

REPLAY VALUE

In Phoenix Force 1, you have 100 levels to beat and there is nothing more that is worth doing. The play value is of 4 hours.

In Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer, you’ll have 30 bosses to unlock and upgrade, 10 phoenix powers and 20 phoenix skins to unlock and 50 achievements to complete. It’ll take you months to unlock all of them!

SOCIAL

In Phoenix Force 1, you play alone and compare scores with your facebook friends.

In Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer, you cooperate with your friends on the battlefield, and you attack the nest of other players to steal their resources!

As a Stretch Goal, we want to add the Clan functionality to Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer!

AVAILABILITY

You can play Phoenix Force 1 right now on www.PhoenixForceGame.com

Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer is just an idea right now, that will only come to life if you contribute today! Don’t let to contribute on the last minute, contribute today and get perks at a discounted price! Ask your friends to help too! If you want Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer, you’ll be the one responsible for making it a become reality for all of us! 

The future of Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer is in your hands!

Phoenix Force 2: Multiplayer will be available for iOS, Android, Windows Phone and PC!


The Impact

The game is a consequence of a dream to collaborate and incentivate independent brazilian developers to reach their personal goals, developing games that bring the best experience with mobile and bring back the classic gameplays that we had with old school consoles, that are not classic just for the graphics, but for their soundtracks, remarkable gameplay and challenging difficulty.

Phoenix Force 1 is the proof that Awoker Games can deliver high quality games. We developed more than 25 games, and with your support we will work full time to make Phoenix Force Multiplayer the best shoot 'em up of all times!

Risks & Challenges

Phoenix Force Multiplayer will be our first game with complex multiplayer features. That's our biggest challenge in this project, but we are confident that we can overcome this hurdle, because most of the gameplay mechanics are already well defined on the first game, so we can focus on the multiplayer implementation.

Other Ways You Can Help

We believe that money doesn't buy everything, so sharing this page with your friends and making some noise about our campaign will help us reach a lot of players around the world!

If you can't pay using any of the provided payment methods, maybe your friends and family can make a contribution for both of you.

Your suggestions and opinions really matter for us! :D

What We Need & What You Get

To reach our objective, we will need $30 000 so we can design and develop a game that maintain the originality of Phoenix Force and add a cooperative battle mode with friends and a competitive system that can reach gamers world wide, connecting people for pure challenge and nostalgic gameplay!

Here’s the breakdown of how the money will be spent:

  • $16 000: Brazilian Staff Salaries - 3 people for 4 months

  • $1 000: Additional art contracting

  • $1 000: Music contracting

  • $250: Sound effects licensing;

  • $250: Software licensing

  • $3 900: IndieGoGo and Payment Processing Fees

  • $7 600: Manufacturing and Shipping Physical Rewards

By contributing to this game now, you'll get one or more of the following prizes:

  • Double the amount you paid in upgrade points (e.g. if you pay 10USD, you get 20USD of upgrade points).
  • STICKERS!
  • Game Soundtrack;
  • Exclusive poster;
  • Exclusive shirt;
  • Phoenix plush toy;
  • Exclusive in-game phoenix;
  • You'll be able to design a new guardian with us!
  • And even get to have lunch or dinner with us! :)

More details on the right collumn of this page.

If we don't reach the $30 000 goal, you get your money back!

story:
Our team consists of 5 key members: Our Team Leader and Sound Engineer, Our Team Leader and designer, Our Main Artist and Designer and our 2 Amazing Programmers. We all are just regular, ordinary,  people that got together to fulfill our dream of creating this wonderful app. This is only our first project that we wish to present to you. Down below you will have the possibility to get to know other future projects that we have in store for you. Unfortunately we are in a situation, where we are running out of our budget, that's why we are hoping that INDIEGOGO, with your help, will help us to release this app at the end of December, preferably before the New Year. Your support will help us to get proper audio equipment, The possibility to release this app on iOS, Android and Windows platforms. Due to the fact that all of us are constantly working on this project, your help will help our team to not give up on this project and so we can work on a full stomach. The financial support that we ask for is not out of this world. Thank you for taking the time to get to know a little bit more about us and our project. We hope you enjoy the preview and the gameplay video, as well as our fantastic pictures that our designers have provided.

Again, a huge Thank You and we will see you in the gaming world!

Yours truly

Proud Storm

Rocket Star is a 2D arcade game based on the space genre. The game gives the opportunity to fly trough space while evading comets, lasers and more! Try to achieve your highest score while collecting coins, boosts and other collectibles. Run away from aliens or make them Explode! Don't forget to check the achievements to get the most out of your play through. Try to finish all the missions. At most you will have 3 missions during one play through, but some may prove much more difficult than others, so you can selectively finish them or try to achieve all of them during one game and lots and lots of explosions. DON'T FORGET! Explosions are exiting, but they are also deadly! With this game we wanted to achieve something we would like to play ourselves, and we are close to fulfilling our dream!

 We hope you will enjoy our game as much as we do!

 

 Welcome to Rocket Star

 

Turrets are lean mean killing machines. There are several types of turrets.

There are over 6 types of power-ups. Use them to your advantage!

A lot of mines to blow up, use them to destroy aliens ships. Mines blows in chain reaction if used properly.

​

Better watch out, if you touch them you will lose. All animations are frame by frame drawn like a cartoon​.

​

All maps contain meteors and space debris​. Signs will guide you in the right direction!

Every design part is hand drawn, thank you designers!

 

RANDOM MAP GENERATOR!

Every time you start a new game, a new map will automatically be generated so you can never know, what interesting adventures lie ahead.

You also have the chance to: Customize your ship, Purchase Gadgets and helpers, Gather Collectibles, Run away from aliens or destroy them, BUT DON'T FORGET ABOUT THE EXPLOSIONS! More updates to come.

​Risks and challenges

It doesn't matter how much money we receive because we will always put in a 150% no matter what. We will constantly release updates to improve the game and its quality for our community. There are no risks, besides us starving. We have worked on this game for 6 months, day by day and we started with nothing. Our plan is to release the game in the end of December. I hope you love our game as much as we do!

 

TEAM PROUD STORM THANKS YOU!

 

Future project

 

 

​​
