story:
Ethi, a.k.a. Ethisole, Shidaysha, and Elsu is a nice person and a darned good PvP'er to boot.  But her set-up gives her about 15 fps, on a 4:3 monitor.  Think how good she could be with better hardware!

Ethi is a loyal Enforcer, is always helping the n00bs, and sets a great example for others.  If we all give a little, we can get her a nice, modern-day machine, and she will be even more of a positive force in PvP for enforcers!

story:
New fantasy races compatible with the 13th Age Roleplaying Game, The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, and other fantasy roleplaying games.

Check out our webpage for the latest information on this supplement and all future supplements in this product line.

What is the Tome of Races?

The Tome of Races is the first in a line of Annals of Ages products that are compatible with the 13th Age Roleplaying Game and The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. All content is also easily adaptable to any fantasy roleplaying game.

This first offering is a 96+ page full-color hardcover book containing 20+ original fantasy races. Every race in the book consists of the following:

  • a full-page, full-color male/female piece of art
  • rules specific boxed text compatible with 13th Age and The Pathfinder Roleplaying game
  • approximately 2 pages of racial information, including culture, gov't, history, etc.
  • approximately one page short story introducing the new race
  • half page full-color artwork of the race in action (e.g. battle scene)

We want to provide a large set of varied racial options that can be dropped into most any fantasy campaign setting. This is an invaluable resource for both players and game masters alike.



What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise for Annals of Ages: Tome of Races is going to pay our talented team of authors, our veteran artist, and for editing and layout. 

For your generous support, we are offering some fantastic rewards at every level.

$15: Credit in the book as a supporter, plus desktop wallpapers of every race

$25: PDF copy of the final book

$50: Printed copy of the final book. Plus playtester access to all materials as they are developed.

$100: Set of high quality collector cards of every race included in the book.

$150: T-shirt featuring the full-color racial artwork of your choice.

$250: Annals of Ages themed coffee mug and personal journal.

$500: Annals of Ages themed jigsaw puzzle and 2014 year calendar.

$1,000: Your race idea developed by our authors and included in the book with full-color artwork. Limit 3.

All rewards are cumulative. When you pledge a certain level, you also receive all rewards for the lower levels.


Stretch Goals

+3 New Icons: Three new icons that are related to new racial options will be added to the book. Each icon will have full-color artwork.

+5 Racial Options: An additional 5 races will be added to the book with full color artwork.

16 Page PDF Adventure: Our authors will write a 16-page PDF adventure to be sent to all backers.  This low-level adventure will highlight new races and new icons.

Additional stretch goals may be added if we reach all current goals.

The Team

Thomas J. Scott, Lead Designer/Editor/Layout

Thomas is a veteran writer with numerous RPG writing credits dating back to 2nd edition AD&D for the RPGA network. Thomas's most recent RPG writing credits include the following:

Tales of the 13th Age (Pelgrane Press)
Wyrd of the Wild Wood (Co-Author) (In Development)

Ashes of Athas Adventures (Wizards of the Coast)
AOA7-1 Ashes to Ashes (Co-Author)

Living Forgotten Realms Adventures (Wizards of the Coast)
EAST1-3 Unbidden (Author)
EAST2-3 Nightmares (Author)
NETH3-1 Secrets & Shadows (Author)
ELTU3-6 True Blue (Author)
EPIC3-3 The Tangled Skein of Destiny (Co-Author)
ABER4-3 A Little Rebellion (Author)
WATE4-1 Paying the Piper (Co-Author)

OSRIC Realms of Arkonus Adventures (Magique Productions)
The Forgotten Isle (Author/Editor/Layout)
Dark Raiders of Misty Ridge (Author/editor/Layout)
Advent of Darkness (Author/editor/Layout)
The Magic Balance (Co-Author/Editor/Layout)

Role-Playing Games (Magique Productions)
Caeron 3000: Science Fiction Role-Playing Game (Co-Author/Editor/Layout)

In addition to RPG writing, Thomas has also written for film and television. Most recently, Thomas co-wrote 2 episodes of a Las Vegas locally produced TV series called Galahad. And if you're a follower of the Star Trek fan film scene, you may recognize Thomas's name from Starship Farragut's Animated Episode: Power Source and Star Trek Excalibur's Homecoming.

Mickey Tan, Author

Living Forgotten Realms Adventures (Wizards of the Coast)
CORE5-4  Dark Lords of Oman (Co-Author) (In Development)
CORE5-5 Turning Point (Co-Author) (In Development)
NEVE5-3 Spider's Kiss (Co-Author) (In Development)
DALE1-6 The Vesperian Initiative (Author)
DALE2-4 Illsyldra (Author)
LURU2-3 Shadows of the Knights (Author)
IMPI2-4 Goblins Strike Back (Co-Author)
ABER4-1 The Price of Freedom (Co-Author)
CORE5-1 Churning Shadows (Co-Author)
ADCP5-1 Home's Last Light (Co-Author)
ADCP5-2 The Best Defense (Co-Author)
EPIC4-2 Age of Ruin (Co-Author)
NETH4-3 Purifying The Prophet (Co-Author)

In addition, Mickey has written for Xendrick Expeditions, the Eberron living campaign
in 3.5 (BWC-7 Test of Mettle)

Mickey also writes articles for the Muscle & Body and Wellbella print magazines.

Andy Schreck, Author

Andy Schreck is a freelance writer from Pittsburgh, PA and has an MS in Earth Science and a BS in Geology and Climatology. During his undergraduate studies he edited Exercises in Sedimentology workbook for California University Press (1986). Throughout the subsequent years his poetry and short stories have appeared in various online and regional print publications. In 1989 he wrote a module for the FASA Star Trek the Role Playing Game. It was left ultimately unpublished but the adventure nonetheless spread through many Star Trek fan clubs and organizations.

In 2005 he began writing screenplays for the science fiction Youtube series Starship Farragut produced by Farragut Films, Washington D.C. He has also contributed to the television drama Galahad produced by Magique Productions. Andy also is involved in development of future projects with Magique Productions, including several in conjunction with Pelgrane Press's 13th Age franchise.

Andy currently is primarily employed as a computer repair technician for the University of Pittsburgh which allows him to stay plugged into the current gaming scene as he is a member of multiple university gaming clubs and organizations.

Lawrence Augustine Mingoa, Author

Lawrence is a former editorial assistant for Vibal Publishing House, Inc. (PH). Lawrence's RPG related experiences and credits include:

* DM for Living Forgotten Realms

* Persuasions of the 13th Kind ( http://13persuasions.blogspot.com/ )

* A homebrew RPG system based off a challenge issued in Lawrence's Google+ circles called All About the Number
          Original and Modified (copyright pending)

* DM (13th Age) for Virtuacon 2013

Tales of the 13th Age (Pelgrane Press)
Wyrd of the Wild Wood (Co-Author) (In Development)

Travis Woodall, Author

Travis has a range of RPG experiences including creating his own patchwork Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles rules set using a combination of rules from Palladium, D&D Next and Feng Shui, along with a number of his own additions.

Adventure writing credits include:

Living Greyhawk Adventures (Wizards of the Coast)
URD7-08  Last Man Standing (Author)

Living Forgotten Realms Adventures (Wizards of the Coast)
CORE1-05 Touched by Darkness (Author)
EAST2-01 Ends and Means (Author)

Santiago Iborra, Artist

Santiago has been doing fantastic artwork for the gaming industry for many years. Some of his credits include the following:

Godslayer miniatures game (Megalith games)
Deadlands: 3000
JAGS
Lost Empires Role-Playing Game (Rogue Comet)
The Santharian Dream
Caeron 3000: Sci-Fi Role-Playing Game (Magique Productions)
Realms of Arkonus Adventure Modules (Magique Productions)
and more


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Here are some things you can do to help us:

  • Get the word out to your friends and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for all your support!
story_txt:
New fantasy races compatible with the 13th Age Roleplaying Game, The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, and other fantasy roleplaying games.

Check out our webpage for the latest information on this supplement and all future supplements in this product line.
What is the Tome of Races?
The Tome of Races is the first in a line of Annals of Ages products that are compatible with the 13th Age Roleplaying Game and The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. All content is also easily adaptable to any fantasy roleplaying game.
This first offering is a 96+ page full-color hardcover book containing 20+ original fantasy races. Every race in the book consists of the following:



a full-page, full-color male/female piece of art

rules specific boxed text compatible with 13th Age and The Pathfinder Roleplaying game

approximately 2 pages of racial information, including culture, gov't, history, etc.


approximately one page short story introducing the new race

half page full-color artwork of the race in action (e.g. battle scene)


We want to provide a large set of varied racial options that can be dropped into most any fantasy campaign setting. This is an invaluable resource for both players and game masters alike.

story:
A child reaches for the stars, burdened by circumstance. Folks chained by debt, indentured to the powers at large. Follow along through this alternate 1930's where mankind is thrust to the stars in this journey from backwater slums across the void of space and time.

Ira was the only son of a poor farming family, born to a divided society with little to stand on. He was destined to grow up to join his father in the Martian mines, and his ambitions to explore the stars were a distant, lofty dream.

As a child he watched humanity undertake their greatest endeavor, the Holocene project, as it departed from the Solar System to a new star; a place completely unfamiliar and impossibly distant. The feat left him in awe, but the harsh realities of life took priority as he grew up through a space age depression.

But Ira does travel to this star. Years later he wakes from stasis aboard the Holocene II, only to find himself the sole survivor of a catastrophic incident and left alone on a ghost ship floating on the outskirts of the Lithic System. Now in the place of his boyhood fantasies, his dreams quickly spiral out of control.

The system is flooded with a signal, interfering with electronics, playing tricks on the senses, and blurring the barriers of reality. The sound of that signal was something Ira knew as a boy, like a voice calling out to him across the void. He is deeply shaken and his memories are blurred, returning in flashes, shedding light on his murky past. Struggling to survive, Ira is cutoff and unable to return home. He travels through the Lithic System aboard the desolate, damaged Holocene II in search of rescue, answers, and above all, hope.

Where he expected to find hundreds of souls from the first Holocene mission Ira finds the abandoned remnants of once thriving research colonies. Only their ghostly trail remains, leading him through a labyrinth of mysteries, into the unknown toward truth no one was prepared to find. The Holocene’s mission was not what it seemed, its true purpose revealing itself as Ira uncovers the crew’s fate.

Ira will confront the questions that baffled and astounded the best of Earth’s minds, walking the path they mysteriously vanished from, and he will face his own past that lead him to this strange and alien place. Was it the guiding hand of fate that brought him here, his own will, or some other force in the depths of space?

Turn your ear to the music of the working man; cry with him as he laments the loss of this year's crops, a hard winter, the yearning for a better life. But rejoice with him as he sings of an adventurous spirit, the will that won the wild, and the desire to find what lies beyond...


Music will act as a guide as you navigate Ira’s world. Within Ira’s alternative history arises the folk music of those far from home in Martian mines, and the plight of a people left behind by the space faring few. This music will play the interludes of the story, carrying you across the various timelines in surreal transitions across time and space. Inspired by Appalachian mountain music and the blues of the Mississippi delta region, the soundtrack of early rural America is turned on its head when given a surreal treatment. Deep, airy ambiance fills the space between pensive banjo notes, mandolin chords echo into oblivion. The result is a feeling that connects the farms of Earth and the vast expanse of space, a feeling that is alien, yet familiar.

Point-and-click
Use point-and-click mechanics to navigate through a world of intimate 3D spaces as well as serene, minimalist landscapes. Allow a creeping tension to build in an immersive world as you explore alien landscapes, relive past events, and watch as the nature of reality becomes porous and untrustworthy.

Choosing a path 
Playing through multiple timelines, your choices can have far reaching effects as you interact with and play as an unusual cast of characters, guiding their way through a space age dust punk world.

Choices you make determine your relationship with other characters, who will be present for certain events in the story, and can even determine the fate of certain individuals. Combining our choice system with our multiple timelines will yield interesting outcomes, as making choices in retrospect can change what Ira will find in the Lithic System. This retrospective change is what really makes Ira different than other games that allow for player choice. It’s less about cursing yourself for a choice that was made and more about looking for avenues in which to influence the future (it won’t be easy though).


Risks & Challenges

Creating an experience like Ira takes a lot of work. We're a small team, but we're driven and united by a shared passion to see this project through and create something beautiful to share with the world. The task is huge, but we come to the table with a diverse set of skills. We are as much game developers as we are artists, musicians and writers. This paired with the direction of the game allows us to do everything in-house, and see every aspect through, from inception to implementation.

We understand our collective and individual strengths. We have created and tested all mechanics, production methods, and platform implementation. The only way this project will not be completed is if an act of God occurs, such as death, traumatic brain injuries, and other such unsavory events we hope will never come to pass.

story:
Thanks to everyone for your great support & enthusiasm! This campaign is over, but because of you, we're moving forward and you can order guns here:

AirForce BlowGuns™


AirForce BlowGuns™ may be the most effective foam dart guns ever made! Can shoot 100 feet, are ridiculously fast & intensely accurate.



Check out the speed measured at Jake's Archery!

Hitting Our Target. In case you're new to Indiegogo, our campaign works on an all-or-nothing basis. That means we have until December 4th to meet our goal of $39,000. So, if Wednesday the 4th comes and we are only at $38,999 ($1 short of the goal) the project dies. We won't be able to move forward, you won't receive your soon-to-be coveted Zombie Apocalypse Control Kit or be the envy of all your foam dart friends, your money will be returned, and we will all be left with just our dreams (oh and a $15,000 mold for a paper weight). 

Riding Shotgun. We're not asking for a handout. We want you to be a part of the project! Take a look at the pictures and videos. If you think these guns are as awesome as we do, you can help bring them out of hiding and into production by purchasing one, two, or six :) of them and help us meet our factory minimums. If you like the project but don't feel the need for a gun, there are other fun perks for being a supporter. 

Pulling Out the Big Guns. This whole project started because we love to play as a family, especially stuff that get us up and moving and away from electronics. So for Christmas a few years ago, we bought some Nerf guns. Our kids loved the concept, but the performance was so disappointing that we created our own guns. Our patent pending design increased the range, speed, and accuracy. Better yet, we got rid of all the springs, gears, and levers that complicate the gun and break easily. Our guns really "blew" away the competition! As we played with neighbors and friends, it only took a round or two for them to put down their gun and come looking for any extras we had. We checked into mass production, but it was $15,000 just for the mold! That made it a little unrealistic for us to produce the guns for Christmas, birthday gifts, and neighborhood games. That's where you come in.

Get Fired Up! Like we said before, there are lots of fun ways to support the project. You can choose from buying the iTunes hit single "Shootin' in the Dark," to stickers, a t-shirt, or a Zombie Apocalypse Control Kit featuring the only gun really capable of making the head shot necessary to take out a Zombie. 

What if you hate Zombies? No problem, there are a million other games you can play with this high performance shooter, limited only by your imagination.

We Won't Blow It (your money, that is). We will use 100% of the pledge amount combined with our own funds, for the mold and to meet the minimum order quantities.

Show Me Your Guns. We built a few prototypes and have a patent pending on the very best one. After some rigorous testing by friends and relatives, we sent the drawings and prototype to the factory to create a mold. The guns will be produced from ABS plastic (the eco friendly kind) and look similar to the guns used in our videos. 

Darts. We tested a lot of different darts, and have included the one that performed the best. You can also shoot Nerf N-Strike darts in our guns, but we think you'll be much happier with the performance of our darts (and our gun). 


Setting our Sights. Here is the timeline we are working from to make sure we deliver on target.

October: Factory produces mold from drawings. 

November: Mold is finished, testing and tweaks completed. 

December: Final mold approved. Production of guns begins.

January: Guns are shipped. You amaze your friends with the power and accuracy of your new foam dart gun, enjoy interactive play with friends and family, and the tide turns in favor of the humans in Human vs. Zombie games at colleges across the nation. 

The Hit Men (and Women)

Say hello to our team!

Zac Poulter. Owner of XAX deSIGN and constant creator in the Poulter household. Zac is responsible for the design and creation of the guns, as well as the dream to get them produced.

Becky Poulter. The left brain half of the Zac and Becky team. Becky crunches the numbers, writes the copy, communicates with the backers, and keeps the rest of the team organized to make sure we deliver what we've promised.


Zac & Becky

Brooklyn Poulter. Recent BYU graduate in Music/Dance/Theater, and provider of music, lyrics & vocals for "Shootin' in the Dark" featured in the opening video. With all the buzz about an impending Zombie Apocalypse, we thought it would be fun to make a Zombie music video. So we commissioned Brooklyn (who recently released an album on iTunes) to write a song for it. Her first response was, "Dad, I hate Zombies. I don't think I can write a song about that." A little while later, she jumped up and went running into the music room yelling, "It's coming!" and Shootin' in the Dark was born. 

Brooklyn

Normandy Poulter. Sophomore in BYU's Illustration program. Keeping things in the family, we commissioned Normandy to illustrate Shootin' in the Dark. We hope you have as much fun watching as we did putting it together.

Normandy

Hawkes & Sicily Poulter, Rigo & McKenna Yturriaga. Enthusiastic product testers and fulfillment specialists. Need we say more? Your support will mean lots of good, hard work for them – stuffing, labeling, and shipping your Zombie Control Kits 

Hawkes & Sicily

Rigo & McKenna

Loren & Tina Spendlove. Suppliers, mentors and friends. We are new to this type of project and the support and encouragement from the Spendloves has been more like friends than suppliers. We're just grateful they are both!

Risks and challenges

Pulling the Trigger  The biggest risk for us on the project was deciding to go for it and produce the mold! We knew we would have to come up with funds for that before we could launch our campaign, and it was a little scary to make the first move. But we have had so much fun with the guns, we decided to jump in with both barrels.

We secured a supplier who has a great working relationship with the factory that is building the mold and producing the guns. If needed, our supplier also has secondary sources.

After the project funds, we'll be having a giant fulfillment party, hiring our children to do menial labor which will help them with funds AND motivation for their future education ;). We also have a fulfillment company standing by in case we are not able to handle everything in a timely way from the home base.

We promise not to leave you "Shooting in the Dark."  We'll be communicating all along the way. We'll tell you how production is coming and when we expect the shipment to arrive. We'll also post pictures of our late night fulfillment parties, and comments from satisfied customers (that's you!)
story_txt:
Thanks to everyone for your great support & enthusiasm! This campaign is over, but because of you, we're moving forward and you can order guns here:

AirForce BlowGuns™


AirForce BlowGuns™ may be the most effective foam dart guns ever made! Can shoot 100 feet, are ridiculously fast & intensely accurate.








Check out the speed measured at Jake's Archery!
Hitting Our Target. In case you're new to Indiegogo, our campaign works on an all-or-nothing basis. That means we have until December 4th to meet our goal of $39,000. So, if Wednesday the 4th comes and we are only at $38,999 ($1 short of the goal) the project dies. We won't be able to move forward, you won't receive your soon-to-be coveted Zombie Apocalypse Control Kit or be the envy of all your foam dart friends, your money will be returned, and we will all be left with just our dreams (oh and a $15,000 mold for a paper weight). 



Riding Shotgun. We're not asking for a handout. We want you to be a part of the project! Take a look at the pictures and videos. If you think these guns are as awesome as we do, you can help bring them out of hiding and into production by purchasing one, two, or six :) of them and help us meet our factory minimums. If you like the project but don't feel the need for a gun, there are other fun perks for being a supporter. 
Pulling Out the Big Guns. This whole project started because we love to play as a family, especially stuff that get us up and moving and away from electronics. So for Christmas a few years ago, we bought some Nerf guns. Our kids loved the concept, but the performance was so disappointing that we created our own guns. Our patent pending design increased the range, speed, and accuracy. Better yet, we got rid of all the springs, gears, and levers that complicate the gun and break easily. Our guns really "blew" away the competition! As we played with neighbors and friends, it only took a round or two for them to put down their gun and come looking for any extras we had. We checked into mass production, but it was $15,000 just for the mold! That made it a little unrealistic for us to produce the guns for Christmas, birthday gifts, and neighborhood games. That's where you come in.
Get Fired Up! Like we said before, there are lots of fun ways to support the project. You can choose from buying the iTunes hit single "Shootin' in the Dark," to stickers, a t-shirt, or a Zombie Apocalypse Control Kit featuring the only gun really capable of making the head shot necessary to take out a Zombie. 




What if you hate Zombies? No problem, there are a million other games you can play with this high performance shooter, limited only by your imagination.
We Won't Blow It (your money, that is). We will use 100% of the pledge amount combined with our own funds, for the mold and to meet the minimum order quantities.
Show Me Your Guns. We built a few prototypes and have a patent pending on the very best one. After some rigorous testing by friends and relatives, we sent the drawings and prototype to the factory to create a mold. The guns will be produced from ABS plastic (the eco friendly kind) and look similar to the guns used in our videos. 
Darts. We tested a lot of different darts, and have included the one that performed the best. You can also shoot Nerf N-Strike darts in our guns, but we think you'll be much happier with the performance of our darts (and our gun). 

Setting our Sights. Here is the timeline we are working from to make sure we deliver on target.
October: Factory produces mold from drawings. 
November: Mold is finished, testing and tweaks completed. 
December: Final mold approved. Production of guns begins.
January: Guns are shipped. You amaze your friends with the power and accuracy of your new foam dart gun, enjoy interactive play with friends and family, and the tide turns in favor of the humans in Human vs. Zombie games at colleges across the nation. 
The Hit Men (and Women)
Say hello to our team!
Zac Poulter. Owner of XAX deSIGN and constant creator in the Poulter household. Zac is responsible for the design and creation of the guns, as well as the dream to get them produced.
Becky Poulter. The left brain half of the Zac and Becky team. Becky crunches the numbers, writes the copy, communicates with the backers, and keeps the rest of the team organized to make sure we deliver what we've promised.

Zac & Becky

Brooklyn

Normandy
Hawkes & Sicily Poulter, Rigo & McKenna Yturriaga. Enthusiastic product testers and fulfillment specialists. Need we say more? Your support will mean lots of good, hard work for them – stuffing, labeling, and shipping your Zombie Control Kits

Rigo & McKenna

Pulling the Trigger  The biggest risk for us on the project was deciding to go for it and produce the mold! We knew we would have to come up with funds for that before we could launch our campaign, and it was a little scary to make the first move. But we have had so much fun with the guns, we decided to jump in with both barrels.
We secured a supplier who has a great working relationship with the factory that is building the mold and producing the guns. If needed, our supplier also has secondary sources.

story:
Swimming Teddybears, what is it?

Swimming Teddybears is an action 2D mobile game with a sweet look and chilling climate. You tap on teddybears swimming in the water, in order to rescue them from drowning.

There are 3 game modes:

  • Most fascinating and competitive is the hot seat. One has to rescue as many teddybears as he can in a limited time, and then next one takes his turn. It is really fun experience for up to 4 players on one device. Great for parties because it keeps you together, is easy to learn, and puts you in a good mood.
  • Online mode is a quick match between two players. Global ranking is an interesting part of it.
  • Single player mode takes player to Teddylake. Rules are simple: try to rescue all teddybears, while camera is moving up the lake.


Cute animals in the game

Swimming Teddybears is not only about teddys. There will be much more sweet animals to save! At this moment we are sure to put in the game:

  • teddys

  • kitties

  • pandas

There could be more animals in the game (see the last perk).



There will be hats also. What for?

Do you see a box in the gif picture above? You can find one while playing. Tap on it to get a gift! What will you get exactly? Hmm... Swimming Teddybears is all about good fun and about experience the sweetness of little animals. To add more of it, we let animals wear stylish hats! Just take a look:



These are 3 of 7 hats currently available to get in the game. And we are still making more!


About us

We are two brothers, students from Poland. We study during the day, and programming at night. Our journey with games started years ago, but we've made only little games, rather for us and our friends than for a whole world :). But a couple of months ago, when we have made another little game, and everyone loved it, we decided to make it a full, awesome game and release it. Now we are at the end, and we are proud that we can show you what we have made.


    Why IndieGoGo?

    Swimming Teddybears is almost done. It will be fully released after the end of this campaign. We have even released a smaller version on windows 10 mobile already (you can check it at https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps/swimming-teddybears/9nblggh5ft1s).
    So why do we need IndieGoGo? As we said, we are students. We've took some jobs previously to make a living, but today we are almost ran out of money. Of course it is possible to take a part-time job and continue to make Swimming Teddybears in our free time. But it is not as comfortably as full-time work. To make the game perfect we need your support. 3000$ is a minimum for food, rent etc., and for the rewards we are including in this campaign (I'm talking about nice mugs; check the perks). Here is how we'll use this money:


                                        


    Join us...

    ... and get some nice rewards. If you want to help us, then we want to give something to you. We've prepared promo codes you can use in Swimming Teddybears after game release. They will remove ads, and unlock content like additional animals or rescue wheels (pirate wheel, golden wheel etc.). There are also mugs with a cute picture on. Check it out:

                                                   


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Follow us on twitter and/or facebook.
    • Help us to get noticed at Thunderclap (http://thndr.me/WY8MuN).


    Stretch goals

    We would really appreciate if you support us in just making Swimming Teddybers. But after that, there is more to do. We have many ideas what to do if we raise more than we need. For now, don't worry about it. First goal is the most important at the moment.

story:
Dire Boar Games is happy to announce our new Point and Click Adventure:

 

(We even have a trademark: http://www.trademarkia.com/reality-incognita-86...)

(AND WE PASSED GREENLIGHT: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...)

Reality Incognita is still in development, and We Want To FINISH IT!  It is currently in it’s Alpha release, and you can download the demo here:

http://www.indiedb.com/games/reality-incognita/...

Or you prefer to see gameplay videos? We have them:

 

 

Reality Incognita is a retro-style PC game inspired by our love for vintage games.  Style-wise, it is similar to “Alien Virus” and “Return to Mysterious Island”.  The player wakes up with amnesia, in some kind of ship.  She doesn’t know what kind of ship it is, where it is going, or why she is on the ship.  She doesn’t even remember her name.

The game uses this environment of complete mystery to allow the player to start discovering things about themselves.  Our starting place is a cryo chamber that includes a dead body in one of the pods, and several empty pods, one of which has been smashed by someone.  This homage to movie favorites Event Horizon and Alien is complete right down to the player’s initial clothing.

As the player begins to examine their surroundings, you’ll enjoy adventure gameplay using a standard HUD that allows you to examine locations and artifacts within the scenes, open and close doors/hatches/pods, taking inventory items, and using them.  Later in the game the player will be able to build things out of various inventory items and use the construction as a separate inventory item!

Another great part of Reality Incognita is the dialogue options where the player interacts with computers and robots, trying to discover more about who and where they are.  The player gets to enjoy that vintage adventure vibe, which you just don’t see much of any more.  The in game conversations are long, and heavily branched, just like conversations IRL.  We have found that with Reality Incognita, the vintage vibe works really well within our intellectually charged setup.

Reality Incognita includes many vintage Adventure Game Features that you just don’t see in newer games.  For instance, there are multiple solutions for quests, though some might lead to Trap Situations.
The user might accidentally waste an item that they need later, with no warning from the game.  If the player needs it later, they will not be able to find it.  There is even the potential of wasting substantial trying to recover the item, and losing the game due to the absence of the item.  Older gamers may remember these kinds of traps in Sierra’s “King Quest 6: Heir Today, Gone Tomorrow”.


Conversely, the player will also pick up some items that will merely burden them, and cause them to think too much of how to use it, when there is no use for it at all.
Finally, the ultimate Trap Situation is Perma-Death, with no retry buttons.

These vintage Adventure Game Features create more threats and opportunities to lose, which significantly spices up the game play.


WHERE WE’RE AT

As you can see from the download, we still have a ways to go before we can offer a complete adventure gaming experience.  We still need to finalize the graphics, and several areas of the ship to be used in gameplay.  But even with the downloadable demo, you can see that that sound, music, and awesome voice acting already present a very well-defined game.
Once we have the resources to complete it, Reality Incognita promises an engaging Space Horror Adventure in the style of vintage Point and Click games.  With your support, we’ll be able to complete Reality Incognita and present Adventure Horror Fans with a Game Worth Playing!

 

THE DIRE BOAR GAMES TEAM

Dire Boar Games is a truly global and multicultural team.  I live in Israel, and I’m the Programmer, Story Writer, and overall Boss.  I work with freelancers in:
India – 3D Modeling
Vietnam – Cutscenes and Images
Serbia – Music
England – Voice Actress

 I learned to program and create games just so I could bring my concept of Reality Incognita to life.  It has taken my team a year to bring the game to its current state, and I know that with Your Indiegogo resources we can have the game complete, and ready to distribute, in two more years!
The funds raised here will be used to feed and support myself and my International team of Artists, Composers and Actors so that you will be able to play the complete version of Reality Incognita very soon.


WHY INVEST IN REALITY INCOGNITA FROM DIRE BOAR GAMES?

If you look at many of the other games that are seeking crowdfunding, you’ll see resource needs in Millions of Dollars.  When you support a game like that, it could be a number of years before you see your game launched.
With Reality Incognita you can participate in funding a less resource-hungry project that will be done quickly, so you’ll be able to take pride in supporting it’s release in just two years!  Believe me, funding this project and seeing it succeed is going to make you feel GREAT!

 

HOW DOES THE CROWDFUNDING WORK?

This is not a Fixed Funding campaign.  If we become fully funded, we will finish and distribute the game quickly.  If we are only partially funded, every dime we receive will go to the completion of Reality Incongnita.  It will simply take longer to complete and launch.  
But because the amount of resources we need to complete the game is fairly low compared to most games, I’m sure that you and your friends will help us complete Reality Incognita in record time.


HOW CAN YOU HELP?

There are 3 things you can do to help us, and I hope you’ll do both!


First

Our budget is only $50,000.  Indiegogo will take 8% of that so that they can continue to offer and support this wonderful crowdfunding platform. That leaves us with $46,000 that will be directed 100% into the completion and launch of Reality Incognita.
I really hope you’ll support us.  See below for all the rewards for different levels of participation!


Second

If you are at all interested or excited to help us reach our goal, PLEASE holler at all your friends and neighbors on social media so they can check this out and decide if they’d like to help us out like you have!

And third

 If you really want to help Reality Incognita go live, help us get Greenlighted on Steam:

Reality Incognita on Steam


LET’S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!


I can’t tell you how excited I am about this game.  If you can find it in your heart to support a small, vintage Point and Click Adventure Game, you’ll also be able to see what other kinds of games we come up with in the future!
Thanks with all my heart.
Evgenie

YOUR REWARDS!


 $2 Stargazer Unlimited: A heartfelt Thank You email from the Dire Boar Games team! 

$5 Wanna-Be Astronomer:  Stargazer + Music from the game separately!
 $10 Astronomy Student: Wanna-Be Astronomert + Wallpaper of Reality Incognita!
 $15 Astronomy Doctorate: Astronomy Student + a Digital Copy of Reality Incognita.
 $20 Martian Lore Fan: Astronomy Doctorate + you'll have a chance to start playing earlier with Alpha\Beta Access
 $25 Martian Theoretic: Martian Lore Fan + Art from the game, like sketches and different objects and items drawings.
 $30 Martian Colonization Expert: Martian Theoretic + Crew Dossier: Digital Book about Reality incognita game characters!
 $35 The Curiosity Operator: Martian Colonization Expert + you will be placed in game Credits
 $50 Mars Pioneer: Curiosity Operator + Crew Dossier: Audiobook, the actress who is voicing Reality Incognita protagonist will read the Dossier for you.
 $60 Mars Colonist: Mars Pioneer + Physical Copy. Aren't physical copies more lucrative?
 $75 Mars Old-Timer: Mars Colonist + Crew Dossier: Printed Book. The Crew dossier, but not as file, but as a real book!
 $90 Mars Noble: Mars Old-Timer + a big physical Poster of Reality Incognita to place on the wall.
$250 Red Planet Native: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 1 Year!
 $400 Scarlet Dunes Sleeper: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 2 Years!
 $550 Crimson Sands Ancient: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 3 Years!
 $700 Emperor of Sands: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 4 Years!
 $850 Supreme Martian: All rewards + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 5 Years!

 

Important:

1) Banners for websites with following materials (but not limited to) will NOT be accepted: adult content, religion, extremist material, gambling, drinking, narcotics, insulting to any kind of ethical group, recruitment to military organization, and those forbidden by Israel law.

2) All rewards except: "thank you", "alpha\beta access" and banners will be delivered only after the full game is complete.

That leaves us with $46,000 that will be directed 100% into the completion and launch of Reality Incognita.I really hope you’ll support us.  See below for all the rewards for different levels of participation!SecondIf you are at all interested or excited to help us reach our goal, PLEASE holler at all your friends and neighbors on social media so they can check this out and decide if they’d like to help us out like you have!And third If you really want to help Reality Incognita go live, help us get Greenlighted on Steam:Reality Incognita on Steam
LET’S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!I can’t tell you how excited I am about this game.  If you can find it in your heart to support a small, vintage Point and Click Adventure Game, you’ll also be able to see what other kinds of games we come up with in the future!Thanks with all my heart.EvgenieYOUR REWARDS! $2 Stargazer Unlimited: A heartfelt Thank You email from the Dire Boar Games team! $5 Wanna-Be Astronomer:  Stargazer + Music from the game separately! $10 Astronomy Student: Wanna-Be Astronomert + Wallpaper of Reality Incognita! $15 Astronomy Doctorate: Astronomy Student + a Digital Copy of Reality Incognita. $20 Martian Lore Fan: Astronomy Doctorate + you'll have a chance to start playing earlier with Alpha\Beta Access $25 Martian Theoretic: Martian Lore Fan + Art from the game, like sketches and different objects and items drawings. $30 Martian Colonization Expert: Martian Theoretic + Crew Dossier: Digital Book about Reality incognita game characters! $35 The Curiosity Operator: Martian Colonization Expert + you will be placed in game Credits $50 Mars Pioneer: Curiosity Operator + Crew Dossier: Audiobook, the actress who is voicing Reality Incognita protagonist will read the Dossier for you. $60 Mars Colonist: Mars Pioneer + Physical Copy. Aren't physical copies more lucrative? $75 Mars Old-Timer: Mars Colonist + Crew Dossier: Printed Book. The Crew dossier, but not as file, but as a real book! $90 Mars Noble: Mars Old-Timer + a big physical Poster of Reality Incognita to place on the wall.$250 Red Planet Native: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 1 Year! $400 Scarlet Dunes Sleeper: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 2 Years! $550 Crimson Sands Ancient: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 3 Years! $700 Emperor of Sands: Mars Noble + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 4 Years! $850 Supreme Martian: All rewards + Your Name on a Banner on our website for 5 Years! Important:1) Banners for websites with following materials (but not limited to) will NOT be accepted: adult content, religion, extremist material, gambling, drinking, narcotics, insulting to any kind of ethical group, recruitment to military organization, and those forbidden by Israel law.2) All rewards except: "thank you", "alpha\beta access" and banners will be delivered only after the full game is complete.

story:
There's no reasoning with zombies so dealing with them means turn-based tactical combat as shown in the video below.

Death Becomes All comes with procedural generators for villages, towns, people, zombies, and even an open world campaign with multiple endings. A rich new fantasy setting is procedurally generated for every new game.

Below is a 1 minute video of randomly generated villages in the game.  This is work in progress, with more building varieties coming, including special purpose buildings like inns, taverns, forges, temples, etc.  Towns, ruins, caverns, and other quest locations will also be randomly generated in the game.

Much of the flavor and variety of tactical combat comes from the card-based character development system.  Ability cards are a fun way to provide a rich variety of interactions with both the strategic open world game play and the tactical turn-based combat. 

Please note that this is not a collectable card game to sell random card packs.  The game comes with sufficient cards to play the campaign.  Each expansion to the game comes with a fixed set of new cards along with new 3D models and animations that adds more variety and flavor oriented around certain themes, quests, or locations, like board game expansions.

Zombies are not the only threat.  The realm is inhabited by other fantasy monstrosities, living and undead, that jealously guard their treasures and secrets.

Bands of the living roam the cursed land, each to its own purpose.  Are they friend or foe?

Build sustainable sanctuaries to house characters and store supplies.  Assign tasks like healing and crafting to various characters in your sanctuary to further your goals.  Talk to rescued villagers to gather information about the world and plan your next move on the campaign map.

Every new game takes place on a randomly generated campaign map with towns, villages, ruins, temples, forges, castles, caverns, and other adventure areas. Characters choose their own path through the world, discovering places and lore that reveal several different endings from which they can choose to pursue.

Heroes are characters with extraordinary abilities and hard-to-get equipment who can be recruited during each campaign.  Each hero has a personal quest.  Completing the quest will make the hero available as a starting character in all future games.  Hero of the Realm backers will receive the following exclusive heroes.

Hero of the Realm backers will get the following rare or better gear for your extra support of this campaign.

The Digital Strategy Guide is included with the Hero of the Realm package.  It provides helpful hints and strategies for all facets of game play, from the open world strategic campaign to the turn-based tactical combat to character development.  In addition, this guide will include stories and backgrounds on the various characters, factions and monsters in the game along with a full inventory of all ability cards shipped with the game and a plethora of full color artworks.

Reward: Backer Exclusive Cave Ogre Monster Set

Powerful and brutal cave ogres are found only in the realms where our backers adventure.

Reward: Custom Painted Backer Exclusive Ability Cards

All backers will get three rare abilities, two epic abilities, and one legendary ability, all with backer exclusive with custom painted art.  These abilities and their custom art will be determined by the time the is game released.

Reward: Free Werewolves of the Apocalypse Expansion

All backers will receive the "Werewolves of the Apocalypse" expansion for free when it becomes available.  What was once a curse is now a blessing with the undead invasion.  Werewolves are immune to the zombie plague, and their magical nature means their claws can tear through all manners of undeads with ease. 

Succumb to the ancient call of the beast to gain its fearsome powers against the undead horde.  This expansion allows characters to recruit werewolves and/or become werewolves themselves in the fight against the undeads.

Before going to crowd funding we want to make sure that all technical risks are eliminated and that we can complete the game. We've implemented much of the most complicated parts of the game, namely the turn-based tactical combat system and the generators for people, zombies, villages, and campaigns.  We have also built the content pipeline for the game and integrated a lot of content.  What remains are to produce the rest of the content, flesh out all of the quest and adventure areas, and fine-tune the game play.  That is still substantial work, but there is no technical risk, and we can do this with your support.

story:
Our Mission:

  We at Spiral Anime & Games seek to bring the joys of anime and tabletop gaming to as many as we possibly can. We envision a storefront that welcomes new and old fans alike to come by, relax and enjoy the media they love with others. Do you want to come watch your favorite anime with others? Read your favorite stories in a calm and welcoming environment? Compete against others in casual and competitive play? Participate in store and fan operated social events? Discuss the latest releases, strategies, stories and anything else related to anime and tabletop gaming? We encourage all of this and more. Spiral Anime & Games will become a home away from home for all those who love these media.

Our Location:

  Spiral Anime & Games will be located in Sayreville, NJ, just off County Route 535. Being close enough to New York City as well as being located near such convention areas like the Garden State Exhibit Center, the home of the AnimeNEXT convention, our target market is well within traveling distance. 

Allocation of Funds:

The following is an excerpt from the Spiral Anime & Games business plan detailing the start-up costs after loans are received.

Start-Up Inventory

Anime DVDs

$3,775.99

Anime Library

$1,488.88

Table Top Games

$4,478.88

Japanese Snacks

$418.25

Anime Bags

$608.90

Anime Pillows

$437.23

Anime T-Shirts

$285.84

Anime Key Chains

$768.62

Anime Plush

$742.00

Anime Wall Art/Posters

$996.16

Anime Jewelry & Necklaces

$509.94

Phone Accessories

$213.13

Anime Mouse Pads

$219.90

Anime Figurines

$1,945.12

Anime Wallets

$305.17

Anime Pins & Buttons

$238.00

Manga

$3,372.15

Manga Library

$2,453.57

Tentative Total

$23,257.73

Start-Up Overview

Start-Up Inventory

$23,257.73

Start-Up Assets

$20,110.01

Start-Up Expenses

$41,775.15

Tentative Total

$85,142.89

Sources

Owner’s investment

$15,000.00

Crowd Funding

$15,000.00

Bank Loan (SBA)

$55,142.89

Total

$85,142.89

Operations:

Spiral Anime & Games will offer a variety of products and services featured within the storefront. They are as follows:

·  Online store : Shipping and In store Pickup  (For your "Not so close" purchases) 

·  Anime

·  Manga

·  Assorted anime apparel

·  Magic: The Gathering

·  Yu-Gi-Oh

·  Cardfight: Vanguard

·  Assorted trading card games

·  Role Playing Games

·  Store and fan run events

·  Anime & Manga Rentals

The Perks: 

The Founder's Keychain:

The Founder's USB:

The Spiral Shirt:


Why Indiegogo:

  Upon exploring Indiegogo, we've seen countless ideas; dreams and ambitions come to fruition through the generous backing of the site’s community. It’s become apparent to us that the individuals who frequent this site’s campaigns are ones who believe causes like ours are worth fighting for. We are hopeful that through fighting we can make this dream of ours a reality.

Why Fixed Funding:

    We believe this to be the most honest way to receive donations from a crowd funding platform. You, the funder, shouldn't be making an investment that you won’t get back if we don’t succeed. We want to make an anime and tabletop gaming store that you will be proud to have donated to. Without your support, none of this would be possible.

Will $15,000 be enough:

  The purpose of this campaign is to jump start the creation of this idea. Upon instruction at the Small Business Development Center at Brookdale College concerning small business loans, we were instructed to have half of the funds we requested on hand. With your generous funding, we will be able to successfully apply for the loans needed to commence our project. We look forward to reaching and even surpassing our goal through your support.

Why should you help:

  Anime and tabletop gaming are two mediums that never fail to bring people together. Spiral Anime & Games will create an ideal environment for the public that loves these media. You should help if you support the growth of these entertainments and their community. Every donation received will further the creation of our vision.

Thank you:

  Spiral Anime & Games is an idea that will bring people together by providing a social outlet dedicated to anime and tabletop games. Our true goal is to build a community that strives to keep the media we all know and love growing ever stronger.  Any questions or concerns you might have, please ask us within the comments. Thank you so much for all of your time and support!

The Owners: 

·  Jesse Schickler – Business Management major and graduate of the College of Staten Island. Anime, Manga and card game enthusiast. 

Favorite Anime: Full Metal Alchemist

Favorite Manga: Groove Adventure Rave

Favorite Card Game: Magic: The Gathering

Favorite Tabletop: D&D 

·  Gregory Lombardo – Bio-Molecular and Chemical Engineering major and graduate of the Polytechnical Institute of New York University. Anime, card and tabletop game enthusiast. 

Favorite Anime: Cowboy Bebop

Favorite Card Game: Cardfight: Vanguard 

Favorite Tabletop: Zombies!!!

story:
Game Developed by ADHD Mom

Neuroscientist

Featured in Mommy Minutes (CTNow)

Being a mom who understands how hard it is living with ADHD, a neuroscientist, and a serial entrepreneur, I knew I had to find a way to help my family and other families living with ADHD. By understanding living with ADHD, I developed this game to benefit kids having trouble with attention and planning and connect learning with school-related actions. Beyond benefits though, if a game isn't fun what's the point? So our team of a PhD neuroscientist, a board certified behavioral analyst with PhD (autism/ADHD) and game developers built in an equal amount of fun, making the game as exciting as other games kids already play.

The top comments from other moms when they learn of our game are, "It's about time!" and "I wish this game had been available when my child was younger."

How else can you improve you child's attention and planning for $20? While our $20 perk lets you pre-purchase our game, other brain training games for ADHD cost $1,000 to $2000 plus fees of hundreds of dollars per hour since games can only be played in-office. While we are a tiny startup working hard to get our first product out to you, we believe we are startup with a conscience and a mission to make the world a better place. Read about us in Mommy Minutes CTNow. Buy your game perk today! Game only available here. We do not guarantee it will be available elsewhere at any other time. PayPal account not necessary to purchase game perks. Games anticipated to be delivered September 2014, beta testers receive game August 2014.


An ADHD Skills Booster Game:

What's The Game About?

This project is an action/strategy single player racing video game iPad app designed to improve attention and planning skills in teens (suggested ages 11-16+ years) with ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder- with or without hyperactivity). Our approach to this educational game is based on executive skills function and behavioral therapy strategies. Players study specs on available car parts and characters, plan which parts and characters to select, compete for car parts, build and race their car (players control acceleration and braking). Players compete against 3 computer-run non-player characters (NPC) teams while sticking to their time limit and avoiding distractors like our Trickster. Skill is shown on the dashboard, which gives scores determined with propriety methods for calculating player responses for attention, strategy, recall and time per game plus allows the player to compare their recent score to their average score. [Note: Game will play on iPhone but is not optimized for a 4" diagonal screen size.].


How Can This Game Help You?

Ever sit in chemistry class and...is that your phone?...wish you could just...hey, the garbage guy is dropping half the stuff on the ground...stay focused on the discussion about Bohr's model?

Just like learning to hit a baseball or play the piano, paying attention and being organized improves with practice.

STRATEGY: Just like preparing for tests in school, you'll prepare for your mission. Each character and vehicle part (engine, frame, cockpit, tires and weapon) has detailed specs. Learn about them and choose which you think will build the fastest car. But, this is no big box store. You'll be battling other NPC teams to get what you want in our garage.

FOCUS/ATTENTION: Unique to our game. Just like distractions occur in school or home, our Trickster will try to distract  you with loud noises like drumming or throwing water balloons, but you know better. You won't deviate from your mission of selecting the best parts and building your car. Do you have it in you to defy him?

PRESSURE: Every part of the game is timed. This is no walk in the park. Can you complete your mission before time runs out?

WIN THE RACE: This is the end game. Race against competing NPC teams.  Hope you've honed your driving skills because the clock doesn't stop ticking when you wipe out. Get your mechanic off his duff to fix you up. Hope you've warmed up your weapon too because if your opponents hit you, you're only as good as your armor. Once you're down no one can help you.  

DASHBOARD: When you ace the race, points rain down on you in a golden haze. The dashboard gives you your score and more. You get a full breakdown of where you did well (such as an attention score or strategy score) and where you were more of- meh- so next time you can dominate. Compare new scores to your average scores to see progress over time.

TOOLS & RESOURCES VIDEO: With the game we offer a short video to help parents and players better understand the benefits and goals of the game.



What Our Game Isn't:

This Game is Not a Medical Treatment


This is an educational game intended to teach skills, not a medical treatment. It is not intended as a substitute for medically prescribed therapies. Do not stop or alter medically prescribed treatments without consulting your physician.

How Much of the Game Has Been Built?

We've completed one-third of the game. We can afford to complete the next third, which is underway with completion expected in a couple of months. We're really excited about how much fun it is and can't wait to complete the final race portion of the game.

How to Pledge

Click on desired perk. You will be taken to PayPal where you can pledge with a credit card, debit card or with a PayPal account. You pay nothing unless we raise the full amount.

What Do Pledgers Receive?


Pledgers will receive the rewards they signed up for plus our undying thanks and good karma for your support and encouragement! Pledgers will also have an opportunity to be part of our community of people who believe learning and education is part of their ADHD fighting toolbox. If we don't raise our full amount of $45,000, pledgers pay nothing and no perks are distributed.

Where Will Your Money Go?

Complete the race portion of the game as described (the final portion of the game)

  • Improve the game play, music and artwork on the existing game

We believe in hiring and supporting women programmers.

  • About 80% of funds pay for programmers and 10% pays for artists.(We collaborate with all-women's Mount Holyoke College Department of Computer Science).
  • About 10% of funds pays for the bare bones costs for support (like software, shipping and handling, administrative help, and fees associated with the campaign).


Our Team

AdapTac was selected as a 2013 Tech Company to Watch (Connecticut Innovations).

CEO/Founder: Candice M. Hughes, PhD, MBA, Leading my third venture & neuroscientist

PROGRAMMER: Rey Samonte (games for Xbox, Sony & mobile games)

ARTISTS: George Berger (Nickelodeon, MTV) and Scott Butler (Sony, Argonaut Games)

MOUNT HOLYOKE COLLEGE COLLABORATION: Lisa Ballesteros, PhD, Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science

CLINICAL AND BEHAVORIAL CONSULTANT: Francine Baffa, PhD, BCDA-D

STUDENT GAME DESIGNER:  Jason Wiles

CORPORATE ADVISOR: Chuck Allen, Director of Technology Ops, COD, Black Ops, Activision (correction from video)

What Devices Will the Game Work on?


The recommended devices are iPad tablets, either full (second generation or later) or mini, (first generation or mini with retina). The game will play on iPhones (iOS7), however, the fonts and images will be small and game play more cramped on a 4" diagonal screen size.


How Will the Game be Delivered?

To get the game onto your iPad, we will load the game into the iTunes store then buy it and send it to you as a gift. We will contact you with more information after the campaign closes about how to receive your gift game. (Unfortunately, we are not able to send you the game directly. This will result in 30% of the game purchase price being paid to Apple as a fee; however, we have organized the campaign to pay all necessary fees and still provide us with enough funds to complete the game.)

Spread the Word: Share Our Campaign

You can support our community by sharing our Indiegogo campaign link with friends and family whom you believe would want to join our community. Like us on Facebook and share our web site.

Potential Risks

Risks that might cause delays in completing the game include losing one of our key team members. If this should happen, we would search and locate someone with the needed skills as quickly as possible. However, should a key person leave the team, it could delay game completion.

While our game programmers and developers feel confident they can deliver the game, unforeseen changes in technology could delay the game development or cause us to change some component of the game. We feel this is highly unlikely. However, since we rely on software and platforms from other companies (such as Apple, Adobe, and others), this is a potential risk.
story_txt:
Game Developed by ADHD MomNeuroscientistFeatured in Mommy Minutes (CTNow)Being a mom who understands how hard it is living with ADHD, a neuroscientist, and a serial entrepreneur, I knew I had to find a way to help my family and other families living with ADHD. By understanding living with ADHD, I developed this game to benefit kids having trouble with attention and planning and connect learning with school-related actions. Beyond benefits though, if a game isn't fun what's the point? So our team of a PhD neuroscientist, a board certified behavioral analyst with PhD (autism/ADHD) and game developers built in an equal amount of fun, making the game as exciting as other games kids already play. The top comments from other moms when they learn of our game are, "It's about time!" and "I wish this game had been available when my child was younger."How else can you improve you child's attention and planning for $20? While our $20 perk lets you pre-purchase our game, other brain training games for ADHD cost $1,000 to $2000 plus fees of hundreds of dollars per hour since games can only be played in-office. While we are a tiny startup working hard to get our first product out to you, we believe we are startup with a conscience and a mission to make the world a better place. Read about us in Mommy Minutes CTNow. Buy your game perk today! Game only available here. We do not guarantee it will be available elsewhere at any other time. PayPal account not necessary to purchase game perks. Games anticipated to be delivered September 2014, beta testers receive game August 2014.An ADHD Skills Booster Game: What's The Game About?This project is an action/strategy single player racing video game iPad app designed to improve attention and planning skills in teens (suggested ages 11-16+ years) with ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder- with or without hyperactivity). Our approach to this educational game is based on executive skills function and behavioral therapy strategies. Players study specs on available car parts and characters, plan which parts and characters to select, compete for car parts, build and race their car (players control acceleration and braking). Players compete against 3 computer-run non-player characters (NPC) teams while sticking to their time limit and avoiding distractors like our Trickster. Skill is shown on the dashboard, which gives scores determined with propriety methods for calculating player responses for attention, strategy, recall and time per game plus allows the player to compare their recent score to their average score. [Note: Game will play on iPhone but is not optimized for a 4" diagonal screen size.]. How Can This Game Help You?Ever sit in chemistry class and...is that your phone?...wish you could just...hey, the garbage guy is dropping half the stuff on the ground...stay focused on the discussion about Bohr's model?Just like learning to hit a baseball or play the piano, paying attention and being organized improves with practice. STRATEGY: Just like preparing for tests in school, you'll prepare for your mission. Each character and vehicle part (engine, frame, cockpit, tires and weapon) has detailed specs. Learn about them and choose which you think will build the fastest car. But, this is no big box store. You'll be battling other NPC teams to get what you want in our garage.FOCUS/ATTENTION: Unique to our game. Just like distractions occur in school or home, our Trickster will try to distract  you with loud noises like drumming or throwing water balloons, but you know better. You won't deviate from your mission of selecting the best parts and building your car. Do you have it in you to defy him?PRESSURE: Every part of the game is timed. This is no walk in the park. Can you complete your mission before time runs out? WIN THE RACE: This is the end game. Race against competing NPC teams.  Hope you've honed your driving skills because the clock doesn't stop ticking when you wipe out. Get your mechanic off his duff to fix you up. Hope you've warmed up your weapon too because if your opponents hit you, you're only as good as your armor. Once you're down no one can help you.  DASHBOARD: When you ace the race, points rain down on you in a golden haze. The dashboard gives you your score and more. You get a full breakdown of where you did well (such as an attention score or strategy score) and where you were more of- meh- so next time you can dominate. Compare new scores to your average scores to see progress over time.TOOLS & RESOURCES VIDEO: With the game we offer a short video to help parents and players better understand the benefits and goals of the game.


What Our Game Isn't: 
This Game is Not a Medical Treatment
This is an educational game intended to teach skills, not a medical treatment. It is not intended as a substitute for medically prescribed therapies. Do not stop or alter medically prescribed treatments without consulting your physician.How Much of the Game Has Been Built?We've completed one-third of the game. We can afford to complete the next third, which is underway with completion expected in a couple of months. We're really excited about how much fun it is and can't wait to complete the final race portion of the game.How to PledgeClick on desired perk. You will be taken to PayPal where you can pledge with a credit card, debit card or with a PayPal account. You pay nothing unless we raise the full amount.What Do Pledgers Receive?Pledgers will receive the rewards they signed up for plus our undying thanks and good karma for your support and encouragement! Pledgers will also have an opportunity to be part of our community of people who believe learning and education is part of their ADHD fighting toolbox. If we don't raise our full amount of $45,000, pledgers pay nothing and no perks are distributed.Where Will Your Money Go?Complete the race portion of the game as described (the final portion of the game)Improve the game play, music and artwork on the existing gameWe believe in hiring and supporting women programmers.
About 80% of funds pay for programmers and 10% pays for artists.(We collaborate with all-women's Mount Holyoke College Department of Computer Science). 
About 10% of funds pays for the bare bones costs for support (like software, shipping and handling, administrative help, and fees associated with the campaign). 
Our TeamAdapTac was selected as a 2013 Tech Company to Watch (Connecticut Innovations).CEO/Founder: Candice M. Hughes, PhD, MBA, Leading my third venture & neuroscientistPROGRAMMER: Rey Samonte (games for Xbox, Sony & mobile games)ARTISTS: George Berger (Nickelodeon, MTV) and Scott Butler (Sony, Argonaut Games)MOUNT HOLYOKE COLLEGE COLLABORATION: Lisa Ballesteros, PhD, Associate Professor, Department of Computer ScienceCLINICAL AND BEHAVORIAL CONSULTANT: Francine Baffa, PhD, BCDA-DSTUDENT GAME DESIGNER:  Jason WilesCORPORATE ADVISOR: Chuck Allen, Director of Technology Ops, COD, Black Ops, Activision (correction from video)What Devices Will the Game Work on?The recommended devices are iPad tablets, either full (second generation or later) or mini, (first generation or mini with retina). The game will play on iPhones (iOS7), however, the fonts and images will be small and game play more cramped on a 4" diagonal screen size.
How Will the Game be Delivered?To get the game onto your iPad, we will load the game into the iTunes store then buy it and send it to you as a gift. We will contact you with more information after the campaign closes about how to receive your gift game. (Unfortunately, we are not able to send you the game directly. This will result in 30% of the game purchase price being paid to Apple as a fee; however, we have organized the campaign to pay all necessary fees and still provide us with enough funds to complete the game.)Spread the Word: Share Our CampaignYou can support our community by sharing our Indiegogo campaign link with friends and family whom you believe would want to join our community. Like us on Facebook and share our web site.
Potential
Risks
Risks that might cause delays in completing the game include losing one of our key team members. If this should happen, we would search and locate someone with the needed skills as quickly as possible. However, should a key person leave the team, it could delay game completion. While our game programmers and developers feel confident they can deliver the game, unforeseen changes in technology could delay the game development or cause us to change some component of the game. We feel this is highly unlikely. However, since we rely on software and platforms from other companies (such as Apple, Adobe, and others), this is a potential risk.

story:
THE GAME IS AVAILABLE TO ORDER

Even though our campaign was a bust, we still managed to raise the funds and start the production. The game is out and ready to be shipped worldwide. Just head down to http://bebry.com/ and fill out the order form ;)

Welcome to our playground!

Play is a very important part of anyone’s life. It provides a fun way to develop certain skills. We are not talking about the ones how to jump on mushrooms or how to beat up dragons in virtual environment. At least this game will not help you with those, but it will still be a lot of fun.

Virtual playground is very handy this way. It does not require actual material to be moved around, but it also limits the communication and takes away the human contact. Our idea was to create a fun board game with simple and easily operable environment that would still provide vast opportunities for different play tactics and styles while also allowing more participants than most common games, as friends usually come in packs. Click here to take our personality quiz and find out which of our animals has some similar ideas or characteristics with you :)

Deserted Animals has something for everyone. It’s a fun survival game with thrilling twists and turns. One of the great things about it is the different rule modification possibilities which you can use to tailor the game experience for various set-ups thus also enriching the game play. You can adjust the expected play session from as fast as 30 minutes to as long as 3 hours.

Click here to view full game contents and the Rulebook

This is a language free game set where only the Rulebook and Survival Guides (the things that you don't use after you know how to play) have text blocks. Currently it’s available to order these in Latvian, English and German. We are hoping to add more translations to the list. Below you can see some of the game contents:

Let’s play!

Deserted Animals has been a work in progress since January. It is finally complete and we are proud to present you with an opportunity to be among the first to get their hands on this game set. We decided to go with crowd funding for the public launch not only for the most obvious reason to help us raise the necessary funds for the initial production, but also to be in a close contact with the end users.

The raised funds will go to:

  • Start-up the Deserted Animals board game mass production.
  • Your gift production.
  • Shipping the goodies to your doorstep (or the respective post office).
  • (If 8000$ goal met) 5% of the total funding received will be donated back into indiegogo causes that benefit the animal community.

What you can receive for a contribution:

  • First 10 to contribute will receive a custom made virtual postcard from the Deserted Animals where we alter a picture provided by you to make something like this!
  • A mention in eternal gratitude on our web page.
  • Limited edition Deserted Animals game set. Signed by our team.
  • Deserted Animals T-shirt. Available in different sizes for both men and women with various designs to choose from. See the designs in close up.
  • A virtual monument of your magnificence. A golden statue of you being admired by Deserted Animals and everyone else visiting our web page. You will also be able to embed this content into other HTML based structures. There can only be one Idol.

The campaign will receive its funding only if the set goal of 5000 $ is met completely and all contributors will be rewarded with their game sets in 4 weeks + shipping time. Pick up in Riga/Kuldiga/Ventspils/Cesis includes a free handshake or a hug. For shipping to your address please add the respective fee to the region.

As this is a fixed funding campaign, you can only contribute through PayPal. Don't worry if you don't have an account - you don't need to have one. You can use your credit card to "Pay as a Guest" without signing in. More detailed explanation can be found here.

If this campaign manages to reach at least 8000 $, 5% of the total contributions received (after transaction and other fees) will be reinvested back into the indiegogo causes to support various campaigns that would benefit the animal community.

The Future!

We have created a new game design company called BebryGamez Ltd and supporting this campaign would not only provide you with countless hours of entertainment, it would also give us a boost to advance further our game development.

We are very passionate about this game and we know that there will be many others who feel the same way or at least close enough to get involved in our gaming community. In future we would like to host or support both local and international tournaments for Deserted Animals, but for that to happen - we need to build up this community first.

Other ways you can help!

If enough people will show their support, it will open more opportunities for this project to get recognized and reach its potential. Please click the Like, Tweet, G+ buttons or spread the word in any other way you can.

Your efforts will be not only greatly appreciated but also rewarded. If our campaign manages to reach its goal, we are going to draw 10 random Tweeters + our facebook page followers and send them a free copy of our game (if you already ordered a game set, you will have a nice gift for a friend). To take part in this giveaway compose a tweet and add #desertedanimals with a link to our campaign or simply Like our facebook page (or do both to double your chances, but you cannot win more than 1 set). Everyone is eligible to participate with free shipping worldwide included.

We also encourage you to leave us a comment with your suggestions and any questions regarding this campaign.

Your efforts will be not only greatly appreciated but also rewarded. If our campaign manages to reach its goal, we are going to draw 10 random Tweeters + our facebook page followers and send them a free copy of our game (if you already ordered a game set, you will have a nice gift for a friend). To take part in this giveaway compose a tweet and add #desertedanimals with a link to our campaign or simply Like our facebook page (or do both to double your chances, but you cannot win more than 1 set). Everyone is eligible to participate with free shipping worldwide included.

story:
The city is in danger! The doors came out of nowhere. Everything near them began to talk and almost everything tried to eat you. Solving this problem is no sweat: you only have to find the Main super door and blast it with a super megabomb. As a real hero, you'll have to handle it yourself. However, everything is sure to go haywire!

 

About the game:

  • An open clayworld: explore it and face different challenges;
  • Odd, talking characters: conversations with mushrooms, bugs, pumpkins etc. will be your common practice;
  • A destructible environment: with a huge hammer in hand, you'll have no chance to be bored;
  • Traps, secrets, bosses. There are no tedious places behind the doors;
  • Out of pop corn gun ammo? Search for cornfields. Looking for a healing compote? Pick some berries!
  • Everything is made from plasticine. Over 8000 photos and an enormous number of editing hours. The game is entirely hand made!

 

About the development:

I am an indie developer, who has been making this game for two years. For that I had arranged a small home studio for sculpting and photography:

Every game object has been shot from several sides:

The photos are edited to animate the objects and characters:

 

 

About the budget:

I'm working alone and my enthusiam is the only thing that keeps this project going. That's why I need your help to cover the expenses and finish the game.

 

About me:

   

Before this project I had about 10 years experience of working in various game development studios. But two years ago I decided to make my own game. Now I'm almost there.

 

 

About the timeline:

Now the game has 54 locations - it is about 10 hours of gameplay in story mode. Within a few months, I'll edit the game balance and do testing. After that, it will be closed beta test and the final correction. Thus, the game will be released on steam in late autumn 2016.

 

Another help:

Vote for the game on greenlight!
Support my campaign to follow my progress and share with your friends!
