story:
CUTTHROAT PASS - THE CARD GAME

The first offering from indie publisher Oz Kids Games, Cutthroat Pass is an exciting pirate-themed family card game in the tradition of Uno, Gubs and rat-a-tat CAT.

So What Makes This Game So Special?

Easy to learn and fun to play, Cutthroat Pass is the ideal game to play with family or friends. 

As a parent, primary school teacher and avid gamer I've had many opportunities to observe people's reactions during games and competitive situations. One thing I've noticed is that often a player's enjoyment of a game will lessen when it becomes obvious that they have no chance winning.

One of the key design elements when creating Cutthroat Pass was to make it so that during a round of play there was no indication of how well each player was doing. The winner of each round would always be a complete surprise and every player would feel right up until the last moment that they had a chance to win.

As you'll see from the video, the combination of chance and strategy allows players of all ages to compete on a level playing field.

On the night that footage was filmed the youngest player went on to win.

While essentially a collection game whereby players assemble a particular group of cards and relying to some extent upon chance, players are given a certain amount of control over their fate through the strategic use of action cards that can be used to either enhance their own hand or attack another player's.

To add tension to the game and ensure that players must remain focused not only on their own hand but on the actions of every other player, each round ends with a sudden and unexpected lunge for the pirate treasure. As with musical chairs there are always less Jewels than there are players and once one player completes their card collection and secures the first Jewel everyone else has an equal chance to snatch one before their opponents do, thus keeping the hope alive that even if you have a terrible hand you still may gain the treasure.

To join in the conversation about Cutthroat Pass - The Card Game, visit our thread at the Crowdfunding Forum.

The Pirate Crew

There are 5 pirate characters in Cutthroat Pass - The Card Game 

Captain,  First Mate,  Second Mate,  Lookout  &  Ship's Boy

As a thank you for your support we would like to give you, our backers the opportunity to create and choose these characters' proper names.

Will it be Captain Fancyfeather? Or Doofus McDougall, the Ship's Boy?

Every pledge tier comes with the opportunity to vote and several give you the power to submit a name to be voted upon.

The only restrictions are that all names submitted must be suitable for use by children and not infringe on the intellectual property and copyright of others. So no Jack Sparrows or Blackbeards please.

Otherwise let your imaginations run wild :)

 

The Action Cards

There are 4 Action Cards in the game. 

Cannons, Swordfight, Pillage & Cutthroat Pass

You may have noticed that the action cards in our video were not illustrated. This is because the design of these cards will be directly influenced by the outcome of this campaign.

If we reach target but do not exceed it those cards will have basic colour illustrations of the action they represent e.g The Cannons card will have an illustration of a cannon.

If we exceed our target and reach our $20,000 stretch goal those cards will feature full colur scenes of our characters in action e.g The Cannons card could have the Second Mate launching the cannon at an enemy ship.

 

What Are The Rules?

These rules can be enlarged by viewing them in our Gallery.

 What Do We Need To Make This Game A Reality?

To give this crowdfunding project the best chance of success we are only asking for the bare minimum needed to get the game manufactured and into your hands.

That said, we want you to have a high quality game so have chosen a highly talented and experienced illustrator and sourced manufacturers of shop quality games. Our intention is to create a game worthy of being sold in any game store in the world, that can hold its own against comparative games already on the market.

This is what we need:

What If We Get More Than We're Asking For?

At the moment Cutthroat Pass is still in the design stage. The beauty about not having moved on to manufacturing yet is that we have the opportunity to change and enhance the game in any way that we want.

If we reach our goal we will be creating for you a professional quality game with all the basic essentials needed for hours of swashbuckling fun. However, if we exceed our goal we'll make that game even better in every way we can think of, more detailed illustrations, score cards, more treasure and even your own miniature Captain action figure to play with.  

 

How Can You Get Involved?

Pledge

Even a $1 pledge will help us get closer to achieving our goal.

Share

Let your networks know about us via Facebook, email and Twitter.

Print a copy of the Flyer in our Gallery and put it up in your local game store or the lunchroom at work.

After pledging, sharing is the most important thing you can do. The more pleople who pledge the more likely we will reach our goal and everyone can get their rewards.

Contribute

When the time comes to vote for your favourite pirate names make sure you submit your vote.

If you're a creative person choose a reward tier where you can be creatively involved. Create a name for a pirate that everyone can vote upon.

Or, if you're very generous and really love your cat, choose the one and only Captain pledge and have your feline friend become the Ship's Cat.

 

Thanks so much for checking out our campaign. We look forward to getting Cutthroat Pass off the design table and into your hands soon.

When the time comes to vote for your favourite pirate names make sure you submit your vote.
If you're a creative person choose a reward tier where you can be creatively involved. Create a name for a pirate that everyone can vote upon.
Or, if you're very generous and really love your cat, choose the one and only Captain pledge and have your feline friend become the Ship's Cat.
 
Thanks so much for checking out our campaign. We look forward to getting Cutthroat Pass off the design table and into your hands soon.

story:
What do you get out of it?

The joy of doing something good, of course!

Nah, I'm just messing with you! You get awesome stuff!

Postcards!

I'm not going to lie - I'm not the best artist who has ever lived. Still, everyone over the $25 level will get to choose a postcard. I'm going to put a personal touch on them, too! If you get the earlybird $25 postcard I'll even draw a cartoon character based on your MMO character!

Tombstones!

There are a couple of levels where you can get a custom 3D printed tombstone for your character. At higher levels these can be made of steel!

Live Funeral Ceremonies!

You better sit down for this - I did the voice acting for BOTH characters in the video above! I know... Shocker, right? Anyway, using the upcoming FaceRig technology (funded right here on IndieGoGo!) I will perform a live funeral for your character!

Watch this tech demo for FaceRig and then just try to tell me you don't think it would be awesome to have a dragon send your character into the great server in the cloud. I dare you.

Note: You don't get a copy of FaceRig, just a live funeral ceremony led by me as a FaceRig character. =)

The days of just dropping another quarter into the machine and getting three extra lives are long gone. Every day, millions of us meet, play, talk and become friends in vast virtual worlds.

Massively Multiplayer Online Games are our homes away from home, a vacation spot that we can visit for as little as a few minutes or for hours on end whenever we want. It allows us to expand our imaginations, relax and bond with people from around the world.

Each of us does this through a single point of contact - our characters.

Game players across the globe put a lot of time and effort into developing their in-game identities. Whether it's a custom skin in Minecraft or tweaking every little setting in the character editor for an MMO, we love putting a part of ourselves into each game we play.

Character creation is only the beginning, though. Once we enter our games, we quest for not just the best equipment, but for equipment that suits our character and our personality. Each character we create is an extension of us - and some have deeper personal connections than others.

Eventually our characters will pass from our lives in one way or another. Either the game will shut down, we'll move on to another game, or we'll find ourselves in a different phase of our life.

When a game shuts down thousands of players can have their characters deleted. When you quit a game your character stays behind on the developer's server.

That's where charTOMB.com comes in. It's a final resting place for your character. It's a place where you can upload screenshots and links to videos, post a eulogy, and even have a live funeral if you want.

My goal is to allow people to have a rich and immersive environment in which to explore and see other people's characters, to reflect on their digital lives.

There will also be celebrity graves for famous game characters such as Aerith, Gray Fox, even our beloved Companion Cube. These will be places where we can post and share fan art and links to the characters that have touched our lives. 

And last, but certainly not least, will be the graves that mark the passing of friends we knew from games who passed in real life. When I first heard the story of Sean Smith (AKA Vile rat) it really moved me. Here was an avid member of the EVE Online community, a diplomat in both real life and, to some degree in the game. In an interconnected age, we may not all be able to travel to attend the funerals of online friends who have passed on. That's another reason why I feel there is a need for something like this.

charTomb and Charity.

Games can be powerful emotional experiences - and they can be a real force for good in the world. I have long been inspired by Child's Play, Extra Life, the Humble Indie Bundles, the Able Gamers Foundation and others. These are gamers who realize that having fun and having an impact aren't mutually exclusive.

That's why I want to make sure that I work closely with charities like these to allow people to use their character's death as a positive force in the world.

Why I'm the person to build this, and why I need your help.

I have worked in the digital media industry for a long time. I've built games, websites, apps, and even have a couple of awards to show for it. But none of that matters - what matters is that I am passionate about this project and want to see it become everything it can be.

Where is the money going?

The graveyard is hungry for 3D art - and I want to feed it until it explodes. With plans for Day / Night cycles, different environments, and a variety of customization options for both tombstones and mausoleums, the art alone is going to chew up a big part of the budget.

Producing the soundtrack will also consume some of the campaign funds, of course. Death and music go hand in bony hand.

Hosting and security will also be a big part of the project. Regular and plenty of pre-paid hosting time will make sure that once your digital loved ones are laid to rest they won't be eaten by bugs (server bugs, that is).

Timeline and Stretch goals.

I have set the deadline for this campaign to be 42 days (the meaning of life!) long.

During the course of the campaign I will be making my final selection for the following roles on the team:

  • 3D Artist
  • Musician

Of course, as we near the middle of the campaign if it seems like there may be a need for some stretch goals, I have a few doozies planned. =)

I have set the deadline for this campaign to be 42 days (the meaning of life!) long.

story:
The Darius Studio was founded in early 2013 in Kiev. On the basis of their project. Our work we are developing a mobile game of the "The Different Ones", and doing that with a great responsibility to this day.


                                What We Need 

We need money to complete work on the brand-book, design registration, web resource, online advertising, brand building, preparation for negotiations with the investor.

                                    

    The plot is based on the theories and dogmas of classical occult. Used the idea of ​​dividing the universe by 14 planes (parallel realities) with its unusual structure and relationship.

    Game «The Different Ones» tells the story of the second and third plane (and our Astral). Where borders have been destroyed, and that will lead to an imbalance and house in a complex system of relationships planes. In the story sharply raises questions of ethics and morality in our society. Consequence of human desires, vices and lust for power will become an irreversible process terroformation.

    The confrontation of religion, technology, okkulti- all of these aspects of human history will be challenged in the plot, forcing the player to go deep in thought about the values ​​of our society. 

    All the events of the plot will take place in real places (having supernatural or mysterious story), thus betraying the illusion of perspective possible future of mankind.

    The highlight of the plot will be a footnote to the real study of the supernatural in our history that the investigation will be a prerequisite for all that is happening in the game. 

    The main concept of the story is fiction, built on real facts and events of our history. This will create an atmosphere of an alternative future with real conditions in the past and the consequences in terms of the process of terraforming. 

    The main plot is divided into four visions, depending on the clan. Each clan has its own distinctive story feature, due to the history of these will have different options for completion.

    The main idea of ​​the clan: 

    1.Custodians of White Desert- eastern mythology, traditional alchemy, paganism. The basic idea - the dominance of religion and the occult technology. 

    2.The Last Stronghold for the Humanity - the Christian religion, the worship of saints. The basic idea - the rejection of paganism and technology. 

    3.Architects- technology, the introduction of mechanisms in the human body. The basic idea - the dominance of science over faith. 

    The term "terraforming" is set to change in climatic conditions in a condition suitable for the habitat of certain individuals. In our history, the process is due to the fusion of the planes that brings a change for our environment suitable for life of the inhabitants of the Astral plane. 

    The plot consists of 4 sections in which the total number of 16 chapters (quests and locations)



    Talk to your friends!

    Word of mouth is the key to success, don't forget to share this page on social medias / forums, that will help us a lot!

story:
Each Go Snag’em Bible game has:

 

  • ·      52 New Testament multiple choice questions
  • ·      52 Old Testament multiple choice questions
  • ·      Biblical references for each question to verify answers and to teach
  • ·      Instructions on how to play Go Snag’em on the back of the top card
  • ·      An option for your name or logo to be printed on the bottom of each card
  • ·      A high quality hard plastic case
  • ·      No diamonds, clubs, spades or hearts. Just 1-13
  • ·      Optional cards with suits if requested for orders over 2000 games

Players at different levels of knowledge can play together by trying to respond without the three possible answers for more of a challenge.

 

Retailers and distributors can test market the game as a possible new best seller.


            Go Snag’em Fundraising Game

Playing Cards

Go Snag’em The Bible - What do you know?

The Fundraising Game

Learn a little - help a lot! Family fun for three or more. Challenge your knowledge; challenge your friends. Play Go Fish with a twist. Quick to learn - fun to play!

 

How do you play Go Snag'em?

If you know how to play Go Fish, Go Snag'em is a fun variation on this popular game. If someone asks you whether or not you have a 2, for example, and you do, ask the question on the card. If they answer correctly, they snag the #2 card and make a new pair. If they are incorrect, you snag their #2 card instead. If you want a real challenge, try to answer without the three possible answers! It’s easy to learn, a lot of fun to play and the more often you play the better you will be.

 

 

How could we use Go Snag'em in the church?

Aside from your members wanting their own cards to play at home, Go Snag'em can be a fun way for the kids to learn more about the Bible. Each question has a reference printed at the bottom that can be used to discover where that particular question came from. You may want to pick up a few decks for your Sunday school class or consider using Go Snag'em cards as a fundraiser. They make the perfect fall fundraiser and can be sold as a Christmas gift! If 200 students were given 5 games each to sell, that would raise $10,000.You will make as much or more money selling your cards as selling chocolates, and you may even get people opening their Bibles!

Are other versions of Go Snag'em available?

POLITICAL PARTIES for The United States and Canada



SPORTS personalities and the rules
RELIGIONS Easier and harder questions for different levels
 Go Snag'em can be developed on any subject. Choose a political party American or Canadian and we'll have two questions on each card. The top question will be one on the history and personalities of the party and the second question will be much harder because it will be a question on how your government actually works. A fun way to raise money for your party and inform your members about how their government works! Play often and you will eventually be know as the expert amoungst your friends!





Go Snag'em on sports? Choose your favorite. Once again two questions. The top question is on the personalities. stats and history of the sport. The second question is on the rules of the game. How good a referee would you be?

More faiths. Judaism, Buddism and others. Depending on the request, we will work with the interested parties to come up with a Go Snag'em game that fits their needs. Fundraising is important for all groups and if you can teach your members as they play a fun easy to play game, everyone benefits!

story:
Where It All Began

         Hi gamers my name is Richard.  Let me tell you a bit about myself, most of my adult life I have been in the IT service industry.  About 2 years ago a coworker and I opened a small IT Consulting firm and have been growing it ever since, but what I love is gaming. 

         The first time I got introduced to gaming was in 1987, I was 5 at the time, on a visit to my next door neighbor’s house.  I walked into the living room and there it was an Atari 2600.  I was instantly hooked on Frogger and Pitfall.  Since then I have owned and gamed on most major home consoles and the PC.  I currently own the 3DS XL, PS4, and XBOX One along with a gaming PC I upgrade every two years or so.  As you can see I don’t believe in one platform being superior to another, I game for the experiences no matter what platform they are on.


The Deal

         gBuds will be a member’s only adult PC gaming community based in the US.  Have you ever logged into a Minecraft server where you built your base just to find out somebody came in and destroyed it for no reason?  Ever played Space Engineers and have somebody crash their ship into your base just to ruin your day?  How about playing a shooter where they repeatedly kill you at spawn?  I envision a place where gamers can come together to game, without the more negative aspects that plague gaming and the internet as a whole. 


Why become a member?

·  An exclusive member’s only forum with a code of conduct written with input from the community.  If you are found breaking one of the rules there will be penalties based on a 3 strike system.  On the third strike you will be banned from posting on the forums but will be able to access the servers.  I think this is missing in today’s gaming to forester that sense of community social media just doesn't cut it.

·  Access to private servers for all their favorite games.  Some example include:

         7 Days to Die         

          ARMA 3 

         Battlefield Hardline

         Chivalry: Medieval Warfare

         Counter-Strike: Global Offensive

         DayZ

         Farming Simulator 2015

         Minecraft

         Reign of Kings

         Rust

         Space Engineers

         Star Made

         Starbound

         Team Fortress 2

         Terraria

·  Live admins to keep an eye on the servers and the forums.  In the beginning I will be the only admin, but I plan to add more as servers become available.

·  Members will be able to request servers for any games.  As long as the average monthly usage is 75% of the server’s capacity (for example a 32 slot server should have a daily average of 24 players) the server will be on going.

·  All members will have input into how the servers are ran (map rotation, game modes, mods, etc…) via polls in the member’s only forums.

·  A zero tolerance policy on Cheaters, Glitchers, Griefers, Hackers, Trolls.  If you are interfering with another member’s enjoyment you will be banned from our community and no refunds will be given.

·  This will be an adult gaming community so all members must be 18 and above.  If a member is found to be underage they will be banned from our community and no refunds will be given.

·  We will locate the game servers as close to our members as possible to minimize lag.  For example if enough members playing one game are located in a certain location we will place a server at a nearby data center.

· There will be no advertising in the members section of the website.

·  There will only be a one membership level so all members will have the same status.


If You Contribute I Will Build It

·  The biggest chunk at 35% will go towards the game servers themselves.  This will allow me to lease about 55 enterprise class servers and the hosting that goes with them.  These will very strong servers with at least 12 Cores & 12GB of RAM to minimize any lag.

·  The next 30% will be for advertising.  This will cover the cost of creating the ads and having them featured on popular gaming sites to grow our member base.

·  At 25% we have the costs associated with the website.  This includes the domain, design, registration, emerchant fees, and so on.  This will provide the community with a kick ass website and forums.

·  The last 10% will go towards the credit card processing fees and Indiegogo’s cut.  Not much to say about this one.


Bonus Level  

         All Harbingers, Precursors, Vanguards, & Champions will also receive the following T-shirt as thanks for your support.  On the back of the T-shirt it will have your gamertag.


Future Quests

        Once the service is flowing smoothly and we have a good amount of members, I will work on providing more benefits for our members.  Below are some of the ideas.

· Support with mods to join our servers.

· Discounts on games & hardware for members.

· Meet & play with our admins on Twitch streams.


Challenges

         I see two major challenges in growing the community.  The first is to generate a creative, effective, and aggressive marketing campaign to grow the community.  The second is to balance that growth with enough admins to efficiently manage the servers.

         I plan to overcome the marketing challenge by working with the best local talent to produce some amazing web ads.  The second challenge will be a bit of a trial and error scenario.  Through time we will find right amount of servers one admin can manage without letting anything fall by the cracks.  As more servers go online we will hire more admins to keep up with demand.


Other Ways to Help

           If you are not able to help at this time don’t worry, you can always contribute by becoming a social media champion and spreading the word on popular gaming & social media sites.


Bottom Line

         With gBuds I am trying to create an adult only PC gaming community that will foster great coop and competitive gaming experiences without cheaters, glitchers, griefers, hackers, trolls… etc.  With your help I can build this community where we can all enjoy gaming as it was meant to be.

         DayZ
         Farming Simulator 2015
         Minecraft
         Reign of Kings
         Rust
         Space Engineers
         Star Made
         Starbound
         Team Fortress 2
         Terraria
· 
Live admins to keep an eye on the servers and
the forums.  In the beginning I will be
the only admin, but I plan to add more as servers become available.
· 
Members will be able to request servers for any
games.  As long as the average monthly
usage is 75% of the server’s capacity (for example a 32 slot server should have
a daily average of 24 players) the server will be on going.
· 
All members will have input into how the servers
are ran (map rotation, game modes, mods, etc…) via polls in the member’s only
forums.
· 
A zero tolerance policy on Cheaters, Glitchers,
Griefers, Hackers, Trolls.  If you are
interfering with another member’s enjoyment you will be banned from our
community and no refunds will be given.
· 
This will be an adult gaming community so all
members must be 18 and above.  If a
member is found to be underage they will be banned from our community and no
refunds will be given.
· 
We will locate the game servers as close to our
members as possible to minimize lag.  For
example if enough members playing one game are located in a certain location we
will place a server at a nearby data center.· There will be no advertising in the members section of the website.
· 
There will only be a one membership level so all
members will have the same status.
If
You Contribute I Will Build It

· 
The biggest chunk at 35% will go towards the
game servers themselves.  This will allow
me to lease about 55 enterprise class servers and the hosting that goes with
them.  These will very strong servers
with at least 12 Cores & 12GB of RAM to minimize any lag.
· 
The next 30% will be for advertising.  This will cover the cost of creating the ads
and having them featured on popular gaming sites to grow our member base.
· 
At 25% we have the costs associated with the
website.  This includes the domain,
design, registration, emerchant fees, and so on.  This will provide the community with a kick
ass website and forums.
· 
The last 10% will go towards the credit card
processing fees and Indiegogo’s cut.  Not
much to say about this one.
Bonus Level           All Harbingers, Precursors, Vanguards, & Champions will also receive the following T-shirt as thanks for your support.  On the back of the T-shirt it will have your gamertag.


Future Quests

        Once the service is flowing smoothly and we have a good amount of members, I will work on providing more benefits for our members.  Below are some of the ideas.
· Support with mods to join our servers.
· Discounts on games & hardware for members.
· Meet & play with our admins on Twitch streams.


Challenges
         I see two major challenges in growing the community.  The first is to generate a creative, effective, and aggressive marketing campaign to grow the community.  The second is to balance that growth with enough admins to efficiently manage the servers.
         I plan to overcome the marketing challenge by working with the best local talent to produce some amazing web ads.  The second challenge will be a bit of a trial and error scenario.  Through time we will find right amount of servers one admin can manage without letting anything fall by the cracks.  As more servers go online we will hire more admins to keep up with demand.

Other Ways to Help
           If
you are not able to help at this time don’t worry, you can always contribute by becoming a social media champion and spreading the word on popular gaming & social media sites.Bottom Line         With gBuds I am trying to create an adult only PC gaming community that will foster great coop and competitive gaming experiences without cheaters, glitchers, griefers, hackers, trolls… etc.  With your help I can build this community where we can all enjoy gaming as it was meant to be.

story:
Set in a post-apocalyptic world, Decimation is a game that combines select elements of Real Time Strategy, 4X (explore, expand, exploit, and exterminate) and Role Playing Games into an immersive experience geared to challenge hardcore strategy gamers, yet accessible enough to be enjoyed by casual gamers as well.

It features: 

  • Base building
  • Open world exploration
  • Action-oriented vehicular combat
  • Tower defense
  • Resource management
  • Deep research mechanics
  • Combat unit customization

You are the leader of a community of survivors who make their home in a remote pre-war military installation. After the old world ended, your people have not ventured far beyond the protection afforded by the mountains surrounding the colony. Not much is known to you about what lies outside the walls of rock that you call home. One thing is certain: The isolation that spared your people from the worst of the cataclysm has become a curse. Technology that has long sustained the colony is giving in to the ravages of time. Food and water are running low.

To succeed, you will have to make good use of what the colony has on hand to brave the vast undiscovered wastes, seeking out resources and lost technology. The myriad denizens of the wasteland will challenge your claim to travel their territories. Succeeding on missions will allow you to obtain key pieces of technology that you need to research from a deep technology tree, bringing your colony out of subsistence and into mastery of the wastes.

Your tactical and strategic skills will be put the test as you make choices on what missions to undertake, which technology to pursue, how to customize your armaments and what command skills to develop. Good decisions in all of these areas will help assure that enemies do not breach the colony’s defenses and that your colony has all it needs to thrive. 

The explorable world map spans 400,000 square miles / 640,000 square kilometers (about twice the size of Texas). Aside from requiring in-game time, travelling through the game world will require fuel and supplies for your units and people. You will need to plan ahead. Choose your unit composition and  missions wisely. You do not want to find yourself stranded in the middle of a vast wasteland populated by raiding parties, maniacal warlords, hostile machines and mutated beasts, out of fuel, food and ammunition…

The main story arc will guide you through the game. Along the way, you can choose to go on a variety of side missions including trade runs, convoy escorts, scavenging for resources and technology, helping certain inhabitants of the wasteland to join your cause, or just good old search and destroy.

You never know who or what is lurking about and will certainly encounter groups, factions or creatures that will not take kindly to your actions. They will seek you out. It will only be a matter of time before they find your colony…

Fortunately, the military base has a few defensive emplacements and combat vehicles that the colony has managed to keep functional over the years. These machines have kept you and your people safe so far, but you can never have too much protection. 

The colony's defensive emplacements and units are customizable. You can dabble with different configurations. New upgrades can be unlocked through research or by acquiring new tech in the wasteland.

Before the war that devastated the planet, the colony was a secret military weapons testing facility. It has seen better days but the technology remains intact (more or less). The world you have to contend with is more treacherous than before, and whatever “advanced” technology the colony possesses may not be enough to deal with what’s out there.

Prior to your predecessor’s passing, you had some experience in combat. Now that you’re in charge, you will need to pick up new skills to succeed as colony steward.

As you gain experience, you can expand your effectiveness by assigning points to 19 unique Commander Skills. Not all of them can be mastered, so you should choose where you assign these points carefully. Being strong in some areas can compensate for weaknesses in other areas. Others skills you may find indispensable.

Commander Skills fall under three main categories:

1. Unit Skills influence the effectiveness of weapons used in combat.

2. Battlefield Skills influence the colony’s broader combat capabilities and heavily influences colony defense.

3. Colony Skills influence colony productivity and morale.

You will have 4 lieutenants/advisers that will help look out for your people. There will be situations where heeding their advice will be in the colony's best interests. In some cases, you might find that you should have trusted your gut instead.

In addition to the main plot, each adviser has a unique story which you can explore depending on the choices that you make, perhaps unlocking previously hidden technology or knowledge of the wasteland in the process.

At the beginning of the game, your colony will only have a few citizens. Each citizen represents the population of the colony that can be directed and are capable of working on various tasks. You can assign citizens to one of the following functional areas:

  • Engineering: Building, repairing and upgrading the colony’s Units, Structures, Equipment and Consumable items.
  • Research: Advancing technology that helps the colony be more efficient, more successful in defending against the environment, or more effective in exploration and combat. 
  • Reconnaissance: Scouting the areas of the game world and uncovering tactical information about wasteland locations and factions. 
  • Logistics: Collecting, moving and storing colony supplies and resources.
  • Combat: Manning defensive or offensive units/structures.

Each citizen that is assigned to one of these fields contributes to the completion of tasks associated to that particular field. As you build a stronger presence in the wasteland, the likelihood of newer citizens joining your cause increases.

How effective and efficient the citizens are will be affected by a variety of factors such as:

  • Food supply
  • Living conditions
  • The state of your main colony structures
  • Your leadership (Commander Skills)
  • Victory or defeat in battle

Fail to balance these aspects and your people will suffer performance penalties, leave the colony or die a gruesome death. Don’t let that happen! Rise to the challenge and lead your colony from decimation to being a force to shape the wasteland!

For more Decimation related content, please visit our website.

We set the game in a post-apocalyptic world. For us, and we hope for you, the grimness and severity of stories told in such a setting inspires and captures the imagination. We feel (and know) that the harsh and bizarre (and sometimes offbeat) places found in the best works of the genre are a perfect place to explore what it is to be human, and test long-held concepts of "humanity" under extreme conditions, both story and game-wise.

Some of our favorites in this genre are the the Fallout series of games, the Mad Max films and the Matrix Trilogy. We also draw inspiration from classic strategy games like the original UFO: Enemy Unknown, Sid Meier’s Alpha Centauri and Star Control 2. Decimation is also influenced by console games that we immensely enjoyed as kids: Konami’s Jackal (known as “Top Gunner” in North America) and SNK’s Great Tank (“Iron Tank” in  North America).

With Decimation, we set out to create a world that captures the same severity and evoke similar feelings as those found in works that have inspired us. In the end, we want to create a gaming experience that is both enjoyable and challenging and to have told a satisfying story as well.

The game started a few years ago as a personal project. In November 2012, I decided to work on the game full time. It has seen steady but slow development until more members of the team were drawn into the project. Progress started picking up as the rest of the team trickled in. They have been kind enough to contribute their time and skills to the game outside of their day jobs and without pay. Since then, we have accomplished much but there’s a lot more work ahead!

If you have taken the time to watch the video, you can see our potential and what inspired these guys to come on board. Decimation's game world needs to be further populated. The particle system and animation needs to be improved in several places. We have completed about 40% of the planned player, enemy, structural and environmental art assets and models, leaving about 60% yet to create.  The music and ambient sounds needs scoring and mastering. We are also in the process of overhauling the HUD and in-game menus. Several major and minor (but important) gameplay features remain to be implemented. We are currently somewhere between First Playable and very Early Alpha stage.

I cannot question the team’s passion for the project, as they have been pouring in the volunteer hours to develop the game outside of their primary jobs. The reality though, is that without paid positions, project completion will not be a speedy proposition. People need to prioritize endeavors that respect the value of their skills and expertise. 

Your contribution will allow us to:

  • Transition key members of the team to full-time paid positions, and compensate part time and contract staff, thereby accelerating progress. 

  • Score the game's soundtrack. 
  • Purchase much needed equipment upgrades to accelerate development and acquire certain software packages that will enhance the game.
  • Ensure that day-to-day office requirements (general overhead, power, internet) are taken care of. Keep the power on! 


Based on the scope of the project (and with your help to fund it), we plan to to go Beta in about eight months and to release the polished/full game a year from funding (November 2014). This is a carefully deliberated timeline that provides a little allowance for the unforeseen. We would love to get the game to you as quickly as possible without sacrificing quality.

We have chosen fixed funding because we cannot meet the commitment of completing and polishing the game in a year with less. The funding goal is the absolute minimum we will need to bring you a quality game and fulfill the perks for the campaign.

Help us spread the word! Tell your friends and personal network about the project to help us reach more potential players and funders. Bringing in more supporters will go a long way towards making Decimation a reality.

As gamers ourselves, we value the community that forms around a game. And your referrals are part of that. Which is why we are running a humble, but important, Referral Contest. We will reward the top 5 people (or organizations) that have spread the word and directed people to the Decimation campaign page. 

At the end of the campaign (if our initial funding goal is reached), the five people who direct the most traffic to our campaign page will receive the "Road Warrior" perk, our heartfelt gratitude in the form of a personalized thank you letter from the team, and the title “Networking Contributor” in the game's credits.

Moreover, the individual/organization who raises the highest amount of funds for the campaign (calculated as: your referrals' contributions plus your own contribution) will be given the distinct opportunity to design the colony's military emblem. The emblem is colony's link to its military roots and the symbol of its persistence in the wasteland. It will be used and displayed throughout the game: In the opening sequence and on colony structures & units. It will also be printed at the back of the Decimation campaign shirt. This winner will also get the "Road Warrior" perk, our heartfelt gratitude in the form of a personalized thank you letter from the team, and the title “Creative Contributor” in the credits.


If you copy the campaign URL (found in the "Share This Campaign" box below the pitch video) and paste it into an email or social media update OR if you click on one of the share tools also found in the box below our pitch video (Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, Embed, Email), that will allow you to share the campaign and direct people to the Decimation's Indiegogo campaign page.

As long as you are logged into your Indiegogo account when you use the share tools, sharing will allow us to keep track of how many people are taken to the campaign page via the sharing option(s) that you have used and will be attributed to your Indiegogo account. 

If people you've referred end up contributing to the campaign, your Indiegogo account will be recognized as bringing in that amount to the campaign as well.

If you do not have an Indiegogo account, you can still have your referrals tracked once you've contributed to the campaign. You will be presented with a special URL immediately after completing your contribution that you can copy and share with your network. We would recommend that you create an Indiegogo account prior to sharing though, as it is not that difficult and would ensure that your referral and contribution count is attributed to a single account.

We'd like to thank you for reviewing our campaign page, and for your interest in being part of Decimation's success!

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

Q: Any chance for a Linux (or Mac) version of the game?

A: This campaign in particular is to raise funds to complete Decimation's PC version. Back when the project started we decided to use the XNA 4.0 framework and have made a lot of headway on the game's custom engine since then. Prior to launching the campaign, we were considering 2 options to be able to cover Mac and Linux versions of the game. One involved obtaining a license for Unity3D or to port the existing game into Monogame for multi-platform development. Both options would have increased our budget by a significant amount, and would require an extra programmer if we still want to meet our completion deadline of 1 year. If you're a Mac or Linux user, don't count us out yet though. We definitely don't want to close our doors to you, and if there is significant interest in the current project, we can add Mac and Linux coverage as a stretch goal.

story:
Update : May 29th

Added some concept art of our Town Hub in the Updates !

UPDATE : MAY 22nd

Guardian class implementation and Graphic System.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=180gIcUVPUY

UPDATE : MAY 19th

Had an interview with EPICBREW.NET , check it out here : http://epicbrew.net/2012/05/17/interview-with-hero-arena-developer-about-development-funding/

Hero-Arena is an Action RPG game developed using the Unity3d engine that will be FREE TO PLAY and available for both PC and MAC using your browser or through download with optional iOS and Android releases in the future. It is played from an over the shoulder third person perspective where you control 1 of several characters you can customize in arenas, defeating monsters either alone in single player or mode, or with a friend in multiplayer.

Also competitive PVP modes and leaderboards will keep the longevity of this game going ! The game will have ever expanding content to match holiday events and have an open content system that will contiously be updated !

  • Not just a point and click game. Use your dodging, blocking and attacking in different patterns to make them effective
  • Level up and learn new abilities, unlock classes and arenas
  • Singleplayer and Multiplayer online CooP and PVP modes from any pc or mac computer with a browser !

Hero-Arena has been in development for a long time. We wanted a working prototype with some our features ingame before we decided to bring it public to indiegogo so that we would only start it when we need funding. The money will be going towards : 

  • Licensing the approperiate engines and technology we need
  • Creation of assets and development of the game
  • Implementation of local and online features
  • Multiplayer Development and Hosting
  • Higher Quality Models , Environments and Details
  • If our goal reaches beyond the 10k mark we will also include a mini-game mode to play against friends online while earning gold and experience !
 
Team Dark Side Of The Pixel or DSOTP for short consists of a wide variety of talents from all across Canada ! We have 4 dedicated members and 3 part time members each with a specialized skill and trade.
 
The team leader and founder of Dark Side Of the Pixel  , David B.R , is a 2d/3d Generalist with a background working on over 10 indie games alone. Our Lead Animator and Lead Programmer both also have published titles under their belt and all our members are adults who are certified in their field of work !
 

Hero-Arena is all about customization. We want you to feel like you've got unlimited choices in customising and creating your characters just the way you want to be online.

  • 6+ Classes to choose from including Guardian, Magician, Assassin and the Reaper ! All classes have unique weapons and armor looks !
  • Earn gold and level up in the single player mode, then head online into the frantic multiplayer arenas to earn points, unlock new content, and defeat your friends !
  • Customize your character the way you want, without effecting your stats you can alter your look to perfection ! Skintone, Eyes, Hats and Clothing are all customizable  !
  • 3 Different arenas to battle monsters in , each with mini bosses and final bosses ! Unlockable arenas to come afterwards !
  • Play from any browser, anywhere, using the Unity3d plugin.

Weapons in the game are locked to their respective classes. For instance, the blood drenched REAPERS can use their SCYTHES to attack while the nimble ARCHERS can use their BOWS.

ARMOR SETS are also a big part of the game. Customizable from Head to Toe and unique armors available for different classes :

So, what happens if we make it over our budget ? We expand the game even further. Additional plans include having an entirely 3d mini-town / lobby system, minigames, forum character implementations and much much more. Every dollar goes towards expanding our game to be the greatest gaming online playing and social experience around !

Be sure to check out some of our videos of Hero-Arena as we were working on it publicly to see how the progress is - 

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLAE944320E9A8A932

We are delighted to have you supporting not just our game as a team, but our game as a whole community. With your contributions and our development skills were bound to make Hero-Arena a name to be remembered all through the gaming world !

Added some concept art of our Town Hub in the Updates !

Guardian class implementation and Graphic System.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=180gIcUVPUY
UPDATE : MAY 19th
Had an interview with EPICBREW.NET , check it out here : http://epicbrew.net/2012/05/17/interview-with-hero-arena-developer-about-development-funding/


Hero-Arena is an Action RPG game developed using the Unity3d engine that will be FREE TO PLAY and available for both PC and MAC using your browser or through download with optional iOS and Android releases in the future. It is played from an over the shoulder third person perspective where you control 1 of several characters you can customize in arenas, defeating monsters either alone in single player or mode, or with a friend in multiplayer.
Also competitive PVP modes and leaderboards will keep the longevity of this game going ! The game will have ever expanding content to match holiday events and have an open content system that will contiously be updated !

Not just a point and click game. Use your dodging, blocking and attacking in different patterns to make them effective
Level up and learn new abilities, unlock classes and arenas
Singleplayer and Multiplayer online CooP and PVP modes from any pc or mac computer with a browser !




Hero-Arena has been in development for a long time. We wanted a working prototype with some our features ingame before we decided to bring it public to indiegogo so that we would only start it when we need funding. The money will be going towards : 

Licensing the approperiate engines and technology we need
Creation of assets and development of the game
Implementation of local and online features
Multiplayer Development and Hosting
Higher Quality Models , Environments and Details
If our goal reaches beyond the 10k mark we will also include a mini-game mode to play against friends online while earning gold and experience !

We are delighted to have you supporting not just our game as a team, but our game as a whole community. With your contributions and our development skills were bound to make Hero-Arena a name to be remembered all through the gaming world !

story:
The year is 2049.

Zack Hunter wakes up inside a pod, connected to wires and pins.
The pod opens and Hunter gets out. He looks at his hands and sees cold metal and circuitry. Slowly realizing what happened to him, he walks towards the terminal near his storage pod. The terminal shows a log and a profile of Hunter.
The log states that Hunter has been there for several months, connected to the machine. It shows data about an extraction process that failed.

Hunter drops to his knees and looks at his hands. Faint footsteps can be heard coming from the hallway. Someone is coming to collect him.

Control
Skyliner is a third person stealth game where you control the environment. You have access to every aspect of your environment; doors, lights, lasers, surveillance, turrets, androids, transporters, platforms and even entire rooms.
Use your power to alter your surroundings and reach your goal and to distract, trap or kill your enemies.

Lighting
A unique lighting system will allow you to dynamically control every light. The AI will use this system to determine visibility in real time. When you disable the lights in an area, you will be able to bypass your enemy as they stumble towards the nearest light source switch. Watch out, as any moving light, like transporter headlights or flashlights can still illuminate you and get you caught.

Artificial Intelligence
The foundation of every stealth game is a good AI system. Skyliner will have a complex AI that will react realistically to every situation. Your enemies will use teamwork to lock you in and take you out.
They will react to your presence when they see or hear you and will react differently to every disturbance. When locked inside a room, they will try to get out by searching for a door lock or call for backup when completely locked in.

Know your Enemy
Skyliner will have diverse and dangerous enemies, all with different reactions to the player and ways of handling a situation. Besides humanoid enemies, you will also encounter androids that are faster and stronger. Some androids will be able to go through tight spaces such as air ducts.

Traps
Besides regular enemies, you will also encounter traps such as lasers, mines, surveillance and moving platforms. Use your power to use these to your advantage.

Sound
The AI will react to every sound they hear. They investigate strange footsteps and will search the area when hearing gunshots.
Sounds will overlap in Skyliner, meaning you can run past a machine that is humming loudly. Strategic use of this system allows you to control a speaker and make it emit a sound to either distract an enemy or to drown out your footsteps.

Combat
You will be able to defend yourself against enemies by using your only weapon, the Striker 7.
The Striker 7 will be completely customizable in functionality and design. You can place scopes and silencers on it, extended magazines and more.
Because magazines for the Striker 7 will be scarce, you need to preserve ammo as much as possible. Be as accurate as you can.

You can also take out unsuspecting enemies by sneaking up on them and breaking their neck. When the enemy has noticed you, you will not be able to perform any grabs.

Hunter cannot take much damage, so try to avoid combat.

Story Driven
Skyliner is story driven, non-linear game.
Depending on your actions the story will change and will lead to multiple different endings.
The levels will be open with multiple ways to go through, some paths more dangerous and rewarding than others.


About me
My name is Peter Verstappen and I'm the sole developer of Skyliner.

Skyliner is an ambitious project that I started working on around late 2012.
I wanted to create a 3D stealth game that was not combat oriented and would encourage players to stay out of sight and try to distract and outsmart the enemy with a unique gameplay element, instead of shooting their way out. Development is well underway with the concept and the basics of gameplay all ready.

Platforms
The game is being developed for Windows, Linux and Mac and will be available DRM free as a standalone download.
A Steam release is also planned after a succesful campaign and Greenlight process.

Questions?
If you have any questions, feel free to post a comment. I will be updating the campaign as much as possible to keep you informed about the progress.



I've started this Indiegogo campaign to fund for audio and visual equipment and software so I can improve and maintain the level of quality I'm aiming for.

Goals and Expenses
With the minimum goal I will be able to:
- Continue working on the project
- Acquire the license for the engine
- Buy equipment and software for audio recording
- Buy equipment and software for modeling and coding
- Buy equipment and software for model textures
- Buy equipment and software for professional video creation
- Work full time on the project, paying for rent and personal expenses.
- Create an official website
- Have a small reserve to make sure development can be finished

Interested but unable to fund?
There are other ways you can support Skyliner. Tell your friends or create a message on twitter or facebook to get the word out on Skyliner.
You can also follow the twitter and youtube of Skyliner to stay updated.


There will be several perks available during the campaign, all with goodies only available during the campaign, including access to the prototype, alpha and beta versions and an exclusive media package.
All early versions will be released DRM free as standalone downloads.

Depending on the success of the campaign, a web version could be launched so you can play it on any machine without downloading.

Let's get to the goodies, what do you get when you fund?
There are three editions; Basic, Extended and Complete Edition.
All editions will have limited early versions which will have the same content but a lower price for the early birds!
Every edition will have the full game, which you will get on release.

When the game is Greenlit on Steam, you will also get a Steam key to activate your copy on Steam.

Basic Edition
You will receive Skyliner on release and access to the prototype after the campaign.

Extended Edition
You will receive Skyliner on release, access to the prototype after the campaign, the Skyliner OST in FLAC or MP3 format and an exclusive media package featuring unreleased art, models, levels and a making of detailing the creation process and how the game evolved over time.

Complete Edition
You will receive Skyliner on release, access to the prototype after the campaign, the Skyliner OST in FLAC or MP3 format and an exclusive media package featuring unreleased art, models, levels and a making of detailing the creation process and how the game evolved over time.
You will also get access to every alpha and beta release which will feature levels exlusive to early access and content that might not end up in the final game.

When the campaign is over and the initial goal has been reached, all backers will get access to the prototype. The prototype will showcase the basics of gameplay and the direction and idea of the style and world of Skyliner.

story:
Project description


This is the first part of the project conceived as a trilogy. The plot tells us about the adventures of a young elf-girl, which since her childhood had been kept into slavery by people. The action takes place in a fantasy world that has inhabited by different races for centuries: orcs, dwarves, people, trolls and many others. The world is filled with magic and keeps a lot of mysteries and secrets that you will have to find with the main character together.

 

  • Large number of plot lines affecting the development of history
  • 3 different endings
  • An extraordinary original story
  • A new fantasy world
  • Many elaborate scenes and dialogues
     

 

or

 

 

Collected funds will use to

  1. Text processing. We are a young team and do not have a literate writer, so we will attract an editor to improve the text
  2. Publication of a comic book and printing of paper versions
  3. Advertising

 

Take a look at these stretch goals:

  1. $50K STRETCH GOAL -  More than 25 illustrations will be added!
  2. $90K STRETCH GOAL -  The variety will increase. 2 endings will be added!
  3. $130K STRETCH GOAL - All illustrations will be dynamic!

 

Team

We are a young team ofthree person which wishes to make own fantasy world

  1. Lobosova Svetlana is a painter
  2. Luginin Egor is a scenarist writes the main story 
  3. Kuroshev Ilya is a manager engaged in advertising and project support
